3.description: Got a bird tattoo was supposed to get a nose piercing only ended up with both didn't even have to make an appointment! Love it! Planning on getting my daughters initials soon! Can't wait!

1.description: Great job I love my new tattoo it's my second my first one they fixed for me all at a great price. Friendly service as well. Will recommend.

0.description: Yesterday I got a nose and a cartilage piercing from here and it was very professionally done! Everything was explained to me before being done, he made sure I liked the positioning of the piercing before and after getting it done, and everything was very sterile. For only $18 per piercing, I couldn't have chosen a better place. On top of all of that, the employees were really nice!

2.description: I have been to both locations. They are friendly, clean, and inexpensive. Ive gotten a few tattoos from different tattooists there and extremely happy. Will definitely continue going to them for my tattoos

5.description: Had a great experience here. I had my hesitations when outside but once through the door it was clean and bright and the entire staff was so friendly. I was a walk in and when they said it would be about ten minutes, they meant it. Chris did a tiny piece for me and he was very accommodating. He was very friendly and knowledgeable and more than willing to answer all of my questions and I had quite a few even though this was my fourth tattoo. By far the most reasonable pricing I've ever heard of.  Thanks so much and I will be back!

6.description: I came to the shop to get my lip piercing switched out. It turns out I was pierced with an 18g and most lip studs are at 16g. The piercer was very helpful and switched it out for me and gauged my piercing up. He did it very quickly and did a great job! Plus I got 3 lip studs for $10, which is such a great deal considering I spent $20 on one lip stud at a shop up north. Clean place, friendly artists!

7.description: Got my Nose Pierced there Last Month and LOVED IT! He gave me after care guide and also it was fast. ONLY 18$ Man What a deal... I will be going back

8.description: The service was decent. But the quality of work, sucked. I won't be going back. I got my belly button pierced here and the girl did it completely wrong. It got infected and I had to take it off, and I REALLY took care if it like I have all piercings. Very disappointing and a waste of my time and money. She was nice and all, but she needs more experience or something. I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND to anyone.

9.description: First off the service here is fantastic. I felt very comfortable and all went smoothly. The place is really clean and everything was opened in front of me so I knew it was all sterile! I went here for a clit piercing and the girl was very nice. She was very informative and told me all that I needed to know about how to keep it clean and what types of rings I could buy after it healed. She was very quick and almost painless! LoL I WILL BE GOING BACK SOON!

10.description: Decent place. Got my belly and nose pierced, cool experience. And they always cut you deals! No experience with tattoos tho. I've had no prroblems with my belly ring like I did from my first piercing at ****. I love my nose stud so yay!!!!!!!!

4.description: Best tattoo place I ever been to hands down. Everyone does a great job. Returning customer for now on.

1.description: Yummy!! It is a food truck on the roadside. Lots of people on the line. So we wanna to try and it is really delicious! Lots of meat inside! Juicy!

0.description: This place is the reason why I can't loose weigh. The food is awesome. And the portions are huge. I cater from the last year and all my friends would not stop bragging on how good their food is. Try it plZ

1.description: I've been here twice because my usual stylist was way too busy. I'm not really sure they take walk-ins but both times I was admitted immediately.  Javier cut my hair both time using scissors only (my request) and I have not been dissatisfied yet!  After going to the same girl for over 10 years, I might have found a new stylist!  They only charged me $10 not including tip, but probably just because my hairstyle is easy.  I'll be back for sure.

2.description: Usually my hair and my beauty is in Charge with Filly He is my Best Man! I love him, because he make me feel beautiful and leave my hair style so good, sexy, etc.Thank you guys!  prices are so good for what u get.

0.description: Love coming here to get my hair done. It's always comes out the way I want and they make sure to leave you looking beautiful! I've been coming here for years and will continue.

1.description: They dont cook food properly. They server uncooked cold gyros. They dont wash hands there. Place is an inferno, filled with smoke, inadequate air inside. I used to go here all the time, until I opened my eyes last night and have decided for my health, its wise to not catch anything thereI called the owner to report my food was bad. He refused to pay attention. He does not speak nor understand proper English.

0.description: grease pit food at it's finest.  everything you would expect from a neighborhood joint, like mother-in-laws, big baby's, and the combo Italian beef-sausage.  your heart will not thank you for eating here, but your belly will......
Typical Dollar Tree, but as usual, checkout is slow.

1.description: This KFC is the worst!!! Ever!!! I mean How do you run out of chicken, at KFC.  Its happened people, to me and my friends for a very long time. Every time I go it seems like they run out of tender or anything else I want to order. The worst part is you order in the drive thru and when you get to the window you have to repeat your order 7 time, not exaggerating." ohh, what kind of drink was that again, crisp or original?" "No, Grilled" "ok, a number one grilled, with what kinda drink?" Arrrrgh!!!

0.description: This review is for a 2012 November visit. Staff might have changed now. But that was the worst experience ever! There was a special for like a 10 piece with 4 biscuits and 1 large side. We don't eat biscuits so we decided to just buy a 10 piece with 2 large sides. The cashier thought it's would be "cheaper" to give me the special with an extra large side. But we said no to that offer because it was not cheaper because the special included the biscuits. So then we paid with credit card and when we got the receipt back, the cashier STILL ordered the special with an extra large side. Even though it's was only like $1.50 more, we explained that we did not want the biscuit meal and wanted to order separately. The manager or someone that was in charge went over to the cash register and handed me $1 and eagerly said that is more than we owe you. I told her that the difference is more than $1. The manager then went on and said NO, $1 is more than enough because it's PLUS TAX. Who charges tax on returns?!?!!? KFC is suppose to be giving back the tax that WE PAID. I' not sure how she got the job when she doesn't even know how to calculate simple math. No matter how we calculated on our phone and said the difference is more, she refused to re-order our order to see what the total was and still stick to her $1 is more than enough. So instead of arguing, we just left. Worst employees ever.

3.description: It doesn't seem like this place wants my business.I called on Wednesday morning to schedule an appointment to have my dryer looked at. I smelled a slight gas odor the day before, so I wanted to make sure it was safe to use or if it needed to be serviced. When I called, it sounded like I got a random cell phone number. The guy on the phone was very short and it seemed he wanted to hurry me off the call:Me: "I need to make an appointment to get my dryer serviced."Campos: "Ok, where you at?"Me: [address]Campos: "Ok, I come check it out."Me: "Wait, when are you coming?"Campos: "Right now."Me: "No, I'm not home now, can you come tomorrow?"Campos: "Ok, I come between noon - 1 o'clock."Me: "Tomorrow is good, but please be sure to come before 3 o'clock."Campos: "Ok, I come before 4."You get the idea. Needless to say, the jerk never showed up, but ironically the gas smell is gone and I don't think I needed him after all. Whatever, you don't want my money? I'll take it somewhere else.

1.description: Definitely the place to go to for fixing up your appliances. I had a problem with my washer then my dryer within 2 weeks of one another. It was nice to know that they came out, for a minimum cost and fixed up the appliances. I spent less than $100 for everything and I am so glad that I didn't just go buy new appliances. They also sell appliances that have been refurbished at thier store, but I like the fact that they come out, charge you very little and do the job. I HIGHLY recommend them.

2.description: I got to agree with Laura -- seems like this place doesn't like making money. Never showed up, and when called, gave excuses. Waste of time...

0.description: Excellent service. Muuuuy buen servicio. Very fast delivery!!! Thank you so much! Good guarantee!!!

4.description: Campos is our go too place for appliances. We have bought a washer dryer from them and a stove. Washer dryer we bought used and I flat out beat the hell out of them for years and they never had a problem. Recently bought a stove and there was a small electrical problem. Stove still under warranty. They came, fixed it and never even asked to see bill of sale to ensure still under warranty. We once had the guy come for what we thought was a prob with the washer and he showed us we had overstuffed the washer and didnt want to charge us for such a silly repair but we made him take $20.  GOOD GOOD PEOPLE. And for those who think this place is only for mexican families.. we are white middleclass and you can pay more with other people and not get HALF the quality or honorable people that you would from Campos.

1.description: The # for this business is incorrect or the it is no longer in business.

0.description: So glad we were able to find Mayra.  She was at the place where we originally had our embroidery work, but they closed and we thought we were out of luck.  Thank goodness I found her on Yelp.  We needed to have some hoodies done for our auto repair shop and decided to do one for our new puppy.  Mayra came a long way to our shop and picked up our things, did a BEAUTIFUL job on the embroidery and promptly returned.  Her work was so fantastic, that we are having her do more.  I would not hesitate to recommend her for fair pricing and real quality work.  I've put up a picture so you can see for yourself!  Thank you Mayra!  We will talk soon!!
excellent service!  friendly place  will open Jan 2015we used to be located 2862 w 38th street as Leo's hair salon and we've moved to a better and bigger location visit us...

58.description: Best Carnitas Tacos in town.  'Nuff said!

56.description: This counter-top eating taqueria has the best steak tacos on the south side and possibly in the Chicago-Metro area.  The meat is prepared and chopped in front of your eyes.  The smell of the cooked meat is just the beginning.  Once you bite into your first taco (it is impossible to eat only one) it makes you wonder if you ordered enough since they are so good.They serve tacos de carnitas and chile rellenos as well.  The tacos al pastor (pork) are ok.  It depends how you like them.  At Pacos Tacos, the pork is simmering in a pot until a "pork taco" aka taco al pastor order is placed.  It becomes a rather soggy taco.  The burritos and tortas are great.  However, ordering tacos allows you to eat more of their delicious carne asada.

29.description: This place looks like it was designed by preschoolers because it is very unappealing. The building looks like a bunch of red bricks being held together with mortar, which reminds me of preschoolers putting Lego blocks together. Now, this is not a negative review about the restaurant. Do not let the looks of the building fool you, Pacos Tacos is a very popular taco joint. Pacos Tacos is a hole in the wall restaurant, where people go to grab a quick breakfast, lunch or dinner. The moment you walk in the restaurant, you will notice how small it actually is and you'll start to question yourself whether it was a good idea or not that you came. The appearance may appear unappealing but trust me, the food will make up for the appearance. You will not see sets of table and chairs like an ordinary restaurant would have, but instead you will be greeted by a counter with about 8 wooden stools for you to eat your food. The place is usually quite packed because of the high demands for its delicious tacos. People always seem to be in a rush whenever they order from this place so do not expect anyone to be nice here. Everyone is here for the food, not to make friends. I've waited in line for about 10 minutes before I got my food. The food is made quickly because they had about three or four chefs working. You can tell that the chefs are skilled because they work quickly to get your food to you but at the same time, making sure the food is thoroughly cooked and seasoned right. I ordered two steak tacos, one al pastor (grilled pork), a lengua taco (beef tongue) and a large horchata (rice milk with cinnamon). I took it home to eat because the restaurant was really packed and it was starting to get very humid from all the steam and people standing next to each other.  The workers at Pacos Tacos are very generous about the portion sizes. I ordered all my tacos Mexican style (cilantro w/ onions) because that's the correct way to eat tacos. My steak tacos had so much meat on it, it looks like they put a whole cow on each taco. The meat was very tender, juicy and not dry like other Mexican restaurants. The onions had tons of flavor on it, enough to make a "wasabi" like feeling permeate my nose. I think I even started to tear up from the strong taste of the onions. This just tells you that the ingredients they use are very high quality and fresh. I finished the steak tacos quickly because they were so good, and so I could move onto my al pastor tacos. The al pastor tacos had a lot of juice in it, which explodes in flavor. The texture of the pork is so good, you could just let it sit on your tongue and it'll feel like it will never run out of flavor. The meat rips apart from each other easily, which is an indication that it is fresh. I quickly nom'd the tacos, while washing them down with the horchata. The horchata that I ordered was very large. It was a 32oz for just $3.50. You could taste the rich rice flavor and feel the gritty bits of cinnamon swimming in your mouth. While I was almost full from the large tacos I was served, I still had room for the beef tongue tacos. The beef tongue was really chewy and was bursting with flavor, like the al pastor. The salsa verde (green sauce) that was provided with the meal balances the flavor of the meat with tangy and spicy flavors. Overall, I enjoyed the meal and I would always go back for more. I will always be a customer of Pacos Tacos.

42.description: Let's get this clear. Nothing tastes as good as the tacos in Mexico. Having lived in Mexico for over 17 years, I have tried to find something "authentic" across the country. I would regularly give a Mexican restaurant 1-2 stars, but to be fair this is one of the most legit mexican tacos I've had in the USA. The onion, cilantro and lime were there. They had good flavorful sauces. I didn't like the fact that their tortillas were the ones from the supermarket I could tell. If they were made from scratch, this place would have taken it out of the ballpark. Meat wise, it is not too bad. Spices are right on although the pastor was slightly salty for me. Very friendly people working there and I would totally recommend it to anybody who knows about real Mexican food.

23.description: Tacos are good and stuffed with a lot of meat and all of your fixins.  Definitely worth the money for the amount of taco you get.  I did enjoy the tacos, but nothing beats Atotonilco on 47th.  I love the selection of chicharron they have up front.

47.description: The best streak tacos I have ever had thus far. The place is small and not much seating but the tacos are stupendous. Prices are decent and service is fast!

8.description: These tacos are amazing! The four stars are for their food, and how fast your food is ready. The only downside about this place is that the cashier is very very rude. Not only does she give mean looks, but she also makes faces when you ask her for something. She always gives out an bad attitude and doesn't seem to enjoy being there. The other cashiers are nice, but the older ladies are very rude.

31.description: Pacos Tacos is pretty darn delicious! The tacos aren't the cheapest I've seen, but the price isn't really so bad considering how much meat you get on these suckers!I had the lengua, barbacoa, chicharron and al pastor. Unfortunately, by the time I got home, I couldn't really figure out which was which, except the chicharron, which is the choice I highly recommend. It's soooo flavorful! The others weren't bad, but they didn't stand out in flavor enough to even know which was which. But they were filling and delicious, and about $12 for 4 tacos, not too bad I suppose. I've always seen this sign in my neighborhood, but never had the gumption to try it till recently, and I'm glad I did. I will be returning to get my taco on!

34.description: good mexican food for the price. not too expensive and has everything you would want for this style of cuisine. i liked it and would go back for a dine-in experience. good tacos yum. :D

16.description: This is my go to spot for steak tacos. Plenty of juicy meat on every taco.God I love this place!

13.description: Tacos are good and stuffed with a lot of meat and all of your fixins.  Definitely worth the money for the amount of taco you get.  I did enjoy the tacos, but nothing beats Atotonilco on 47th.  I love the selection of chicharron they have up front.

11.description: This place has the best carnitas ! My wife and I drive pretty far to pick food up to take to both our moms on weekend when go visit them .

39.description: FAST, CHEAP, CROWDED, FRESH.  Not fancy, family-style & damn was my belly full when I left!

37.description: 4.5 ***If you have been to one Paco's Tacos you have been to all.Same uncomplicated system, no frill nothing fancy. Simple places, good food on the cheapOn my last visit here I ordered 2 steak tacos and 1 chicharron de lonja taco (pork skin with meat) It was the best chicharron de lonja I have ever had. Fatty, meatty and so flavorful.If in the hood, must go to Paco's Tacos and order a taco de chicharron con carne.

0.description: BEST STEAK TACOS IN THE CITY. That's basically all you need to know.This is a very low key place. Don't expect any frills. Just order your tacos and shove them in your face after adding a good squeeze of their green sauce. Be warned they are HUGE. I always get two and have a hard time finishing the second but of course I force myself to because they're fucking delicious. I also add cheese because I am a white girl after all. Also, don't be afraid of the guy basically blocking the doorway playing his guitar. I guess he's a a staple at this place because he is always there, rain or shine.

38.description: One of the best place to get tacos in Chicago. Tacos are well seasoned and the meat are so tender. You can't go wrong ordering anything.

51.description: I love Pacos Tacos but the last two vists the carne asafa just dont taste the same taste more burnt. Will try them one more time and see what happens. If its bad again Im stick witht he PAcos Tacos on Pulaski never had a complaint on thier tacos.

27.description: I was next store getting a fade for my son and we got hungry. I got the chicken torta for my son and a steak and 3 lengua tacos with a side a grilled jalepenos for me. Amazing! The greatest thing about this place is the generous portion sizes. And the green sauce gets your mouth oh fiyah!

32.description: Best Taco joint in all of the Midwest! I was surprised to see a large Mexican community and love the authentic food that comes with it. The Birria tacos are amazing and there salsas are A+

54.description: I love taco's and I have tried many places before around the area and this place is by far the one of the best I have tried. By far the best proximity wise to me hands down though! My Mexican friends all swear by this place, so you know it is good. Last night, my friend and I decided to come here and give it a try because we been wanting to try this place for the longest, and we were both craving tacos. Upon arriving, the place is kinda older and hard to find, but the inside is surprisingly clean. They have a yellow sign on the outside, but for some reason it wasn't lit up at night, so we missed it the first time. Inside was packed to capacity, but the ordering to go line was only a few people. We've decided to order to go and we both ordered 2 steak tacos with the green sauce and a jarritos to complete our order. The total came out to $5.99 per person, which is really cheap for the best tacos.The workers are really nice and the people working there are so fast. They wrapped the tacos perfectly so when you eat it on the go, it isn't too messy. The steak was so perfectly cooked and season to perfection. Make sure you ask for the green sauce because this is the icing on the cake to an already perfect taco. I will definitely come back here in the future and my biggest regret was not ordering more!

48.description: One of my favorite taco spots, especially for steak. It's got it all- affordability, deliciousness, efficient service and a nice surprise-some pretty sweet art. I will note there is counter seating only.

44.description: Can't top it really. I eat a lot of authentic Mexican food at home, and this place is up there. Their tacos are amazing!!!!!! I've tried many other Mexican restaurants and always return to Pacos.

24.description: tacos tacos tacos.try the chicharon taco ,delicious.gets crowded around 6pm.wait for a seat to open up .worth it.

7.description: Love the food here, I always get the chicharron tacos and asada. Highly recommend this place for carnitas as well.

49.description: After reading much of reviews on Yelp, I tried this place out since it was a couple of blocks away from my house. The place reminds me of a classic fast food diner. I had high hopes for it. I ordered the carne asada tacos and the tacos al pastor. I was not impressed. The steak was slightly dry; but the spices were good. The pastor would be better if it was slightly crispy. The texture of it was similar to pulled pork. However, I  did enjoy the amount of meat in each taco. Will I ever go back? Not likely.

40.description: Good quality steak, don't go there for the decor or ambience. Just go for the food. Great quantity, quality and one of the best tacos joint in the city.

53.description: few of my friends swear that this was the best taco joint around the area.. so i decided to give it a try.. its a street parking, so make sure to feed the meters.. i went on a Saturday evening and it was packed in there.. i ordered 2 steak tacos and 1 chicken taco.. it comes with cilantro and onion..  the steak and chicken was cooked just right and seasoned well.. they don't cheap out on the meat either..they also got fried pork skin and other meat near the window that you can buy by the lb.. will be back soon to try it.

30.description: Just tried pacos taco with coworkers, I started out with the carne asada tacos, the amount of meat they put in these tacos is unreal, it is enough meat for four tacos and they are only $2.40! The steak was a little too tough for me. So I tried the pastor taco, this was heaven on archer, all I can say, this is by far the best pastor taco I've had. They come with onions and cilantro, that's all you need, trust me. Try them.

46.description: The best steak tacos and tostadas I've had thus far in Chicago. This authentic Mexican joint might lack in good looks and parking but the food will make you keep coming for more. What can I say? This place is solid and the prices are what they should be. Try the steak tacos, tortas, and tostadas because you will not be disappointed. Other great tacos are al pastor, chile relleno, lengua, and chicharron en salsa roja. Their tortas de carnitas are also a great choice and you can't forget a chile asado to accompany your food. This is my go to place for Mexican food.

1.description: Good tacos, went there for a quick lunch. Had three steak tacos with onion & cilantro the only way to eat tacos. Places was clean & service was quick. I do recommend this place it's on of the oldest Mexican taco joints around.

55.description: Btw I'm salivating as I write this review....Omg, hands down the best tacos I've ever had!! The place itself looks like it could use a big renovation but everything is spotless clean. I always get the carne asada tacos and they never fail to fill me up. When I'm having a bad day, I take a drive out to Pacos instead of eating ice cream at home. Yup, they are that good.

9.description: I always find it funny when people ask me, "who do you think has the best tacos in chicago!?" I mean, c'mon dawg, i'm half mexican so you already knowwwww the best tacos in the Chi are at my momma's crib! No, but really. However, when my parents aren't cooking, I like to smash out at Paco's. I'm not from out south so when Big Robby Valentino, my ace squid, put me on my life was truly changed. The meat is cooked right in front of you by a dude who looks like he could be my uncle and the tortillas come out steaming, heated up on the same greasy grill the meat was cooking on. I like the spot because it's extremely fast and to the point.  The tacos come to your table within the same few minutes that you ordered, topped with nothing besides cebolla AND cilantro. For those who don't know, cebolla AND cilantro to the taco game is like mustard and relish to the hot dog world - the only acceptable additional ingredient on classic tacos outside these two is DEF avocado and MAYBE cheese or sour cream, but they're not really needed.

26.description: This place is a must! Tacos are loaded with very tasty choices. You just can't go wrong with any choice. It's a small joint but I travel a distance just to enjoy their tacos,

25.description: My favorite taco spot and its a 2 minute walk from my house which makes me proud to say that this place is in my neighborhood.The asada is seasoned well and they are very generous with their meat when ordering. Try a taco de chicharron (chicharron in a red salsa) or barbacoa, very tasty as well. This is the place to come on a sunday morning to pick up carnitas and chicharron for brunch. Ive yet to taste a place that sells carnitas better than here.Although it can get pack here the line moves very fast. The ladies behind the counter are very sweet and friendly.only cons:they close early as 9pmthey don't serve homemade juice like horchata, jamaica, or lemonade..however they still have a large selection of soda and almost every jarrito flavor

12.description: Pacos Tacos is pretty darn delicious! The tacos aren't the cheapest I've seen, but the price isn't really so bad considering how much meat you get on these suckers!I had the lengua, barbacoa, chicharron and al pastor. Unfortunately, by the time I got home, I couldn't really figure out which was which, except the chicharron, which is the choice I highly recommend. It's soooo flavorful! The others weren't bad, but they didn't stand out in flavor enough to even know which was which. But they were filling and delicious, and about $12 for 4 tacos, not too bad I suppose. I've always seen this sign in my neighborhood, but never had the gumption to try it till recently, and I'm glad I did. I will be returning to get my taco on!

21.description: One of the best tacos. A lot of meat for sure in your tacos. It's also not expensive, you will get full with 2-3 tacos and a drink.

17.description: Best place in Chicago for tacos hands down. Great cooks and great staff. Very pleasant experience and have been going there for over 15yrs

10.description: Oh Yeah!  Let me assure you that this is a good spot for some tacos.  I've been to the Pulaski location a few times, but this was my first time at the Archer location and I wasn't disappointed!  I ordered 3 tacos (Barbacoa, Chicharron, Carnitas) with onion and cilantro.  Tacos were about $2.50 each and piled high with delicious, flavorful meat!  While there were plenty of seats available to eat in, I decided to enjoy them back at home and were still very much warm by the time I ate them.  The place was easy to find, the service was quick and I was very happy that they do accept credit/debit cards, since I hardly ever carry cash on me.

5.description: *4.5 stars Authentic Mexican in the heart of a Mexican neighborhood. I will definitely be returning to Paco's. We tried a bunch of different tacos and my favorites were carnitas, pastor, and carne asada, in that order. The carnitas definitely make the top of my taco list; juicy chicken with a spicy, flavorful sauce. The pastor was also excellent; Seasoned well and topped with fresh cilantro and onions. Not to mention two different salsas you can add on top! Do yourself a favor and go here!

3.description: Oh Pacos Tacos... how I adore you!!! Ok.. a pic of these tacos on a platter were floating around Facebook. .. they looked so good me and two of my cousins hopped in for you guessed it...ROAD TRIP... ok not that far... 25 minutes.. and oh yes. .. it was indeed worth it.. the food tasted great... the meat was seasoned perfectly! !! Onions.. cilantro cheese... all fresh! Man o man..the tacos were great! I had steak my cousin had chicken. ..the chicken.. to die for! Paco we will be back for your tacos!!

35.description: The tacos are probably the best that I have had outside. I love the meat portions, which explains why they are a little pricier than other tacos. This is a good carry out place, I wouldn't really want to sit and eat inside. Not a good selection of drinks, but the tacos are amazing!

19.description: I was next store getting a fade for my son and we got hungry. I got the chicken torta for my son and a steak and 3 lengua tacos with a side a grilled jalepenos for me. Amazing! The greatest thing about this place is the generous portion sizes. And the green sauce gets your mouth oh fiyah!

28.description: Everything was amazing. I recommend the Al Pastor if you like spicy. Street parking could be a little tough if you go during peak times.

45.description: Probably the best place to grab a taco in the southside.  They load up the taco with meat unlike some places that skimp out.  They are quick to serve and carry out has been very fast if you call ahead.

33.description: Paco's Tacos on Archer has been consistently good for years. It has the most authentic feel to a taqueria in Mexico in comparison to anywhere else in the city. You use to be able to walk up and sit at your stool and order tacos right from the cook but because of people skipping out on the bill, you have to order them with the cashier and pay for them ahead of time. Their tacos de Carne Asada and Chicharron are my favorites. They are pretty generous with the meat without sacrificing taste.

43.description: I have been to Pacos tacos more times than I can count and I have never been disappointed. Scratch that, I was disappointed once when they didn't have barbacoa. This is hands down one of my favorite taco joints. As a Mexican I take pride in my tacos and this place gets my stamp of approval. Their steak tacos are amazing and the lengua are also tasty, but my favorite thing about this place is the barbacoa. Not only can you order by the taco, but on the weekend you can order it by the pound. Their barbacoa is definitely like the one I used to eat as a kid at home and at the restaurants in Mexico. Whenever we ask my 7yr old what she wants to eat when I don't want to cook this is her go to place. The people there are really nice and their green salsa is perfect. The salsa is just spicy enough for us pros but not too spicy for those who can't handle the heat.

2.description: Best tacos i've ever had in my life & that says alot about the neighborhood that's loaded with lots of taco joints. I would go back every week if I had the chance. If you're around midway airport and need a quick bite, you definitely need to stop by.

18.description: I haven't eaten here in years due to me living on the North side of Chicago, but this is my favorite taco spot when I'm in the south side. Very very good tacos.

41.description: I love meat therefore I love the tacos here. They give you lots of meat. It's not overdone with anything unnecessary, it isn't loaded to the brim with that weak veggie stuff. When you ask for a steak taco (which I recommend you do), they give you steak. You can even watch them roll out chunks of beef as you eat your beef *swoons*The place itself is found conveniently right next to a bus stop. Seating is limited but the seats open up fast enough. The cashier is nice and friendly. I'd definitely stop by the next time I'm in town.

52.description: As many times as I have ordered here I have never had a problem! Milanesa Tortas are mouth watering and the toasted Pan it comes on is heavenly!

50.description: best steak tacos in chicago, always fresh!

4.description: Since moving from TX, I've been on the hunt for some great tacos and I'm so glad to have stumbled across Paco's Tacos. The place is well kept, staff is friendly and offers an intimate environment where you can watch them prepare your tacos. I've tried the carnitas, carne asada, barbacoa, pollo and al pastor tacos and they're all great! The horchata is tasty too! The green sauce is in the freezer and is a must try! Will happily return to satisfy my taco fix

6.description: These steak tacos where as good as it gets. Excellent !!!!!  I've tried various tacos in differant parts of the city . These where easily in the top three.

22.description: Best lengua taco in Chicago. Tender but not greasy. Everything was perfect. Even the cilantro was super fresh. Well worth the money.

15.description: Best tacos in Chicago! I dare you to find better.

57.description: Been going here for about 15 years maybe since they opened. Lets just say the tacos were a little cheaper back thee. I would say this is the best taco place in the city of Chicago. Prices are still reasonable and recipes have remained the same for good reason.

20.description: I never leave bad reviews, but I had to. I got really sick after eating here. I was looking foward to  trying this place but I wouldn't never again.

36.description: My boyfriend took me here and HANDS down they are the best tacos I've ever had. The chicken in the chicken taco was so moist and flavorful!  Didn't even need any Salsa verde. I love this place! YUMMY

14.description: My favorite taco spot and its a 2 minute walk from my house which makes me proud to say that this place is in my neighborhood.The asada is seasoned well and they are very generous with their meat when ordering. Try a taco de chicharron (chicharron in a red salsa) or barbacoa, very tasty as well. This is the place to come on a sunday morning to pick up carnitas and chicharron for brunch. Ive yet to taste a place that sells carnitas better than here.Although it can get pack here the line moves very fast. The ladies behind the counter are very sweet and friendly.only cons:they close early as 9pmthey don't serve homemade juice like horchata, jamaica, or lemonade..however they still have a large selection of soda and almost every jarrito flavor

3.description: I'm super excited to review this place. I went last night for some birthday drinks. The drinks were awesome, AMD reasonably priced. The service was great! The decor was beautiful. The atmosphere was really mellow. I really LOVED the live music. I will definitely visit often and I will definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone. Thank you for having us!

1.description: Went to Club Coco on a Friday night with a girlfriend. There was fun live music (David Bazaar was playing), classy ambiance, and comfortable seating. Although I was apprehensive about the area, I was surprised to find such classy bar on top of the sports bar below.I had two appetizers, the parmesan fries and fried ravioli, which were both delicious. My girlfriend and I had cocktails, The Waz, Yellow Jacket, New Jersey Devil, and the Soyko. Our favorite was the Soyko Martini (delicious lemon!)The servers were super friendly and personable. They attended to our every need. I totally recommend this place!

2.description: Great selection of drinks for the prohibition type environment. When you enter you need to tell the bouncer that "you're with the club" with no signs telling you outside. The venue is delicately classy and they usually have live music for your enjoyment. Their menu has a great selection of cocktails and liquor for anyone to enjoy. Service is very good, extremely kind and the manager is knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend the place for a nice night to relax and enjoy some sweet cocktails.

0.description: Great atmosphere, the mood was complete with the Nite Hawks, a jazz band tonight. Loved everything about this place. Completely different than what I've ever experienced and will definitely be back!! The four of us ordered the woz, the sephia, De bello, apple cinnamon bourbon tea, and last but not least, absinthe!! First time absinthe, it was delicious. We ordered the Parmesan fries and I don't think i can eat fries any other way now! Love love love, you won't regret it!According to the co-owner, they will be opening on Sunday's for comedy nights!

I have been to serval Sally Beauty Supply stores ... This is by far the worst I been too...bad customer service!!  As soon as you walk in to the store you have an employee following you through out the entire store ...making you feel very uncomfortable and making sure you don't steal or touch anything on the shelfs!!  Very, very uncomfortable!!! I stopped shopping and I cancel my Sally's members card... I refuse to shop at a sally again! Sally's should invest into some kind of security system to make sure ppl don't steal... Instead of allowing there employees to follow customers around !!

3.description: Please don't waist your time or money at this place. I went here to have a French manicure done for my Granddaughter's Sweet 16. Needless to say the manicure did not last 12hrs. I have had French manicure for many years and never had the entire polish from clear to white tip peel off all together! When I went back to ask them to fix the nails they made it seam like it was my fault and told me to come back the next day so the girl who did my nails could fix it.  So I go back the next day and they still argue with me and say its because of my nails!  After two days of arguing, they finally decide to fix my nails. This is the first and last time I will go to this nail salon! Bad customer service

1.description: Went once because it was the nearest place open to me. Never went again. The person who did my nails was rude and did a sloppy job, I asked for gel but they used acrylic, and another woman who was not doing my nails kept insisting that I get an upper lip wax. When I declined she said under her breathe but loud enough for me and others to hear "well you need it." I was of course upset and therefore did not leave a tip. The lady still had the nerve to call me out on it! When I told a friend about my experience she told me she's been told similar things! Never ever going back!

2.description: Worst place ever ! Like never go here ever!!! My nail broke like within hours leaving there the did who did my nails made me bleed cause of a hang nail the lady messed up my eyebrow cause she insisted to make them thin when all I wanted was a clean up! Don't go here! Save ur money!

9.description: This place is good. I have been going here on and off for about ten years and it is consistently a pleasant experience. The place gets busy with a lot of eyebrow waxing and threading customers, but they never let the customers sit waiting for a very long time. As for the negative review saying it is dirty, well it is a Vietnamese nail salon in the hood, so what do you consider clean? It's not an Orland Park nail salon, honey. Bottom line, the place is decent and I have never had any problems with my gel nails for eyebrow waxings.

10.description: If I could give this place -1 stars I would... They cut my finger so bad it was oozing blood for 10 minutes and then they blamed it on me... but it was him who held the sharp object by my skin while talking and not paying attention. Then tried to make a not so big deal of it.. I will NEVER go back here and suggest everyone else to ignore this place

4.description: I been a very good customer for the past 2 years. Love there price and work.  But today I walked in to get my nails done actually made an appointment and sat there for 30 minutes when 3 girls came in together and they took them first because of course it was only me and 3 of them which means more money for them which I thought was really rude. This was some bogus shit and he still had the nerve to tell me I had to wait after her finished all 3 when I was there first and had an appointment! Never will I ever go there again they just lost a good customer! Very rude it's fucked up that they only care about the money and not there loyal customers.

6.description: I am so sad to see the negative reviews. I have been going to An's Nails for almost a year. I always get no chip manicures and eyebrow waxes, sometimes pedicures. The pedicures are &19 Monday through Wednesday. Normally they're $22. I never had a problem and hardly ever had to wait, only when I went on a Saturday. The prices are reasonable. I've never thought the place was dirty, as was mentioned a few times. The people are friendly and nice. I gave four stars because once or twice I did get my skin pulled too much and started bleeding. She put crazy glue on, weird but it stopped the bleeding. And sometimes while I'm getting a manicure, certain but not all staff members would ask me if I wanted an eyebrow wax, which I was going to do anyway. One time I didn't want to because I didn't feel like spending the money at the time (only $8), and the lady said it's been a while and I had a lot of hair already. I laughed because I need to get my eyebrows waxed every week and it had been over a week. But my eyebrows weren't that bad. I know she was just trying to add a sale. I only stopped going there because I moved to Austin, TX. I had a great experience going there.

12.description: Ok, so i don't think i can give this place a lower star even if i could, which i would!! Ok, so i usually go thread my eyebrows on the Northside at glamore, but it is sooo far from me. So i deciede to come here. NEVER again. The woman who threaded my eye brows didn't even ask me how i would like the done, it was just sit down and here you go. I needed them done for the next day cause i had a party to go to so i also had a pedicure. HORRIBLE. They do NOT sterilze their equipment!!!!! Its just like if the person before you had foot fungus, here you go, you got it too. GROSS. I would not recommend this place to anybody. The prices are 25 for pedis and 8 for eyebrows. The staff is ok, would not go again.

5.description: Horrible Service I hate the way my nails came out and it was a simple French tip. I will never return to this place. My finger look horrible I'm hurt as well quick work with low quality garbage nails I was charged 70$ for a French manicure and pedicure  never had I been so disappointed and disgusted with this type of service

11.description: This place is NOT up to cleaning nail salon standards .... It's dirty! I would not recommend coming to this nail salon ..stay away !!!

8.description: I wanted to find a salon close to home so I thought I'd take a chance on An's.  The tech was extremely talkative with a very heavy accent that made 95% of his cheesy and "friendly" words unintelligible. His movements while applying a full gel set were obviously more for theatrics than actual quality. At some points the the fakery became so ridiculous I had to fight the urge to walk out in the middle of this dark comedy! Me being african american... you KNOW how that would have been interpreted. Lumps, bumps and poorly applied tips weren't even the last straw! When I was ready to pay the posted price, the cost for my set was $10 more.  If I could give negative stars, they'd earn at least 3. I wish I had come to Yelp first!  Oh, and just for the record, that 5 star review below is, no doubt, submitted by someone who works there or owns the place. (Hmmm. Could it be the very one mentioned in the review?.... nah!!!) They went back "once" after not stepping in the door for several years yet can now spout off one of the most thorough pieces of 30 second copy I've seen since John Moschitta pitched FedEx?!?  Seriously???

0.description: This place like the past reviewers is DIRTY! I was the first person in on a Wednesday (10am) and the floors were filthy. When I mentioned to the owner (who did my nails) that the reviews stated that her shop was dirty - she acted flabergasted and shocked. Then on once of her trips up to get something, she started kicking the shards of caste off fake nails underneath closets and chairs. There were 4 people sitting there with NO customers, instead of kicking all of the day before's nastiness, why don't you tell one of your people to pick up a broom and CLEAN IT UP!!! I still gave 3 stars because the service was A-OK.

7.description: This place does not deserve a star.  I have been going there for over a year, but today will be the last time and I hope I won't have to hire a lawyer after getting a pedicure today.  I went in for my monthly pedicure and An who regularly does my pedicures cut me that I bled for half an hour.  I could see she was scared at what she did and that she couldn't control the bleeding.   She kept apologizing.  Everyone in the place kept coming up to me and shaking their heads.  She didn't charge me for the service.  Which was the least she could do.  I pray I don't get an infection.  The way she handled the situation was unsanitary.  Please stay away from this place.  It is not worth to compromise your health.Marta

12.description: It was sunday afternoon and me and the bf were looking for a burger and beer.  It was our mistake, to go in on a Bears game night. Equipped with groupon we were ready to drink it up and munch out. Unfortunately, do to lack of service we settled for 1 beer (after our waitress forgot our pitcher, and brought us 2 glasses instead). Once our food was brought in by a "new waitress" we were asked if we wanted another beer, to put up with the ridiculously loud tvs (for the less then 50ppl there) we said yes. No beer was brought. And no one ever returned to our table. This is surprising since for such a large bar it was practically empty, with sections looking like ghost towns. What is disappointing is that this place has the potential to be a great place for people on this side of the city. Sadly with all its negatives, we'd rather shell out for gas and parking on the North Side than get bad service and really mediocre food close by. so, service - thumbs downfood - a big Eh. atmosphere - ugh. obnoxiously loud, for the lack of people there.

7.description: Great place to catch a game, they have huge TV's everywhere and they have daily special so make sure to check that out! I looooveeee their margaritas!!

19.description: This place stinks.  It used to be much better when it was just La coco's.  The food has generally gone downhill, the chili is now horrendous, and their menu offerings are subpar. Booooooo!

1.description: Can I please get some service here? Hours waiting for service! You have to chase them down to get a drink, or even the check.  Food gave me a stomach ache, drink were ok .

2.description: It's a shame that this neighborhood bar doesn't get that much of a crowd , but they're definitely overpriced for being a neighborhood bar and grill ... I pay downtown prices for a south side shack ... There aren't that many bar grills in this Area so I would think there would be more people or some kind of attraction to it.This place does have delicious wings and they're loaded fries are really good and filling . But their $10 pizza special, you pay an additional price for each topping .. I guess I would frequent more if they had more specials going on , otherwise there's other places to visit with better food and specials .

9.description: Fuck this place. My girlfriend and her co workers got jumped right outside by a bunch of gang bangers. They were all wearing their uniform and these pieces of shit still went ahead and take advantage because it was 6 people agains 10. Like wat the fucking fuck? Kids these days smh. This bar needs to take more responsibility when it comes down to their facility because this happened right in their parking lot and the security guards said they didn't get paid enough to break up the fight and one got sent to the hospital and my girlfriend and her other female coworker got jumped by 5 females nothing but fuckig garbage ass gangbangers! Fuck this place!!!!

6.description: This place is cool as hell. Lots of tvs everywhere playing loud music and sports games. Almost a club like atmosphere at night on a Friday. Food is good

18.description: Went with a Groupon (20 for 40) with the wife and my son, we went during lunch time. They are super cheap, for the Groupon we got; a burger, basket of fries, 1/2 pound fried mushrooms, 6 jalapeno poppers, 3 non-alcoholic drinks, 1 alcoholic drink, 12 chicken wings and a slice of pizza. Of course, we took some home but wow we were stuffed there and once we got home and ate the rest a few hours later we got stuffed again. This place may not be the best bar and grill but it is most definitely not the worst. They rank pretty high on my list and their slushy alcoholic thing taste delicious, it is a must. It's huge as well so I might go there for a night out because it looks like a chill spot and the bartender is very nice.

10.description: I went here with some friends to watch the Chicago Blackhawks game. We did not like how they played loud music and you could not hear the game at all and it is a sports bar. The food and drinks were good. They had good specials. I think we may give this sports bar another try.

13.description: This place is terrible!! Been there once and never came back. The food sucked the service was even worse. The waitresses untrained and don't the difference between their elbow and their asshole. They got us a drink or food and they never came back to check on us worst service ever. I've been a lot of bars but never one this bad I was surprised that this place is not out of business yet terrible service, food and customer service.  We didn't leave a tip and I'm never going back.

16.description: Madd Anthony is a "special" place. Its a sports bar that is extremely local to the South Side. It has a rough feel if you walk in, but a good time can be had especially on Karaoke Nite.  Think of Cheers, in a the hood.  They take their darts serious in these parts.  Free popcorn and cheep drinks, its not the best place but its not the worst.  Real Hawks and Bears fan be here arrrr. my biggest pet peeve with "Madds" is when they have $1 domestic beers, because in the South Side domestic means Bud, Bud Lite, MGD and Miller Lite, and YOU are the moron if you think Sam Adams or Leinenkugel are domestic.  The food is typical bar food, best to go with something fried.

17.description: This place sucks. If I could give it zero stars I would. I got something in the mail that they had a free pizza buffet weekdays from 5 til 7. I got there at 6 on a Thursday and they said they didn't have the special. We showed our waitress the special that was on the card we received through the mail and asked her why it said that than and it was false advertisement and her response was "that's just what it says". She was so rude about it and we just left. Management sucks here, false advertisement, rude service. Go down the street to pizza castle, much better service, pizza is delicious, and you'd be supporting a family owned business that has been in the community for years.

15.description: The crowd of people here are ghetto! Gang bangers, you can tell when neutrons come in. However the food is good, the service is good. They're a south side establishment so dont expect that Wrigley field atmosphere where all the servers ate gay and beyond friendly. This is the south side. Tell them what you want and move over lol the bar is great! And dont leave without trying their wings they're delicious

0.description: I was a regular at this place long before they did their renovations and once my schedule allows it, I'll likely be a regular here again. Nonetheless, I find time to stop in once or twice a month. In addition to the visual renovations, I LOVE the fact they have taken steps to make the troublemakers of society who used to infest this place at night feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. I'm not sure how anyone could complain about their prices because they have some awesome daily specials every single day. If I could recommend anything it would be for them to hire someone on to work on their marketing & advertising to get more people in the door. This place is WAY too nice now for the low attendance you see in there on some days. I mean, it's great for those of us who go in during those times because we get faster service, but I'd like to see this place stick around for years to come instead of the rash of trashy dive bars that plague that general area.

5.description: So they wouldn't allow for us to get a bucket of beer, which would be fine since they say they want to limit the amount of alcohol being served per person. All about the safety laws until you see the the waitresses gustling beers and the other slamming vodka/lemonades behind the bar. And even that would be just fine unless they don't take order in a timely fashion and fail to check in frequently which is exactly what was happening. It a ridiculous policy they have and clearly they don't have their priorities straight! The management needs to be put in their place. Send Bar Rescue into this place!

11.description: I just wanted to go somewhere for a late night snack. Little did i know this place turns into a terrible club with an awful DJ with a $5 cover charge. They were the only thing open so it had to do. My guy friend got patted down YIKES! What kind of place is this, we just wanted a pizza! Maybe this place is better when it is earlier in the day. I will not be back!

8.description: I used to frequent this establishment back when it was LaCocos and it definitely has changed for the better, much to the adjustment of the times. I love coming here for many reasons. The service is amazing, the food is definite comfort food, and the drink specials are top notch.The times that I have been here the service has been amazing. Speaking as a server, it's very hard to find great service anywhere. These ladies really have got it. The food is definitely generously portioned. The calzones are to die for, the chicken tenders are a great size for the 5 piece and the pizza is great as well. They have daily specials for food as well. Don't miss that! There are lots of drinks specials here. From daily to monthly. It's the best spot to hang out or go with family. People don't skip out on this place. I can not review on the night aspect of it being that I always come during lunch so that is the only reason I will give it a 4 star review. But I have seen from friends posting on their fb of constant meetups here. Keep up the good work people! Love it.

3.description: I've been here a few times on a Friday and Saturday night..and let me tell you it's very different from during the day. I went with my bf a few weeks ago and had great service I don't remember her name but she had blonde hair. We ordered wings, pizza, hamburgers, fries, beers. Every thing was brought out hot, the order was correct and she made sure we had everything. She was nice and recommended a beer I would like..never before have I tried a rootbeer beer. It was interesting. At night it's a different crowd though.

14.description: I really like the pizza! Why? Because they make the pizza any way you want it & it's not  greasy!!! It's a great bargin 9.99$ for an extra large. Instead of little Caesars I would buy this pizza instead. Freshly made with veggies or meat whatever you prefer. I will go back. Try it once I know you will return.

4.description: Horrible service, no buckets of beers, $5 domestics, $14 pitchers, only one pitcher per table, even if the table has 8 people sitting there, food is good but not worth visiting. They think they're in downtown but they're located in the hood, save your money and go down the street to Illinois bar and grill..

3.description: Awesome selection, prices, and service! The store is stocked full of just about everything you'll need work related. If you pay cash you can skip on the tax. It'll save you $10-$12. I'll be back in the fall to get ready for that Chicago winter. Parking is located in the back.

1.description: good selection of work gear and good customer service :)

2.description: Real nice owner.  I tried on 7 different types of boots and never once heard a peep out of him cause I made him keep going back and forth.  Tons of stock and everything a construction  worker or policewould need

5.description: I needed some steel toe books for work, and maybe its because I am new to town, but finding steel toe boots here is not easy.  I rolled into their store 30min before they closed and they were amazingly helpful.  First, they said I should bring my bike inside the store to protect it from getting messed with outside on the street.  Their selection is HUGE.  I mean they seriously probably had about 80 different models of boots.  In fact they had so many, it was a bit daunting on how to select, but they pointed me to some of their better quality boots that were water proof and light.    Its probably difficult to find steel toes in Chicago because these guys have them all.  They didn't rush me at all and I had my boots picked out in about 10min.  Super comfortable, really happy with the purchase.  While there, I was talking to Matt, who I think was the store owner, and said that they have been in that shop for 17 years and in that area for around 40.  Super nice guy.  I forgot that I needed some BeesWax and he tossed it in for free.  Matt even held the two doors open for me to wheel my bike out.  Great customer service.Super friendly, awesome selection (not just for boots, any heavy duty work gear, they got it all).  I will definitely go back and get some more gear from them.

6.description: Working in the trades for a living you come to appreciate quality garments and just how warm or cool they can keep you whilst out in the elements.  I found Delaware  work wear to have one of the largest selections in stock in the city while offering reasonable prices.  They offer everything from steel toe work boots to fire retardant clothing and everything in between.  I go there for their broad selection of Carhartt products( without which I couldn't bear working in chicago's pleasant winter months.  Be advised that this doesn't mean they're cheap.  You must assume to pay a little more for quality work wear. Lastly the gentlemen whom has helped in several occasions( older fella, whom I believe own's the establishment) to be both, very helpful and cooperative. If you need work gear, head there for quality service and quality products.

0.description: Great store to buy work wear all sizes for everyone they have shoes , boots , gear for the deep freeze up to summer so I suggest you go there and check it out !!! I give this store 5 stars  or 5 ups ........

4.description: Great customer service and product selection! My hubby always shops here for his work gear.  The owner and his wife are friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful!

3.description: Crazy drive thru entrance. I say at the order menu for a good 2 minutes without even being greeted. I really hate this neighborhood.It took a really long time to get just 2 whoppers and a cinnabon. I ordered 2 and they only had 1 ready, so they comped me it. Which was nice. The lady at the drive through was very nice, but for the long wait, it was a bit nuts.Also I don't too much care for Burger King food, but I had a coupon and was looking for a cheap lunch. The whoppers were standard. The cinnabon was ice cold. Overall not a fantastic trip, but what do you expect from a Burger King in a not-so-great neighborhood?

1.description: Oh wow, I am about to do what I try never to do. A one star! Fortunately for them, I can't go any lower than that. But we will see what the review does for them and again I have to be just honest and not beat around the bush just to make them look good. I came in for a breakfast sandwich, I usually go through drive thru but decided, nah I need to just come in and check them out. Picture it, 7:00 am and just a few customers in the establishment. You know, the ones who live in the area or are on their way to work and decide to stop by and grab a bite or two. But I digress. . . . . . . I noticed that when I asked for the restroom to wash my hands, the young lady said: Are you sure you want to use it? NO, Of course I don't, I just asked because I like to get reactions, NOW LET ME GO WASH MY HANDS! Really!So I continue to the restroom and noticed perched in some of the chairs, a few homeless folk just minding their own business. Of course I am one to help anyone who asked for food and that's just me. But one guy asked for $5 (really, you don't need loose change) and when I offered to buy him a breakfast sandwich meal, he said "NO thank you, I just want the cash." Ummmmm No!So any who, I went to wash my hands and a homeless man was in his skivvies (underwear) and was actually bathing! Oh LAWD NO!I quickly left the restroom and another one was filling up his water bottle. This is definitely the last straw, I'm outta here and refuse to be part of an establishment that lets patrons witness these shenanigans and the workers KNOW about it? I hope I don't come off as a prude, but come on. I didn't pay to see a show, I just wanted a coffee of which now, I will never get. RUN FOR YOUR LIVES, this is definitely a miss!

2.description: This place always gets my order wrong. They need to retrain their staff. Once I had to go back because they gave me the wrong order. When I told them they had an attitude with me. They gave me the my order but when I got in my car I checked the sandwiches and they were the wrong ones so I had to go back in again.

9.description: It's a booger King, what do you expect?Food's hot, fresh, and you occasionally see a bum. Coupons usually end up in my mailbox every two weeks or so, so it's even better.

10.description: I found a bee in my iced tea once. A whole freakin' bee.

4.description: To be honest i never liked this place.... Not clean, terrible customer service  and  you have to wait long for your food to be ready... This is not a fast food restaurant.. Lol..... Never again.

6.description: Fast food???  If you plan on going to this BK expect to wait for your food for 5-10 minutes While the BK crew figures out how to read. I ordered my whopper with no cheese onions or mayo, You know their motto, "have it your way" and I got a whopper with everything. When the cook was told what to make He still put cheese on it as she was yelling for him not too. Another BK I will not go to

11.description: This is strictly a breakfast report: I generally spot at BK before i head in for summer camp because its the closest fast place to get breakfast before work. Now while they aren't the best, they have the formula down to a degree - crossaint, sauage, egg, cheese. Not hard to mess up, is it? Plus they offer french toast sticks for a dollar, but you do better going with the sandwich and hashbrown combo. Sometimes they try to get too fancy and put as much meat as possible on one sandwich...seriously people, you don't need every type of pig on one sandwich. orange juice...not a good option. While its good, its comes in small boxes so its gone before you know it. I do like the little hashbrown thingies....as far as their new idea of the bacon wrap (which is basically some sort of cheese sauce, hashbrowns, eggs and bacon) make sure they dont forget the bacon, its happens alot, which is bad since its the main ingredient in a bacon wrap.

5.description: This place is ok but lots of times I came by my food is cold and the service is terrible. I'm always waiting long even in the drive tru. This last time I came they did take care of me fast and my food was hot. So that's why I give it 3 stars.

7.description: As Burger kings go it's par for the coursenothing special, nothing terrible.The same is there that's  at the other one, that's down the street a mile away.How ever it does offer two great options#1. Dine in.  "have it your way, at our place"#2. Drive -thru or "to-go"Or as the locals call it "take out"c'est la mode.  burger king. c'est la mode.

8.description: Same old same oldHad some crispy fries for the first time in these burger chainsToday it was very empty, only a couple people eating.hey it is a fast food chains, aint going to say they have the best burgersThey only screwed up my order once this year

0.description: This review is kind of biased since I'm rating it off the coupon booklets and the value menu. I was quite disappointed at the new bacon burger they had since it seems to be enough to feed a ten year old with no problem. The pros is that it was fresh and hot. They try to limit the lines at the drive-thru though. The other items on the menu is pretty good too, such as the taco. Their icees never disappoint me either unless they aren't ready on occasion.

1.description: I'm very disappointed and still quite hungry as I will not be finishing my dinner. I ordered a steak taco dinner. It was quite bland and comprised mainly of fat. I'm not entirely sure how this place is open with all of these other competing restaurants right nearby. I will most certainly not be returning.

9.description: The carne en su jugo is right on point!  Delicious, the service is not the greatest but the food takes the 5 stars

23.description: With walls adorned with stuffed cocks (roosters), this local south side dive offers a good variety of Mexican foods including tacos, tortas, shrimp cocktails, soups, and yummy cinnamon coffee.  Los Gallos has a several traditional meat offerings as well as chicken to stuff their tacos and burritos with.  Each table is equipped with traditional condiments including a bottle or two of hot sauce, pickled vegetables, and salt.Service is okay; nothing spectacular.  This joint is pretty clean for a taqueria.  Food is prepared fairly quickly and you can expect it piping hot to your table a few minutes after you place your order.  One thing to note is their late hours - making this a great place to stop by after warming up that bar stool.  Summing it up, this place is cheap, fast, and pretty good.  When ordering tacos, be sure to order an extra one as they are a little on the small side.

12.description: Carne en su jugo is definitely the specialty at this place. You can never go wrong with it. Being a regular here, I would definitely recommend getting the meat in it "well done" or "doradita" and adding salsa and lime. And nothing like the house's horchata to accompany your meal. If you're not into soup or whatever, I definitely also recommend the tacos de tripitas or pastor. Not a fan of the barbacoa to be honest. The service is nice and very attentive. The owner is always there during the day and is very friendly and likes to joke with the customers, making the restaurant a home-y environment. All in all I def recommend it. And the fact that it's open pretty late makes it all the more convenient. Just a tip: it's cash only. They have an atm tho

21.description: I ate here? ...Oo yeah, it's sort of slipped my mind over the past week, since my visit. Granted the burrito was ok, rather large + the tomato was so ripe that it still had a bit of stem. If it weren't the bright green of the avocado + the brown hue of the beans, I would have been unable to distinguish any difference from the two. I'm curious as to where they get their freakishly white-only iceberg lettuce ...It must be grown in the dark, some new hybrid that remains untapped. I was hungry, per usual, on my friend Mike + I's post-work "Burrito Sundays" so Los Gallos #2 sufficed. The horchata was tasty but unremarkable. A few (dozen) sprinkles of oregano + a dab of their run-of-the-mill red sauce (the only one they offered + the pickled vegetables looked dry, though I admired their orange-y color) + I was strung out on enough carbs to shake the lingering question as to why ABC7's "Hungry Hound" would have visited here (which was evident by the framed photo which hung behind the cash register).Halfway through our meal, the waitresses started to clean ...The smell of "big pink" cleaning detergent took over any "you're in a resturant" smells + I felt as though I was eating in a train terminal. Fortunately, the price was right + I am willing to cut some slack since it seemed more of a takeout joint opposed to dine-in.The man who sat nearby + said a little hand-clasped prayer after each mouthful, offered up some decent entertainment ...Next time I'll try having what he was having.

16.description: I love their Carne en sen Yougo. (spelling)  Still I have and will go back.  It's far away from my House. Still worth the drive.  We has Taco's and soup. It can't be good for You 'cause it tastes soooo good.  Worth the drive. If You live close Lucky You!!

17.description: A dive looking interior--clean, but with a cafeteria level decor--which is sometimes a good sign for taquerias.  It didn't pan out this time.I found the steak burrito meat very tough and overcooked, and even at $1.70, I've had much better tacos with fresher ingredients. They just threw in some cilantro and red sauce, which I found unflavorful--just some heat, but no pepper flavors.Given the number of options in the area, I don't think I will come back.

10.description: I love their carne en su jugo and the fact that they put cinnamon in their coffee.  I always have at least three cups. Friendly and good service too.

5.description: I'm very disappointed went for dinner and since I forgot to get cash before going , they only accept cash. I decided to use the ATM located as soon as ur enter and of course it wasn't working. So I told the girl working that it wasn't working and she just shrugged her shoulders and said oh I guess it has no money... Good thing Husband had some cash on him... So I ordered a tostada of ceviche then she comes back and tells me that they don't have it because the ceviche needs a lot lime and they don't have limes.. Very, very disappointed won't be going back!!!

11.description: Very good. :-) Mexican breakfast for lunch. Waitress speaks English.

22.description: pretty much agree with 1st. review, except it's not that dumpy.(you want dumpy? take a look,but don't go in 3-4 doors east, i'll review later ) also,  you should try the restaraurant's specialty  "carne en su gugo" (beef in its own juice). your first thought is " i can't finish this". until you dig in.a big bowl of small pieces of steak you'd normally find in their tacos in a soup-like mixtrure of radishes, cilandro, onions & -get this-bits of bacon. if you like a little zestiness, grab a dried pepper sitting at your table as a condiment, break it in half, get rid of the seeds & crush the pepper into the soup... the best!oh yeah, try that coffee, also great.

0.description: One of my favorite things about this place is the "Carne en su jugo".  This soup has bacon, beans, peaces of stake. The fact is the it's addictive. We ordered a large bucket of the soup to go and it comes with only package of tortillas. You also get pepper, lime, onion, radish and avocado. Our avocados where a bit old and I wish we got a little more tortillas.People here are very friendly and nice. We didn't get to wait that long for our food. If you havd never had carne en su jugo you should definitely try it. Definitely recommend this place. I will come back again.

20.description: I've been getting carne en su jugo here for 15 years.  It's always been awesome.  It's my favorite cold cure and I swear that I spent an entire winter eating it and lost weight even though it's pretty filling and kind of oily. (To solve this, stick it in the fridge, remove the oil once it's done it's thing -- calories avoided.)My favorite thing to do is put everything in the soup -- chilis (not all of them because you will die), radishes, onion, cilantro, avocado, and a bit of lime.  Stir it up and then scoop out some non-fluid parts, put them in a tortilla, put some of that awesome red sauce on it, and eat it like a taco.Then eat the yummy broth which I've tried time and time again to duplicate, but never succeed.  I have an idea why, but I'm not going to divulge secrets here.As far as other foodstuffs here go, the carne asada tacos and burritos here are just OK.  Not as good as La Pasadita, but better than a lot of places (including a taqueria nearby that has consistently provided me with digestive distress).But go for the carne en su jugo.  I've tried it other places in the city and so far this place is my fave -- so much so that I make trips from Edgewater for it.

19.description: The carne en su jugo is excellent, and so is the menudo. I also really enjoy the tortas (the bread they use is the best!). My only complaint is that the steak meat they use is sometimes tough and grisly.

2.description: Went today and the food was bad and expensive ....Never again ... the one on 26st is way better ... the meat was chewy by that I mean like gum and the chicken was dry in the tacos ... the only thing was the beans that was good and the rice was horrible had to mix it with the beans to even eat it...

18.description: I've been getting carne en su jugo here for 15 years.  It's always been awesome.  It's my favorite cold cure and I swear that I spent an entire winter eating it and lost weight even though it's pretty filling and kind of oily. (To solve this, stick it in the fridge, remove the oil once it's done it's thing -- calories avoided.)My favorite thing to do is put everything in the soup -- chilis (not all of them because you will die), radishes, onion, cilantro, avocado, and a bit of lime.  Stir it up and then scoop out some non-fluid parts, put them in a tortilla, put some of that awesome red sauce on it, and eat it like a taco.Then eat the yummy broth which I've tried time and time again to duplicate, but never succeed.  I have an idea why, but I'm not going to divulge secrets here.As far as other foodstuffs here go, the carne asada tacos and burritos here are just OK.  Not as good as La Pasadita, but better than a lot of places (including a taqueria nearby that has consistently provided me with digestive distress).But go for the carne en su jugo.  I've tried it other places in the city and so far this place is my fave -- so much so that I make trips from Edgewater for it.

13.description: It was pretty good. Prices are good and good customer service I will come here again in the near future

4.description: I love los gallos! Always great service and food. The carne en su Jugo and tacos al pastor are the best. Also they have fresh orange juice and carrot juice pretty good. Always clean and they never messed up your order like other restaurants in the area. I recommend this place 90% for the food. the only bad part is that they only take cash but it's worth it get a carne en su jugo and ask for the oil chile.

6.description: Good home-cooked meals, good reasonable prices,a taste of Mexico walk-ins are always welcome Great service

15.description: Ordered the steak burrito and it was eh. Steak was overcooked and I think the tomato was too big of a slice. They should dice them. The red sauce was ok...had a bit of kick to it.Horchata was cinamonny (I know it's not a real word, but you know what I mean!)I think there are way better options close by. Inside was clean and bright.

7.description: this place was walking distance from a friend of mine.. got hungry and they suggested this place.. once i got in there i was greeted.. the workers here are friendly.. i was curious of a drink after i placed my order and the lady pulled out a cup and let me tried some! now that is cool!anyways... i ordered..-steak taco- has cilantro and onions and the steak was tender for the most part.. there was a few chewy pieces-al pastor taco- has cilantro and onions and it was flavorfull.. i liked it a lot-breaded steak torta- it was alright.. not the best but it was still pretty good.. the toppings on it was fresh-jamicia drank- it wasnt overly sweet like a lot of places which is a plus for me!

8.description: Carne en su jugo is this place's moneymaker and it's evident- almost everybody in this joint is chowing down on this stuff. Other good stuff- chorizo tacos (skip al pastor and steak) and horchata.Good service, amazing chili paste for the table, and cheap as can be. Nom.

3.description: I had carne en su jugo for the first time here and it was the first of many. It was served hot with plenty of fresh cilantro and onion. The meat was very tasty but I could have done without the beans. I added some of the spicy pickles veggies from the container on the table which made it even better. The soup is served with warm corn tortillas that apparently you're supposed to soak in the broth. We also tried the lengua, al pastor, and tripe tacos. Lengua and al pastor were the bomb but the tripe was not so great--it tasted like salted crispy fried metal to me. I have also had the shrimp cocktail which seems a little pricy for the amount but it was still good. Avocados are served with just about everything and they're really fresh and good! The place is cash only but there's an ATM inside. Service is super fast!!!

14.description: The only reason I dine here is for their carne en su jugo. It is the best I've had so far and it's your perfect hangover/cruda cure. Make sure you get the full works with the dish as it comes with pieces of steak, beans, onions, cilantro, radishes, and slices of avocado. They also give you corn tortillas that you can have with a spicy chile de arbol sauce that they make "molcajete" style but beware because it is very spicy. FYI cash only no credit cards accepted.

1.description: I work in the neighborhood and decided to try out this taqueria. I had tacos al pastor and they were really delicious! As in, wow, I was excited when I was eating it, and congratulating myself on choosing the right store. I really enjoyed their salsa, it was seasoned really well. I will definitely try more of their menu soon.

0.description: Good Solid Mexican Food that features hand made tortillas and some of the best Tacos de Cabeza (cow head) Lengua (beef tongue) and solid tripitas (tripe) in the city.
