The place is a no frills diner style restaurant with a modest menu but quite a delicious one.The Salsas that they serve along with the chips when you sit down are spicy and give a flavorful punch to the delectable food.Cash Only ( I think? well I don't remember either way I paid with cash)

3.description: Best barber shop!!! Good prices, comfortable environment, they take their time to make sure needs are met.

1.description: I have been through many Asian salons to get my haircut and I always left unsatisfied within the week. I thought it would be awkward and intimating to go to a barbershop for the very first time, but it was not like that. It has a warm and cozy atmosphere. Despite the wait, I saw consistent perfect fades completed with straight razor shaves. My barber was Jose also known as Pelos. I had a few ideas about what to do with my hair as the other ideas didn't work so well with the salons. He listened to my ideas and suggested his professional expertise and I followed. He made sure the haircut was to my liking. He also gave great advice on properly taking care of my haircuts and answering all my questions. I will definitely come back in two weeks for a touch up.

2.description: Best barber shop in the city. Good prices and they take their time. A family owned, local business which I love. Joe, Bryan, Jose and the "Quiet Guy" will do exactly what you ask for and do a great job at that.

5.description: I was about to give this 4 and then realized that if a first visit can make you feel so welcome and comfortable, that's probably a very good indication of a 5.What stood out most to me about Joe's is the welcoming personality of the barber I was assigned and the cleanliness of the place with large angled mirrors across so you always know what's going on.  Joe's has every indication of consistency which is a gem for barber shops in this neighborhood.  First impressions are of a place with a consistent and reliable staff that is attentive and happy to provide their service to you.For my first visit, I received a barber who engaged me in conversation, was friendly, and gave a great haircut.  The prices are consistent with what you would pay at a good shop on the north side.  I look forward to a repeat visit.

6.description: The one other review posted here is clearly written by someone that works at the other establishment.  All that aside, here is the real scoop.1.  Consistent perfect fades every time2.  All cuts are completed with hot foam straight razor shaves for the cleanest look3.  A little bit pricier than some of the other local hair cut places, but COMPLETELY worth it4.  Relaxed laid back shop with top notch friendly serviceI was in the Marines for 5 years, so I was used to getting a nice super close cut every week.  Every time I returned home for my short vacations I hated it because I couldn't find a place to get a descent barbershop cut.  I'd resort to visiting SuperCuts, Hair Cuttery and other local salons for a shave, high fade, and trim at the top.  It was always subpar and I always left unsatisfied.  Then one year waay back in like 2006 I tried a barbershop by my house and it turned out to be LIttle Joe's.  The business is totally professional, place is clean, and the barber (Joe) has one of the best techniques I've seen out there.  Fades are executed seamlessly and your haircut is by hand & scissors which always looks more natural than those other chumps that resort to a comb & the trim machine.Joe has his 2 sons working at the shop also. I remember visiting in the earlier years where they would always be present every weekend standing next to their father observing and learning and now they too have acquired this family skill.  Joe's proteges have blossomed into great barbers who pride themselves in their skill and technique and I am glad that they have so when I visit, I can easily sit down on any of those 3 chairs and know that I will be happy with the results.One last note:  this place has a laid back and clean atmosphere.  To me this is a big deal especially since many of the barbershops popping up in the area all claim to provide the "best fades in town".  But when you walk in to those establishments you will quickly realize that the clientele and staff is sketchy and questionable.  Ok, i'm done beating around the bush: they are ghetto! There, I said it.All in all, this place is great, give it a try, you will NOT be disappointed.

0.description: Clean. Fair Price. Very good haircut. They take their time and are very easy going. You won't be disappointed.

4.description: Place was very professional. They took their time on my haircut and for the quality of service that they provide the price is reasonable.

3.description: I'm a bourbon guy myself but this place is a gem for all sorts of indulgence. Their whiskey selection rocks and their beer selection is out of this world. Best part, they are willing to spend time taking you on a journey through all of it. This bourbon lover left with a Japanese whiskey and three beers and is loving all of them. Go meet these folks and check out their selection, they are truly top notch people.

1.description: I grew up a couple blocks from Liquorama and it remains one of the best liquor stores in Chicago. In addition to the friendly and helpful service they carry a varied and curated selection of beers, tequilas and assorted liquers.

2.description: Love this place! Highly recommended. The food is awesome- try tge pulled pork and sweet potato fries.

9.description: They carry a great assortment of wines beers etc. I am especially excited by their great choice of IPAs beers. If you're looking for a hard to find IPA you may have a great chance of finding it here. The staff is very helpful and friendly

10.description: Well stocked.I am not a big drinker but I get invited to a lot of parties and just as my mom taught me I should never arrive to a party empty handed. I am pretty sure she did not mean bring alcohol LOL  (JK love you mama, I am a good boy and rarely drink).Any way, this is my place to go. They are well stocked and have things that I have never seen let alone drunk.  Service is super nice, always ready for a quick joke and that is pretty cool.Liquorama is the place to go

4.description: Fantastic selection of anything you could want or need. From craft and domestic beer,  scotch,  bourbon, and tequila they have it all. The brothers can help you with anything. Always a friendly group willing to help.  Will continue going whenever I need anything.

6.description: Great selection and a very knowledgeable staff. The owners and employees are some the nicest people you'll ever meet.

12.description: when i was a youngster, like 4 years old (in the late 70s), i used to go here every two weeks with my dad to get his dad a case of peppermint schnapps and a case of cartons of parliament cigarettes. I remember i used to call the schnapps "Blue Lagagia" cause i was just a kid, and probably because it had a blue label.fast forward to the 2000s and i get a job down the street and it becomes a regular stop for my beer on my way home when i was living on the north side, because they would always have good specials.like for a period of time they had goose island on sale for like $2.99 a sixer and i kept buying it week after week and they were like "nobody around here drinks this north side shit."respect.

5.description: On a road trip from ND to NY and my husband googles best liquor stores in Chicago and he chose liquorama for its picture of fine bourbon. It did not disappoint! Great variety, hard to find items, great prices, CLEAN, friendly and knowledgable staff. ABSOLUTELY worth getting off the highway for!

13.description: They'll have bourbon tastings and buy pallets of random beers to sell for $3 a six-pack (last year it was shiner's hefeweizen).   Between this and Town & Country on 47th.  Brighton and Gage Park are well stocked!

11.description: I admit, I'm not exactly a normal-looking human being - from most people's standpoints.  Occasionally, that works in my favor.  I can walk into a restaurant for the third time, and I can tell that the waitstaff recognize me, for better or worse.  On some occasions, like the day I walked into Liquorama, that did NOT apparently work in my favor.From the second I stepped in, I felt like... someone was watching me.  And, like I do in most shopping establishments I enter for the first time, I spend a long time perusing the aisles - scrutinizing how many deals they have, what prices they're offering for products that I can recall seeing in other shops and how they compare.And yet, I kept having that feeling...I finally made it up and down pretty much every aisle when finally a person I'd seen several times before actually approached me and asked me for my backpack, so he could hold it behind the counter.Now, this is a common rule in establishments, pretty much in stores or areas where they experience a lot of theft.  The neighborhood I live in isn't perfect, but I'm used to this practice.  Especially when it's mentioned upon ENTERING (with signage or a diligent employee monitoring and handling this stuff).  I was dismayed that this wasn't asked of me upon ENTERING.  I was allowed to wander the store for nigh on twenty minutes before they bothered to ask me for my bag.It got me thinking, "Do I look that much like a criminal?"  I was sure that the suspicions I had walking in of being watched were probably accurate.  I was a new face in the store, but I certainly wasn't an under-21 patron (they never even carded me when I made my purchase) and I don't think my actions suggested I was either a criminal mastermind plotting, or a smash-and-grab idiot casing the joint.  I guess that walking around for 20 minutes without actually picking up a product for purchase may have seemed suspicious, but when I just have my backpack with me, I scope out what and how many items I plan on purchasing before grabbing them for purchase.Anyway, I wasn't TOO put off, gave them my backpack, and decided I'd had enough.  I selected my items for purchase (a discounted bottle of Black Cherry vodka that was a good price and some Guinness "Extra Foreign") and headed to the checkout.  They were very friendly people upon checkout - some light conversation and all smiles - but it was hard to shake the thought of them watching me for so long and determining "we better get his bag" after such a long time.Again, I have no issues with stores holding my backpack while I shop - as long as they're up-front about it and I can tell it's a general policy and that I'm not being targeted or singled out in any way.As for my evaluation of the wares, all in all I wasn't too impressed.  They did have a few deals that would make it worthwhile shopping here for liquor, but only to buy the items on sale.  Most everything not on sale was at the average or slightly-higher prices than I'm used to seeing.  But their selection is pretty good.  They have a healthy array of indie/craft/microbrew beers to choose from, though I would have REALLY liked a Hitachino or two supplementing their Asian items.I love the idea of craft beers, but I do not in any way love the thought of paying $8 for one bottle of beer.  Except for those rare instances where I can find Banana Bread Beer.  This was not one of those instances.Either way, after making my selection (after not being carded, which I found a little odd), I was able to retrieve my bag and load my purchases inside.  I even signed up for their e-mail newsletter, in case they have a deal on a liquor I need.But that's the only way I think I'll be lured back here - an incredible deal on a liquor I'm really looking for.  Until then, I don't think I'll be seeing you around, Liquorama.It's not you, it's me.  No wait...  It's you.

8.description: They have a parking lot. It was actually very nice and clean in there. They had what I was looking for.Bartenura Moscato - Recommended by Kevin Hart...lol! Mine still in the fridge, so it better be good. If it is, I'll have easy access to it.They have like a small area that sells cigarettes and scratch off tickets. I saw they had a Cubs scratch off ticket so had to buy it. Yeah, I'm a Cubs fan....from the southside.Definitely a spot to check out for your liquor needs  if you are in the area.

0.description: Great selection of liquor, beer wine.  They also have specialty bottles and I bought my Frida Kahlo tequila here. Amazing

7.description: Liquorama is fantastic!  The selection of scotches, bourbons, tequila's, and beers is stellar!  Peter was extremely helpful with my selection choices over the phone. His suggestions were spot on for what I was looking for.  After talking on the phone, it made me excited to check out the store ASAP.  When I arrived at the store the next day Vicki greeted me with a big smile.:)  Her knowledge was amazing on all her products, which is super impressive.  She walked me thru the store describing the nuances of scotches, whiskeys, bourbon, tequila in the small amount of time that I had, and impressed me even more with her special knack of food and drink pairings.  I wish I had more time when I went because it was a great experience.  When I left, I had to share my experience with a friend who is quite picky of his liquor selection.  He said he had to check out Liquorama the next day because of what selection and customer service I experienced.  He became a happy customer as well!  On the next visit I hope to meet Peter in person.  You have a loyal customer for life!  Thank you so much!

12.description: I got my first full piece done here by Rick and the results were spectacular. Rick is probably one of the best artist that I have seen and I am glad to have gotten work done by him. Hell, i think all of Infinite Ink's artists crush most of the other shops in the city. I love their authenticity and the atmosphere of the shop. All of the artist are really cool and laid back. I highly recommend this shop to anyone who is looking for the best custom work in Chicago.

3.description: I got my belly button pierced here and I am so happy with it! Charlie was super nice and funny! I was totally nervous when I got there and he calmed me down and told me everything would be fine. He was also a super perfectionist which I loved and very clean. Def recommend coming here!!

1.description: The artist that I delt with at the shop seemed alright at first. We met and I paid a deposit so he would start the design. He told me that he would send me a design within a couple days. Those days came and went and when i contacted him again he said he didnt know exactly what I wanted even though we had discussed it. He then said again that he would work on a design and show me in a few days. Again, no response came my way so I contacted him again. He said he didnt have a design and wanted to know if it was ok for him to tattoo free hand on me whatever came to him. I told him I would be more comfortable if I saw a rough outline of what he was thinking so he told me yet again I would see it in a few days. I havent heard from him since and never recieved anything for my deposit nor did I get my deposit refunded. Terrible shop, or maybe just terrible artist

2.description: Impressive with the tattoo of course that I got for my child. Her very first and wow, I am glad that we waited and hired one of their artist. Absolutely loved the look and colors he choose but of course, we wanted to piece tweeked just a little bit which of course he obliged and it only took about 15 minutes to change up. Although we were here almost 5 hours, it was well worth it. I did have an issue with some girls just talking to him while my child (19 years old) is getting her art piece done. I mean come on, you can distract an artist and this is a life time piece. Please ask him questions later, and don't assume you can just walk around where he is tattooing just to talk to him, this is the only part of the visit I had to say was a bit awkward. But still, he is professional and he pulled through with his art. Absolutely would recommend them in a heartbeat, and if you can go and drop a down payment with some ideas, he will customize that and create a work of art that no one else has. HIGHLY recommend RIck, this guy knows his craft!

9.description: I got my tattoo down by John. He's was awesome, as were all the other artists. They do what's best for the tattoo and you, so they provide very good advice on the expectations of how it would turn out. I would definitely go again for another.

10.description: Got my ink done here about 3 months ago Diana did mine it came out just the way I wanted it didn't have to bother with a second sessions she dedicated her time for almost 4 hours thanks again look forward to coming back.

13.description: As soon as I turned 18 I got my first tattoo here! Don't recall who did it...but he did a great job! And the atmosphere of the place is awesome!

16.description: great place. Very respectful, extremely nice, and funny. They do not overcharge at all. i have gone three times, and will continue to go again and again, Rick is a great tattoo artist! They have deals that make it cheaper for large tattoos, also they have parties once a month, so you can checkout the shop. Great place, would tell everyone to go, they also have a location on 59th and pulaski.

6.description: I went in here as I've been coming in for years.... The place has complete new look! It's still very spacious, has great vibes to it. Music playing on loud and the men and women there all go to work ! I had John Sundara give me a nice sized mandala-- flower type design on my chest. He was very easy and smooth. Although when it came to finishing touches it was hammer time! Thanks so much ! Great work!

15.description: This a great place, The piercer there is awesome. I have had 4 done by him and he is very professional and takes it seriously. I've been to some places and the people are rude or annoying. But this place is the opposite. A friend told be about this shop and I haven't been dissapointed yet. I don't get to go down there that often since it's way out of my range

0.description: Awesome place, my Hubby set up an appointment w/ John Sundara @ the Tinley Park Tattoo Convention for a cardinal tattoo. We emailed him a few pic's of the cardinal that my hubby was interested in.The shop was clean and then when we were waiting for the drawing to be done they were cleaning again.  John really took his time w/ making sure my hubby was o.k. w/ the drawing (all points, the tail, the head, the size of the bird, the branch,)  and he took his time on placing it on his leg to get the best possible placing of the tat.  The tattoo is AWESOME, so much detailing, WOW simply amazing how it looks. I set up an appointment w/ John for the Navy Pier Tattoo Convention (can't wait)John:We can not THANK YOU enough for the fantastic art work that you applied to leg.

5.description: Got my first 2 tattoos done today by Dave Lobes. He did an amazing job. Very professional and is good at what he does. I'm so happy that I went to this shop. The whole experience was awesome. Will  be going back soon for more. Thank you so much Dave

11.description: Got my roses outlines done here. Zuriel did em and did them well.I just came back from a kick ass vacation and needed to get some shit straight that's been on my agenda for way too long. Upon a recommendation from an acquaintance, came here rather a hole in the wall and am glad I did. Drove by the address and spotted that it's paper'd up. Called the number and was told that they moved some two doors down. Came in and gave them the design that'll be on for life. He made a copy and took care of business. It didn't take too long, just eyeballing the sightlines make me sort of uncomfortable, but it won't matter in the long run. Was only about an hour long which I felt bad for since he squeezed me in before an appointment of his. I tipped him 33% and was on my way.Sucky thing was that he had balled up the remaining lotion/gel for me, I accidentally left in it my jeans. I threw them to the ground and it popped, so now my 511s has a lotiony pocket. Way to go Adrian W.

8.description: Love this place & my new tattoo! John is the best & his work is amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone & I will definitely be back.

4.description: I must say, of all the shops that I've gone to, this place is the best. My first experience was when my best friend came to get her septum pierced. Nick is really great, friendly, and knows his stuff! I have 10 piercings so I've been through the process enough times to know that he is very professional and takes his work seriously. He was very helpful and didn't treat us like foolish children when we had questions, like I tend to experience at most other places. He was so great I had to come back for a piercing myself. He put two dermal anchors in my back dimples. The process was quick and they look great! The pricing is extremely reasonable too! This is the only shop I will ever be pierced at from now on!

14.description: Full of talented artists and amazing custom work.

7.description: My friend got her nose pierced here and although both employees in the store were super tatted up and therefore much more awesome and hardcore than us,  they didn't laugh at our silly girly giggling and tweeting pictures.  Really professional guys who obviously take their jobs very seriously.THANKS a bunch for being more mature than us 25 year olds! :)

0.description: I was greeted at the door, a bit confused with the set up. Was having a hard time finding an audio converter, there were 3 young ladies working but instead of asking if they can assist me they continued talking amongst themselves and be on their cellphones. Poor customer service.

29.description: Cafe El Meson is my favorite cafe to go to! There will never be a place like Cafe Meson. Their tuna sandwich is the best and their Oatmeal smoothie is awesome! The owner is a very kind and caring man. He definitely puts love into the food, you can taste it!! GO HERE!!! I am kind of sad that its more popular now and less quiet at times when I go and do homework there but I do not mind. A cafe such as this one deserves to thrive! They even have parking in front or in their lot right next door, you gain access through the back of the building. Love it! Too bad its not open Sundays! :)

42.description: Just with one visit and I knew this was a place my husband and I can just sit in for hours. The ambience is so peaceful! The owner is very humble, funny, and great to talk with. It's a great 2 story coffee shop with creative coffee and smoothie creations.The Coco Latte is amazing!

23.description: Great seating area (roomy and comfortable), comes with Wi-Fi. the sandwiches are simple but very tasty. Really like the new spin on coffees/lattes/mochas that they do. Great and very thoughtful customer service!!

47.description: Great place to go chill unwind and catch up. I always passed by and never stooped in. Me and my wife went there a few days ago and we were very impressed by the service and the warmth of the place. Lots a Christan books, its goes both ways, I'm catholic and it doesn't bother me so heads up if you have an issue with that. This place is honestly a new landmark when it comes to class in the south side. The food is good, healthy sandwiches and pasties. The coffee is great. real quality stuff. Great job.

8.description: So even though I religiously check Yelp reviews before trying out a new place,  it's been YEARS since I bothered to write a review (yes, I am the taker in my relationship with Yelp) However, after visiting this little coffee house gem on friday night- I felt compelled to get on here and urge everyone to visit and support this place.  They offer great coffee (i had the Coco Latte- and it was delicious) and sandwiches (I went for the chicken sandwich with jalapeños- also delicious)  If coffee is not your thing, they also offer all kinds of smoothies and drinks. The best part about this place is how cozy and relaxed the atmosphere is- you feel like you can relax all day there.  My sister and I had not had a chance to eat together and chit chat by ourselves in a long time (we always have  two crazy toddlers following us around) so we decided to try a coffee house instead of a restaurant for our sister date- and it was awesome!  The owner was welcoming, answered all our questions and seemed very approachable- and once we got our coffee and food he left us alone to enjoy our evening. We spent 3 hours here talking and sipping our coffee - and we never felt rushed like you sometimes do at restaurants.  Please support this place and help keep its doors open- we need places like this one in our neighborhood- I'm tired of having to head north every time we want to relax at a coffeehouse.

31.description: This is a wonderful place! The  owner is a great, wise, and spiritual person.

34.description: Been driving past this place for years but didn't go in till I saw the review on Yelp! This is one of my new favorite places now! The service was great as was the food and environment. Warm,cozy,quiet and friendly.If your in the neighborhood I highly suggest you stop by!

16.description: One of my favorite places to go! The staff is great, the food is excellent, the place is gorgeous!  Perfect for a reunion or just to catch up with friends. On the winter I love to drink the amaretto steamer and on the summer I ask for piña colada or the avocado smoothie!  They are amazing!  I wil definitely recommend this place to anyone :)

13.description: Just ate the most delicious chicken sandwich! First time here and already love this place. Great place to eat and do work. Coffee is good too!

11.description: A must visit café! Today was my second time at this place and it was even better than the first time! I had the Caramelatto and the Criollo sandwich today; both were delicious! The atmosphere is calm and inviting. My sister and I were there for about 3 hours. Besides the delicious coffee, scrumptious sandwiches (as if there's anything else you could possibly want from a coffee shop) the staff is awesome! I'm very big on customer service and this place has amazing service!

39.description: This is the best cafe to go to when you are looking for a quiet, peaceful place to go study, read, or watch a movie on your laptop.  It's also a great place to go with friends to hang out.  The food is so good!  Try the tuna sandwich on focaccia bread and the mango smoothie!! Both the best I've ever had!! The staff is always very nice and the owner is always willing to talk and do anything he can to make your visit pleasant.I go there once a week!

37.description: The drinks here were very good but the sandwiches were nothing special. They were too light on the ingredients and it made me feel cheated. The drinks made up for it. I tried the guayaba shake and the caramel coffee thing which was delicious and strong. I'd go for the drinks and the place which is a nice spot to catch up with old friends.

0.description: This is in my top three favorite coffee shops in Chicago. A family owned, Christian cafe with great handcrafted food and espresso drinks! The upstairs is so peaceful and great for conversation with a friend or alone time to read. We are regulars here and will continue to be! Oh and my favorite drink EVER is their cocolatte- made with coconut milk, espresso, cinnamon, and honey!

38.description: I stopped by to get a cup of coffee and do some work. The tables are very small and wobbly... not a great for working on a laptop (limited outlets). The coffee is dreadful (very weak) and service is slow (it was just some coffee!).  I'm giving this place 2 stars because the people are nice, it's clean and the decor.

27.description: I went here once, the sandwiches are healthy. Customer service is great!

32.description: I Finally tried there specialty of the house the Frozen Explosión Drink Piña Colada......It was INCREDIBLE !!! They also had a new addition to the menu in sandwiches....The chicken sandwich was very good and will be ordered  over and over again.....

48.description: I LOVE this place. I've been there about 4 times. My housemate recommended it and my other roomate and I checked it out.We wanted to get out of the house and needed some wireless. It is a super clean place and as reviewer number 1 said, not "in your face" with their Christianity concept. The guy who helped us out was super nice and is nice everytime we go in. We usually always have the "El Meson" sandwich- a turkey sandwich on Foccacia with lettuce, cheddar, peperjack,mayo, avocado and tomato, Yum. Stop in for a nice relaxed atmosphere and GREAT customer service. And the bathroom is shinny!

44.description: I started visiting this Cafe in 2009.  The cafe is spacious, plays smoothing music,  and offers delicious coffee and sandwhiches.  I have tried their smoothies, lattes and grilled cheese :) as well as breakfast and turkery sandwiches.  Good stuff... nice people.... a cool place to visit.

24.description: Love this place. I love what they stand for, they always have great customer service and even greater food. I always drive out of the way just to pick up some pina coladas for my husband and I. :)

7.description: I absolutely love the sandwiches here. I had the criollo sandwich and it was great. Nice and toasty. They are way better than any subway, Jimmy Johns or any deli for that matter. The bread is fresh and so are the ingredients. I was told that this is a non for profit. The people that work here are volunteers and the profits go to a Catholic charity. I'm not Catholic I just like good food. They also have a book store with religious books and DVDs and CDs. They have a nice upstairs eating area. They have coffee, cappuccinos, lattes, etc. all the sandwiches are pretty good and made to order.They also offer some sweets for desserts.

49.description: Interesting place.  I'd seen it everytime i passed by looking around for a healthy place to eat...it always caught my eye, but i was reluctant to each at a grease pit.  A friend of mine said it was really good, so i felt like trying some ethnic food...but i was pleasantly surprised!  They have zero ethnic food, it's all healthy sandwiches, on breads such as wheat, french, focaccia, panini, PB&J, bagels, and lots of different coffee, as well as Frappe drinks of all exotic flavors, and smoothies.  The restaurant was super super clean.  The front of the restaurant has a house feel, seating outside in the front yard and back patio seating.  As you walk in the restaurant it feels like the cafe area of borders.  Small tables and new books nicely merchandised.  As you look closer, the majority of the books are in spanish and it was very odd to find that they were all with a christian mood and some "family life" books.  two wide hd screens, however, not sure what it showed, i think it was a minister talking or lecturer of some sort.  The person who helped me out select my meal was super super nice!  he told me all about the concept of the restaurant...they are christian geared and healthy eating.  Although they don't have crosses and christianity "in-your face" sort of speak, it is evident but not annoying. So, at first i was a little disappointed because first time i brave eating tacos around this area, and they didn't serve it...but he suggested a "panini-quesadilla with avocado, onions and tomato and different types of cheeses...it was delicious!  he also suggested the watermelon frappe, extremely delicious!  SO NOTE: THIS IS NOT A TAQUERIA!  healthy eating and reading only, with a wireless conncetion, but not sure if they charged for it.  OH Darn, i just realized i forgot to check out their bathroom.  Price is average for a sandwich place and the sandwich maker guy was sooo nice, i can come back just for his great customer service.  I was very impressed that his recommendation was not on the menu but his swift thinking kept me there to try it.  GREAT JOB!

40.description: Great food.  Great People.  Must check out.  And the Oreo Smoothie is delish.  An I don't ussually use the word "Delish" so....

30.description: Juan runs a friendly, welcoming coffee shop and Christian bookstore.  He is a model of hospitality.  Had a tuna deluxe sandwich with pepper jack and spinach. Excellent coffee.  Comfortable place to work on computers upstairs and sun yourself on patio.  Go!

46.description: I have passed up this wonderful find every day to and from places, since I am always rushing I never really noticed it. So, one day my friend mentioned it and as I drove back home I finally saw what cafe he was speaking of. He hadn't been there and I hadn't been there so today we tried it and we loved it. First of all, it is rare to find a south side cafe period, let alone a good one with such a therapeutical ambiance. It is a Christian based owned place but it's not a "in your face welcome to God's home. Can you attend the church? and will you take this reading material please?" type of place. As a matter of fact, I would have never mentioned it but since it was mentioned in previous reviews I figured it appropriate to explain how it is irrelevant. There is A LOT of literature by what I presume to be faith, motivational and spiritual books. It has a very nice décor all around from top to bottom. I seated myself down stairs but took my nosy butt right up the stairs and flicked away to wonderful seating arrangements around the room as well as a fireplace. It's hardwood floors throughout, and I almost feel like I'm writing a review for design but hey its very inviting and so is the guy behind the coffee bar which is towards the end of the first floor. He was helpful with the menu and also was on point with recommending the cocolatte café- made of two shots of espresso with honey, creamed with cocoa milk and maybe a little cinnamon? My sandwich was very good too. I had the Omelet on Pita. Wi-Fi connection is free for customers who are purchasing. I will definitely skip the overwhelming Dunkin Donut's morning riot line which is less than half a block away from now on and start my morning right with Class A customer service and a little oomph to my coffee drinking experience.

1.description: The owner is very friendly and a definite people person.  I was planning on ordering my sandwich, going to sit by myself at one tables & shove my face into into my phone while I ate, but he invited me to sit at the counter and chat with him and another patron.  That was a nice gesture by him.The Tuna sandwich, while good, was a bit heavy on the mayo.  I was expecting it to be a healthier version of a Tuna sandwich, although the mayo was oozing out the sides.  I'm not sure if this is normal or a one time thing? The gentleman sitting next to me ordered a different sandwich and it looked very good.I am absolutely going to visit Cafe El Meson again in the near future to try the Chicken Sandwich...with light mayo.  :)

9.description: Beautiful ambience and the owner is friendly without being over bearing. I have been able to get my work done here while enjoying an Americano, which was excellent by the way. I recommend this place highly!

26.description: The coffee is tasty, staff are super welcoming, and they have plenty of comfy workspace. And, the Cocoreto (coconut milk steamer with Amaretto) is to DIE for.  Seriously.  I've been here twice and will definitely be back again!

25.description: A quiet, comfortable coffee shop where you can read or work for hours, including an upstairs area separated from the main cafe, a rare find in this part of town! The owner is kind and accommodating and the licuados are delicious. The sandwiches or somewhat plain, but fine for the price. Doubles as a Christian bookstore.

12.description: AMAZING!!!Was leaving the dentist on my search for wifi in a neighborhood I know little about.  They recommended this place and I'm so glad!!  It's an indoor zen garden in here.  I feel like I may smell incense at any moment but really the aroma is neutral.  The owner, Mike, is such a nice guy!  He was engaging, friendly, and overall made me feel really happy to be there.  Can see this place being perfect for a date, business meeting, solo internet exploration... I'm glad I didn't end up goggling Starbucks and going miles out of the way like I almost did.Apparently they have a frappe de aguacate?!! (avocado drink). I'm coming back, for sure.People that live around here:  Support this gem!!!  You want to keep this place alive and thriving in your neighborhood!

21.description: Cutest little cafe place, super chill, great place to study/read. Their signature drink "Cocoreto" is delicious!!! The owner got me hooked on it! He is super nice!

17.description: Nice. Peaceful and everyone is so friendly! Very calm and relaxing. Definitely a place to get work done.

10.description: I was in the neighborhood looking for an estate sale for an antique shop.  I realized the I typed the address in Google maps incorrectly, and was an hour out of the way.  Feeling frustrated and defeated but hungry and interested at the same time I stumbled upon this Gem.  I purchased a candle to relax, a gourgeous necklace for my grandma and not to mention the most delicious mango and spinach smoothie I have ever had.  The owner is kind and caring.  He is extremely passionate and his work and his customers,  I would have stayed here all day if time permitted.  Eat here, Shop here, Feel lifted here!

5.description: I bookmarked this place some time ago, but I wasn't able to precisely pin-point where that was with my knowledge of Chicago streets.  My friend and I were thrift-shopping, and I suggested that we stopped in to get coffee.  The guy, who appeared to be the owner of this cafe, had a nice conversation with us.  The coffee items were very reasonably-priced.  For a 12 oz. latte or mocha, it costs under $3.  We both tried the amorelatta (I believe I've mis-spelt this word...I apologize if I have).  Since we were the first-timers, there was a yelp check-in offer: 10% off, available and I was able to use it.  The guy upgraded our drinks to a 16 oz. with no additional cost and invited us to come back.  I don't necessarily travel much on the south side of Chicago, but this place is cozy, clean, and godly!  There are many Christian books, albums, and spiritual merchandize for sale inside of the shop as well.  There are two (2) floors, with a piano on the first floor.  The building looks like a house that was converted for commercial purposes.  By the way, I could tell that the owner took his time and salted the pave way leading to the cafe:) They also have smoothies, sandwiches, and other food and drink items.  I need to come back and try the piña colada.  It's one of my top favorite crafted drinks, yet I just didn't feel to have a cold beverage tonight.  I wish such place exists in my hood in Albany Park on the north side, within close proximity to my apartment.

3.description: I'm so glad I finally get to try this place out. I had a good conversation with the owner and he sounds like a genuine guy. This is a Christian missionary cafe which I love about it. They play Christian songs and they even sell religious books. I love how they have 2 floors and 2nd floor is very comfy. I'd definitely come back here again.

35.description: Good place!! Very friendly and good tasting coffee con coco!!!

19.description: Love the cozy environment. This is definitely one of my to go places when I need to focus on some assignments. You MUST try their cafe de coco. It is delicious. I gave the cafe four out of five stars for the simple matter that I have attended the cafe twice when wifi connection seemed to be an  issue .

28.description: We went here with our small group, and loved the warm inviting environment, We loved the fact that it is Christian cafe. The owner, what a sweetheart, took his time chatting with us, made us feel very welcome. I tried the green smoothie, it was beyond delicious, and filling! My friends all had different sandwiches, and to this day cannot stop talking about how good they were, and all made fresh. We held our small group upstairs, and stayed until closing time. Only thing is we had to drive 50 minutes or so, wish we had one closer to the north side, but we will be going back.

45.description: This is a gem that gets lost in the shuffle amidst the quagmire of car dealerships and fast food restaurants on Kedzie. It has a comfortable vibe inside. So far, I've only ordered El Meson Sandwich which is worth the visit, and an orange frappe. There is an excellent variety of coffee drinks, frozen/blended drinks, and fruit frappe flavors. The upstairs area feels like a cozy family room with couches, high ceilings, and plenty of space. It is also a bookstore, with a great selection of spiritual reads in English and Spanish. The owner is friendly, genuine, and will personally make and give you your order. I heard there is an open mic night there on Thursdays, and the patio feels like an inviting suburban backyard. Check this place out- especially if you reside on the southwest side.

33.description: Well today was my first time trying this place. I must say that I am happy I found a Christian cafe not too far from my house. :)Been on the look out  for some time now.I liked the sandwich I had which was El Meson, very good and healthy and must say I didn't like avocado till now :P Never tried it and I did not pay attention to the ingredients on the board till it fell off my sandwich. I was thinking what makes this wich' so differ and it was the substitution of mayo.The chips they give are yummy also. My fave.I will be coming back to try some of their coffee and more sandwiches.Check it out!! Very friendly environment and the decor inside is lovely and inspirational to know Jesus love you.

43.description: Cafe el Meson is a bookstore foremost and cafe secondly. It would be a great place to relax with a fresh cup of coffee and good read.As for having lunch there, it is slightly disappointing. The El Meson sandwich is a great combination of flavors and fresh toppings. The sundried tomato focaccia bread was tastey but has since left a lingering flavor in my mouth.Although perhaps not the most fitting combination (and regardless of the 13 degree temp outside), I tried the Passion Fruit Frappe. Aside from the inescapable brain freeze, the frappe was delightful, a surprise given its overly simplistic ingredients.Overall, I enjoyed the experience but wished I had known it wasn't really an eatery, I was expecting something much more Panera-esque. I still wish there was a place like this near my house: cozy, relaxing, tastey, and reasonably priced.

2.description: By far one of my favorite cafes, the atmosphere is always great and the drinks are always spectacular. Everytime I go I am greeted by a warm smile the staff is amazing at making you feel right at home. I  recommend their signature Piña Colada you won't regret it!

18.description: Relaxing atmosphere. A great place to study or meet up with friends!The live music is fun.And the piña colada (house specialty) is definitely worth trying!

41.description: This place is great! It's reasonably priced, very yummy, and at a great location! We need more places like this in the hood.The owner is such a nice man, always nice to have a chat with him.

50.description: Very nice, CLEAN, quiet 2-story cafe with a decent selection of coffees, teas, snacks, shakes, frappes, and free wi-fi.If you live anywhere near this area then you know how something like this is a rare find.  I spoke with the manager who happens to work another job and simultaneously runs this place.  The book selection is mostly faith-based but no one pushes anything on you and it's usually open 'til 11 which happens to be a real blessing (no pun intended) in a neighborhood that's usually over-saturated with cheap bars and junk food.  They also have sandwiches and pastry snacks.

4.description: I am absolutely in love with place. They have the best sandwiches I've tasted in a long time. You have to try there steamer it has amaretto and coco it was delicious. The owner was so nice and welcoming I will definitely be back.

6.description: Small latte for 2.97 total. Lovely girl at register. Other reviews mentioned good food. I didn't have anything. This is a great spot in an area there isn't much. Will return!!

22.description: Love the cozy environment. This is definitely one of my to go places when I need to focus on some assignments. You MUST try their cafe de coco. It is delicious. I gave the cafe four out of five stars for the simple matter that I have attended the cafe twice when wifi connection seemed to be an  issue .

15.description: Service is always great here. They always seem to do a little extra for every customer. I've never had a bad moment here. Their sandwiches are great. Healthy taste and fill you up, food is always fresh.

20.description: Relaxing atmosphere. A great place to study or meet up with friends!The live music is fun.And the piña colada (house specialty) is definitely worth trying!

36.description: I've been back a few times. A few times they couldn't make my coffee frappuccino because they were missing a piece. Finally, they were able to make it and the tuna sandwich is still yummy.....happy me! The people that work there are so nice!

14.description: What a great place! It's such a peaceful environment, and their food is delicious! Definitely recommend this place. And try the Oreo milkshake with double shot of espresso!

3.description: I believe this is a Mexican style grilled chicken joint. I loved it!Tortillas and pollo asadoTits!!!

1.description: Been back a few times now. Bumping it up a star.The seasoned chicken is good. I'm still a fan of the mashed potatoes.Servers are nice and friendly, but sometimes a little inattentive once you get your food.Will have to stop in on a Tuesday or Wednesday with the free half chicken deal when you buy a whole chicken.I'm just not sure why they serve drinks and water in styrofoam cups when dining in. Bad for environment.

2.description: Hidden Gem. I say the chicken here might be even better than Nando's Peri Peri but they don't have that great Peri Peri sauce. Price is decent not a bad grilled chicken joint.

5.description: The only good thing that this restaurant has to offer is their rotisserie tasty chicken, its tender, juicy and delicious. I would recommend placing an order first if you plan for a pickup...slow service.   The restaurant is kept clean and the staff isn't very attentive when dining in...overall, it's worth checking this place.

0.description: SO GOOD! They recently remodeled, added stuff to the menu and its great. I love their chicken, adobo style is awesome. Their mashed potatoes are good also, I highly recommend this place. I would stay away from the firjoles sopa and their juice bar. But that is me. I love their cole slaw also. I love that my work is close to here, kinda. PS, this place is close to my fav taco joint, Paco's Tacos.

4.description: BEST, I mean BEST chicken anywhere! Marinaded in a yellow-orange color, flattened into something that resembles the Cingular logo, and roasted on a gas grill to perfection. Out of the way for me normally since I'm in the NW burbs, but if I'm in the Midway area, I'd definitely stop here for dinner. For the price of a combo with chicken, rice and beans, you can't beat their deal at any chicken chain in Chicago. And you definitely can't beat the flavor. I asked Noe, the owner, what goes into his marinade and it's a secret, maybe as old as the Aztec culture. The interior is very clean and nicely decorated, without being excessive. The art on the walls is interesting too.

28.description: The food is decent here. Quesadilla de flor de callabaza is excelent. However, we always have very slow service. One time we even had to leave without our order, and we only ordered tamales which they just had to heat up.

1.description: The food is good but I'm always effy to go since my sister and my boyfriend have gotten food poisoning from this place. The last time I went the tacos were great, the service is horrible but that's nothing new. They need to upgrade their servers and get some friendly people in there because my once have I had a good server in there. I have had good and bad experiences here. Also, the shakes are like $4 for a "large" but the cup they bring you is ridiculously small.

9.description: The food is great, but the service is terrible. They had us waiting for our order. The did not bring the drinks until we reminded them. Brought the wrong order and they even argued.

29.description: I LOVE this place's burritos de carne asada! mmm mmm mmm my mouth waters just thinking of them! This little place is fantastic, the servers are friendly and the milkshakes are awesome! It's a small place and it can often times be crowded, but its worth the wait! Woohoo! As good as it gets!

23.description: Honestly, if I could vote zero stars I would. I was getting a head start on my order and decided to call before I showed up. I would let the phone ring for about two minutes each time. I called a total of nine times! I finally get their place my order. I decided, "let me try calling while I'm inside to see if the phone works. I dial the phone in the restaurant rings and not any of the "waiting staff" moves to pick up the phone. When This restaurant initially opened their service was great. Their food hasn't lost any quality since, But their service is definitely lacking. When they first opened they had so many waitresses they would run into each other. It seems the owner got greedy and decided to cut staff in order to make more profit. Which in turn, affected their service. Their great product keeps me coming. Their service is scaring customers away. I haven't seen the owner around, probably due to the fact that they opened up another restaurant. If and when I do see him I'll make sure to let him know what I think about their service.

5.description: Had dinner with my mother and brother in law. Everything was great as always. Great service by Christina again!

31.description: My marvelous host insisted on having our morning business meeting here this morning. I insisted I wasn't hungry....until we arrived.Yum. Huevos con chuletas de puerco. Awesome potatoes, refried beans, eggs and pork chops.As I told my host, we can have our business meetings here any time.

25.description: Horrible Service! Waitresses forget your order, bring you the wrong order, and it takes close to an hour for your food to come out! They spend their time talking amongst eachother instead of focusing on their guests' needs. Definitely NOT going back there.

12.description: speaking for the food..very good and cheap..been coming here since i was a senior in hs..i had almost everything in their menu i recommend mostly everything lolthey're open till 5am on weekends which makes it a perfect place to go to after a night outservice is eh..some days they're "alright" others they're bad..never great..management needs to keep a big eye on them in my opinion

37.description: So once you get out of the club at about 3am in the morning either on a friday or saturday night, then you start to think that you are feeling a bit hungry after all that dancing.Well that was what happened in my case and I was looking for a place to eat something good and at reasonable price. I found out about this place through my brother who had already gone here numerous times but kept it secret.Their tacos is the best thing for me. Specially the tripe tacos are delicious. The place is well decorated and fairly new. Waitresses are friendly and always with a smile on. The best thing is that they close until 4am. which is good if the club closes down at 3 =)I will definitely come back here to get some more of those tacos.

21.description: This place has EXCELLENT All Authentic Mexican Food. Try coming here for tacos they are in my list the best of any other place even though there are also good taco places out there but these tacos are sure my very favorite of any place. Honestly any thing you see on their menu is all so good no doubt about it. They also have fresh squeezed orange juice and carrot juice those are also very good. This place is always very clean even when they are very busy. Parking in the back I give this place my 5 STARS

16.description: yes it is true, the service is terrible. yes it is true, some of the servers don't even speak english. (which is probably okay for the demographic in this neighborhood as is with me) yes it is true, when i ordered my horchata the waitress said they had to make it so it would take longer and so she ended up forgetting entirely. but yes, it is also true that the food is excellent. and so I put up with it.

17.description: First off, the place is BYOB which is a definite plus. Whenever I go here with friends, we usually get the same waiter and he treats us like actual human beings. The food is just as good as the price. I recommend you to go here.

10.description: I always CAME to eat here, but after today I will never order from here again. I ordered the pozole and it looked a little funny but I decided to give it a try bcuz I never had an issue with the food from here before. Pozole is supposed to have meat but it was served to me with nothing but fat and bones. After I asked it it was ok to exchange it because it had a funny smell to it and tasted like water. (No flavor) they said yes and a few minutes later the waitress came back with the same plate and said the manager said the pozole is fine and that they would charge me for it. Terrible customer service.

11.description: I loved this place i mean the food very good and i would always eat here. But lately ive been ordering for delivery and they always messing up my order. I asked for tacos ,burritos and a shrimp cocktail. They only gave me one red sauce!and the burrito was supper sloppy no cream or cheese and alot of lettuce! :/ the shrimp cocktail had only like 5 shrimp no lie .and didnt come with crackers .the cashiers whats so ever are so rude. I dont think i will be eating anytime soon here

26.description: If you are in the Brighton Park area, and are in a mood for delicious Mexican food, this is the place to go!  Their prices are reasonable and the place is CLEAN!!!

27.description: Great food & pricing. Very slow service.

35.description: Good food, and inexpensive too. This place is only a few blocks away, and is a great place to go after a night out. They have an outside 'patio' that I haven't had the chance to try out yet. The only downside is service. The girls there are not very friendly, and slow.Also, the place is pretty small and the tables are jammed all together. I will go back for the convenience.

8.description: Seriously service sucks in this place, it took our server about 20 minutes to give us our menu, then another 10 to take our order, our drinks came out about 20 minutes later. The tables around us had the best servers I wished I had one of them. I had to ask another server to bring us drinks and she was nice about it. I was so ready to walk out but I like food in this place. But it's not worth getting ignored like that, it wasn't even busy. Next time I'll just take a delivery.  The 3 stars are for the food only. At the end the food was the best part and the server got better at the end.

0.description: Surprised to see such mixed reviews for this place, as I have been coming here for years and consistently love it. Food is great, some of my favorite Mexican in Chicago. Also, in contrast to many great taquerias, this restaurant has cute seating in a nice, clean, well decorated atmosphere, and outdoor seating. It is as affordable as any other taco place but with a bigger menu. They have great fajitas and I love their filete a la diabla. So spicy and tasty. Tip: come in for breakfast too! Awesome omelette and pancakes. Total cure for a hangover. They also have some customer parking and you can byob

20.description: Extremely rude and careless employees. Placed order for delivery "una taquiza", (20 tacos).. was asked to please hold, said OK assuming they were busy. . 4 minutes later a different person asking for my order. Asked for taquiza 10 asada, 10 tripas very well done.. was asked "well done" I replied yes please. I have previously ordered and they seem to always ignore my request of having Tripas well done. Complimented on there good food but asked to please my request, but with a bad attitude the waitress put me on hold for 5mins.. spoke to different waitress on phone and repeated entire order and request.  She finally "wrote it down" and said I would get delivery within hour. I said I wanted to pay partial cred card and partial cash. Was told I couldn't do that. I said I've done it b4... was placed on hold again for another 4mins, and spoke to someone different.  Repeated everything including my payment method and she was finally able to process order successfully.  After more than one hour of waiting the food finally arives.. cold, and my Tripas non cooked throughly as I requested and practically begged for.. tipped delivery man anyways cause he was not at fault.  But really disappointed with El rey tacis. Good food but run by terrible employees.  The owner should hire quality over quantity.  Great food being destroyed by careless people with little to none concern with the public.  That is how great businesses fail.. apparently am not the only one disgusted by awful service here.. would rate negative stars if possible. .

19.description: Came here with a restaurant.com certificate.Waitress was nice and attentive. Answered my questions.We ordered:Horchata - seemed a bit weakSome hot drink that was like oatmeal - pretty goodSteak dinner - Flavorful and nice and tenderSteak Burrito - A bit smaller than most places, but still good. I got it with lettuce, tomato, sour cream and told them to put just a little cheese and it was good.Tamales - I'm not a big tamales fan, but just decided to try them. Got a red and green one. The red one was pork and it was a bit overcooked on the edges. Either it was microwaved or steamed and left out so it started to harden. The pork and the flavoring was nice though. I took the chicken to go and ate that a few hours later and it was good. Not dry like the other one.The guy at the cash register was nice and friendly. I thought they were having issues with the coupon, but he said no. Very clean and laid back. Would definitely be back. Only thing was when I asked to get my stuff wrapped, she came back and then we sat there waiting for the check for awhile, but I guess we are suppose to go up and pay. No biggie!

33.description: Came here with a restaurant.com certificate.Waitress was nice and attentive. Answered my questions.We ordered:Horchata - seemed a bit weakSome hot drink that was like oatmeal - pretty goodSteak dinner - Flavorful and nice and tenderSteak Burrito - A bit smaller than most places, but still good. I got it with lettuce, tomato, sour cream and told them to put just a little cheese and it was good.Tamales - I'm not a big tamales fan, but just decided to try them. Got a red and green one. The red one was pork and it was a bit overcooked on the edges. Either it was microwaved or steamed and left out so it started to harden. The pork and the flavoring was nice though. I took the chicken to go and ate that a few hours later and it was good. Not dry like the other one.The guy at the cash register was nice and friendly. I thought they were having issues with the coupon, but he said no. Very clean and laid back. Would definitely be back. Only thing was when I asked to get my stuff wrapped, she came back and then we sat there waiting for the check for awhile, but I guess we are suppose to go up and pay. No biggie!

2.description: Good tacos to order considering they're right around the corner in my neighborhood. This day i thought I would try the camarones a la diabla . Too spicy to eat and enjoy. The rice was good and they give you enough shrimp but I just couldn't eat them. I can handle my spicy food but not this. As for the rest of the food the burrito is my favorite. It doesn't have pieces of fat that I hate to find in one of my bites. This place is inexpensive and the food is good.

34.description: It was 2:30 AM on a Saturday morning and I wasn't in the mood for Huck Finn.  A friend of mine told me that El Rey was open and it was not to far from the place we were at.Although I have driven past this place many, many times; I never ate there.  I went inside with a group 3 and the service was freindly and fast.  I was surprised to see huaraches on the menu.  I don't find many places that sell them.The huarache was delicious.  So much so that I will go order another one this Saturday morning....lol  Can't wait!

32.description: I had lunch here yesterday with my husband.  We'd had their tacos as take-out once before and wanted to check out eating at the restaurant.What a find!  There aren't too many tables, but they are nice marble.  The place was busy but not too crowded.  The walls are a mix of exposed brick and nice tile.  There a whole bunch of cool black-and-white pictures from, what I guess, old Mexican movies from the 1930's-50's.More importantly, the food was great, especially for a taqueria.   I had the enchiladas suizas, great.  My husband got the steak fajitas which were very good.  The pieces of meat were good size chunks of quality meat.  We also got an order of the grilled cebollitas, which were delicious, I could eat just a plate of those.Another plus is they give big slices of avocado along with the lettuce and tomato.  It doesn't cost extra like at every other taqueria or Mexican restaurant.The service was very good.  Prompt and courteous.We will definitely be going back, especially in the summer to check-out their patio.  There's also a small parking lot in the back.Check this place out!

18.description: Horrible phone service !!!.. it took me 24 minutes to finally speak to someone and when I finally did she kept having a side conversation,  she kept asking "so what would you like to order?" As I proceed with my order she cut me off and kept conversing with the other individual and then would ask me again and again the same question "so what would you like to order", and I understand it might get crazy busy but at least she should've apologize.   I live near by and I just wanted to oder ahead of time, and most likely I will not order from here again, I most definitely update later on the food.

13.description: Horrible I came for two tacos on a day that wasn't so busy . Took them about 30 minutes to come out , food is good depending on who makes it. There's days were it wasn't good and days that it was . Service is horrible , my waitress messed up my order about 3 times in ten minutes . But hey this isn't the first complain about the waiters and won't be the last until REY does something about it.

4.description: The tacos, burritos, tortas and enchiladas are delicious! Seafood is also good, but I don't recommend ordering the ceviche, it was way too sweet and watery..

24.description: This review is long overdue. I've been eating at El Rey since the doors opened years ago. After trying out many Mexican restaurants all over the city of Chicago, El Rey is hands down my favorite. You really can't beat this place. Everything is delicious and the service is always friendly. Please open a location on the north side! We love you!

6.description: I detest this restaurant which is 1 block from my house! They over work their employees (hence the constant waitress wanted signs), they have very few staff for high volume of deliveries/dining. They are horribly sexist and so perverted with their waitresses, last time I went over 2 yrs. ago I saw several walk around the counter just to avoid this disgusting manager who just ate them with his eyes (customers too). The food is too salty for my taste. And final warning: watch out for your car! A lot of drunks go there after parties to 'sober up' and many many cars get hit, especially on California.

22.description: Horrible horrible horrible horrible service.  Management hired retards. Never going back.

15.description: This place has EXCELLENT All Authentic Mexican Food. Try coming here for tacos they are in my list the best of any other place even though there are also good taco places out there but these tacos are sure my very favorite of any place. Honestly any thing you see on their menu is all so good no doubt about it. They also have fresh squeezed orange juice and carrot juice those are also very good. This place is always very clean even when they are very busy. Parking in the back I give this place my 5 STARS

7.description: I love this place, as well as my whole family, and pretty much everyone we introduce this place to. Their food is so yum, but I always get tacos and the salsa is good (very spicy though). The service can be kind of slow sometimes, but the waitresses are nice. But they've messed up my order a few times, so especially if you decide to order out, double check. I always get the wrong meat with mine and didn't want onion and cilantro but they were in all of them...Still tasted pretty good for the most part, except one variation that I didn't know what it was but definitely not steak taco. So I was quite disappointed. Double check. But I highly recommend just dining in, so they can fix your order which I had to once when I dined in.Overall, I still love the food from this place. I learned my lesson taking out though. I'll still be going here ! :)

36.description: I was in the mood for a Mexican breakfast and I didn't want to go all the way to Zacatacos.  Our friend recommended El Rey. He said it was clean, great service and delicious food.  I live in the Pilsen area so it's nothing for me to cruise down Archer to El Rey (California and Archer).I ordered the Huevos a la Mexicana and my bf got Huevos Rancheros with egg whites. So delicious! Really good salsa, fluffy and delicious Mexican rice and the eggs were so yummy.  Nothing was greasy. The coffee was cinnamon-y and delicious as well. The service was fast and friendly and our bill was $13 for both of us. I will for sure go back. Oh! The decor is really cute and it's really clean, not that it matters. I can't wait to try their lunch or dinner!

30.description: This taco restaurant have " alright" taco's and gorditas. The only downfall is their service is way to S-L-O-W.. I would recommend to call in your order in.

3.description: My #1 spot for tacos. I bring all my friends here and everyone loves it. You can never go wrong with tacos. My favorite are the steak tacos! The meat is so fresh and tender and the veggies that come with it too. I'm even in love with their chips and salsa. The chips are perfectly baked and are not too greasy or plain as you'll find in other Mexican spots.If you're not in the mood for tacos, their chicken tostada is also delish I've tried their quesadillas too. They're okay, but too much tortilla for my taste and not enough cheese and the other good stuff. As much as I love their food I have to admit that their service can be off most of the time. During peal hours they take forever to even acknowledge that you are even there waiting for a menu. The waiters themselves are always so nice and lovely- they just need to learn how to staff the place appropriately.

14.description: Horrible service to a faithful customer ! With that being said I will never order there again . The girls who work there have attitudes toward people while taking your orders . Phone service sucks , they don't know english well so I ordered in spanish and still got nowhere ????? Delivery always over a hour and i live 5 minutes away from the place . And getting the wrong food is a definite yes ! Years of this stop today. Hope the owner gets on top of his workers because these girls talk to you like your a rival gang member . So watch out people this place is a "NO GO" !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

1.description: Ugh seriously this place takes forever to cook our food ! I waited at least an hour or more! They only have 1 chef! Seriously ? -_-

2.description: Wanted to try something new but hey took forever to take my order and the place was nearly empty so long that I ended up leaving

0.description: Stopped into try this place on of all days Easter Sunday. Not too many places were open and we were in the area. The menu was suprising....tortas ok, but Russian, Hawaiian, and Cuban style??!! (there were more I just cannot remember the others)We stuck to normal fare because you cannot go wrong with tacos, enchiladas, a burrito and a carne asada torta. The food was great!  The salsa was really good. I had 3 tacos and I could have made it into 5 with all the meat that they gave. The red enchiladas that my stepson ordered were different than other places, but they were very good. The sauce almost had a sweet taste to it. My husband ordered a burrito, which surprisingly came with refried black beans and not pinto. My husband was VERY happy about this. He is Costa Rican and black beans are a staple.Very good service...we are going back to try some of the other menu items next time!

28.description: Pretty awesome shrimp and chicken strips at a pretty good price. Friendly service. No booths, so it is strictly carry out. Interior is sparse and unpretentious.

1.description: I was looking for a seafood place in the area and this sounded promising.  I got catfish strips, shrimp and mushrooms.   I really liked the mushrooms.   The shrimp was good as well.  But the catfish was just so-so.   Next time, I'll stick to the shrimp like the name says.

9.description: Tried it today after reading the reviews on yelp. No, it's not as good as Lawrence Fisheries, yet just as pricey. The sauce is a bit bland. All the food was fresh and delicious. I did like the variety of different shrimp offered. You won't be disappointed by this place no doubt. But LF still rules.

29.description: Best fried shrimp in the city!

23.description: OMGosh I almost forgot how awesome this place is.. the fried shrimp is FRESH and o so good. I can't speak for anything else since I only get shrimp.. its a plain store front with a line out the door on most days so be ready to wait a bit. All are cooked to order and the smell in this place will drive you bananas.MM MM MM :) Makes me happy

5.description: Only complaint, everything is to-go only.But aside from that I feel the shrimp here has never been surpased in the flavor section in my book. I usually get the Chicago and the jumbo. Be aware you are going to walk out with a bit of a hefty bill , but as most people know, seafood tends to be on the expenseive side of the food pyramid.

31.description: Frank's is a take-out restaurant, so be prepared. Yet, they have the best fried seafood in the city. Really.Please try their Chicago shrimp. The coating is a little spicy, and oh, so delicious! All seafood is fried to perfection --- crispy, crusty brown on the outside, and perfectly done on the inside --- juicy and tender. These shrimp are huge! They have even bigger shrimps with their regular coating. I have been all over the city in my days searching for the perfect shrimp. Frank's is it.

25.description: So far, Frank's has the best shrimps in the city!  The house is clean and simple.  No frills, just good food.  Excellent!!

12.description: My boyfriend and I arrived in Chicago one Friday evening and wanted to get something quick and tasty to eat before we embarked on a journey to our friends' wedding location about an hour away. Browsing Yelp restaurants near Midway, I heard the word "shrimp" and was sold. The shrimp here is definitely solid. We got an order of the New Orleans and an order of the standard jumbo shrimp. The shrimp was fresh and tasty. The batter on the jumbo shrimp was a bit on the bland side, but the spices in the New Orleans version were quite nice. The fries and such were also good, and the prices seemed pretty standard. Service was very friendly and the guy at the counter was very helpful when we were trying to decide what to order.  Overall, I'd say this is a solid shrimp place, though we had better seafood later in the trip.

21.description: Shrimp is so good. I was surprised this lil joint had the good yummy stuff

16.description: I had the shrimp. They were so good. It was jumbo shrimp and wasnt over breaded and cooked just prefect. I also had the scallops. I've never had a fried scallop but these were cooked prefectly. They were so tender... I cant wait to go back there again.

17.description: OMGosh I almost forgot how awesome this place is.. the fried shrimp is FRESH and o so good. I can't speak for anything else since I only get shrimp.. its a plain store front with a line out the door on most days so be ready to wait a bit. All are cooked to order and the smell in this place will drive you bananas.MM MM MM :) Makes me happy

10.description: Gulf Shrimp Dinner: Half pound of large Gulf Shrimp, fries, macaroni salad, hot sauce. Great! Fries and shrimp are fried after ordering, so everything is hot and fresh. Gotta eat it quick. Shrimp was tasty!

11.description: I'm not a big fried shrimp fan, but these were good. Definitely like everyone says, better than Lawrence's. The fried chicken strips were good. Fried perch were good, but the oysters were small.Breading is definitely better here, but I wasn't too fond of the sauce.

26.description: Frank's has the best shrimp in the city!!! And the spicy mild sauce is the best. This spot can never make a bad move. It's simple, fast and delicious shrimp. Always get the Chicago style shrimp! if you are on budget get the New Orleans shrimp. it's a smaller shrimp, but the breading is the same as the Chicago and they are cheaper by the pound.

27.description: Frank's definitely has the best shirmp in the city!  Sorry Lawerance's shrimp on Canal street but Frank's is in the HOUSE!Frank's by far out beats other shimp shacks in the city.  The service is fast and best of all accepts credit cards!

0.description: I have tried almost everything here, but their shrimp... I just don't eat shrimp. Not my thing. Don't judge. I personally loooove their clam strips, fries, mild/hot sauce, perch and chicken strips! The food is always made to order so it is ALWAYS hot! At Frank's they are friendly and willing to give you suggestions if you are a noobie there.

20.description: My boyfriend and I arrived in Chicago one Friday evening and wanted to get something quick and tasty to eat before we embarked on a journey to our friends' wedding location about an hour away. Browsing Yelp restaurants near Midway, I heard the word "shrimp" and was sold. The shrimp here is definitely solid. We got an order of the New Orleans and an order of the standard jumbo shrimp. The shrimp was fresh and tasty. The batter on the jumbo shrimp was a bit on the bland side, but the spices in the New Orleans version were quite nice. The fries and such were also good, and the prices seemed pretty standard. Service was very friendly and the guy at the counter was very helpful when we were trying to decide what to order.  Overall, I'd say this is a solid shrimp place, though we had better seafood later in the trip.

19.description: For a person who does not like  seafood of any kind like myself this place is life changing! My husband made me try the clam strips and boy was I happily surprised. Actually I'm on my way out for some now. My husband loves pretty much everything on the menu and I love the chicken with mild dauce. Font forget the sauce!!@@

2.description: I like going this place when I am not near lawerence fisheries on canal st. This is not a sit in restaurant only pick ups. I had the fried oysters and jumbo shrimps this time around and thought both were a good portion size. Everything is made to order so your order is piping hot! The French fries are pretty good as well.

18.description: For a lb of fried shrimp Chicago knows no better than Frank's Chicago Shrimp. They weigh and bread the shrimp infront of you, so you know its fresh. Chicago style is a must. The price is about the same as any shrimp house, maybe slightly less.  Beware, even though it never takes long from the time you order to the time those delicious little fried suckers touch your lips, its  hot in that little place.  The Hot cocktail sauce is pretty good, but not the best in town. I love technology, not as much as shrimp you see, still love technology, always and forever.

13.description: Best shrimp in the city! I love Lawrences and Franks has them beat! Try the Chicago style and the clam strips. High five! Flippin awesome.

4.description: 1/2 pound of Chicago style shrimp, 1/2 pound of jumbo and an order of calamari, with an extra tub of spicy sauce will run you about $18 dollars with tax.  A tub of your selection of sauce comes with, it's a few ounces of sauce but its enough.  I only wish they offered  a lemon wedge for the calamari.Frank's is a carry out establishment.  It's a small storefront with a couple guys and a couple fryers.  Check out their current pricing, take a minute to form your order and then sit and wait.  It can take about fifteen to twenty minutes since they start frying at the time of your order.Much of their other items are frozen but their shrimp is always good.  I highly recommend Chicago style and jumbo shrimp.  Franks has had a few locations throughout Chicago, so it isn't necessary to drive all the way out here and luckily every location serves the same good stuff.  "Best fried skrimps in the city"

24.description: I'm not a big fried shrimp fan, but these were good. Definitely like everyone says, better than Lawrence's. The fried chicken strips were good. Fried perch were good, but the oysters were small.Breading is definitely better here, but I wasn't too fond of the sauce.

6.description: Good fresh flavor and variety of fish and shrimp i have gone back at least 10 times in a 2 month span.

22.description: For a lb of fried shrimp Chicago knows no better than Frank's Chicago Shrimp. They weigh and bread the shrimp infront of you, so you know its fresh. Chicago style is a must. The price is about the same as any shrimp house, maybe slightly less.  Beware, even though it never takes long from the time you order to the time those delicious little fried suckers touch your lips, its  hot in that little place.  The Hot cocktail sauce is pretty good, but not the best in town. I love technology, not as much as shrimp you see, still love technology, always and forever.

15.description: Chefs frequent this establishment and for once have few complaints.

7.description: Very good, my only complaint are the prices. Seems all shrimp shacks here are expensive, but I'll treat myself if its worth it. I guess that's what they are counting on....I'll be back!!

8.description: Always fast, fresh & friendly! It is one of my family's favorite pit stops

30.description: delicious shrimp and chicken strips.  make sure you have cash.  they don't take credit...i learned the hard way.

3.description: Great shrimp and big variety of sides. To Go only! No seating. The Chicago Style Shrimp is my favorite. They used to have delicious hot sauce but it seems to have become super vinegary and not really hot so I skip the hot sauce now. Tried the onion rings and zucchini today. The zucchini was good. It's cut into slices and is deep fried nice and crispy with a tender center. The onion rings were ok. They are cut very thin and the coating is thin.
