Like really. We are the customers and we get treated like garbage. I called next day and the owner mike didn't even care to hear about it.. Needless to say I'm never going back. If you want to support a business that treats people horribly go there if not stay away and tell everyone you know!! The only reason I gave 1 star is because I had to...

14.description: The pizza is super tasty. Excellent butter crust and sweet tomato sauce. Easily the cheapest date in town. Economic, humongous slices & domestic beer pitchers. The service is not great, but the food will outweigh the service. Watch a game or shoot pool while you wait. If you're  really hungry go for the panzerotti--I think it was made in heaven.

3.description: Ana is amazing! Came in so much pain. Shed a few tears to release mental & physical stress during the massage. Pains just melted away. Immediately rebooked more 90 minute appointments. Convenient southside location & online booking option. Comfortable & relaxing room.

1.description: Sweet Anna had the best massage hands! I was in excruciating pain and left with nearly no pain and de stressed. I will definitely be back! I parked on the side street which was very convenient.

2.description: Ana is wonderful! She is sweet, responsive to requests, and really strong. And she often has great deals!  I highly recommend her!

5.description: I was in so much pain before my massage. I left feeling like a new woman. Ana knows her Craft well! Service was easy to book either online or over the phone. The office is clean and inviting.

0.description: Holistic Pathways Massage is a very well-run and courteous business. Ana is a terrific masseuse and she really knows what she is doing. Not only is she receptive to what my body is telling her, she is also capable of massaging muscles I didn't even know were bothering me. Definitely recommend her!

4.description: If you live on the southside of the City, it always takes a big time commitment to get a massage once you add in all of the travel time. I was so glad to find Ana through her Amazon Local Deal - a masseuse on the south side! Ana's technique is great. I will be returning, and I am sending my husband.

3.description: This place is the best. If u are looking for freshly made Mexican food you've come to the right place! They were very friendly and took special requests. They have quality food that will make you drive for miles just to have it again. The asada tacos are fantastic and the tortas are amazing. But every thing is good here. I've had it all! They have agua de horchata and Jamaica too. But remember to bring cash, it's cash only! They also have the special guacamole salsa that that comes with the crunchy and savory chips and the combination is out of this world! The chips are made at the restaurant fresh everyday. If you go on the weekend you will be able to get delicious menudo too!! I like to come a lot and hope you do too, because honestly it can't get any better than this:) You have to give it a try!

1.description: Love this place. Right in the corner of Kedzie and 37th. Small place but great food. I eat here every time I'm in the area.They have this green salsa made from Aguacate for those who don't know, its pretty damn good!

2.description: Great tacos made with lean meats & soft tortillas. Nothing fancy! Just onions & cilantro. If you are near Kedzie & 38th Street, make sure to stop by. Cash only but they have a ATM machine inside. This place is located near the Kedzie entrance by I-55.

0.description: If you want fresh Mexican food that tastes GREAT and you are close to the area, come HERE. The place looks like a hole in the wall and that I'm sure will turn people away but give it a try. Honestly just order one steak or chicken taco and you will be hooked. The steak is so tender and the chicken so juicy. I personally prefer the steak Tortas but honestly nothing is going to disappoint. Another great thing is the chips and salsa that they give you complimentary are great. Yes, I know every Mexican restaurant does that but the quality is fantastic. These chips are fantastic however, lightly salted, not drenched in oil, and taste fresh. One of the salsas they give you is a avocado based one(it's kind of guac but not the same people may not be used to. Almost like a purée and it's got a kick to it) and it is fantastic and great to put on any of your tacos, Tortas, or burritos.Long story short, give this place a try if you like good Mexican food that stands out :-D

4.description: This place has some of the freshest Mexican food in the neighborhood, I really enjoy the Tacos from La Iguanita and wish this place was given a chance because my fear is this place will go out of business because of the lack of customers. I'm here trying to change that

3.description: Hmmm where should I start? Service is horrible...appetizers never made it to the table..fork didn't either...omg and music super loud!!!ugh...fries yummy and rice...ordered the stuffed pineapple and it looked like a pineapple exploded cheese lol...I do not recommend it at all!

1.description: 1st impression...music too loud - I mean deafening loud.. the food wasn't that great at all. The service kept forgetting simple requests like silverware. The food was ok but if you can barely hear who you are with and not even be able to use silverware to eat your food? They even forgot our appetizer - this place is horrible avoid at all costs.

2.description: So the wife and I were craving some good ol Mexican seafood. Didn't feel like heading to the Ashland and Augusta location(they really are awesome over there, just bad parking and too small for Friday night) And didn't quite wanna head to 66th and Pulaski either. So thanks to google I came across this Brighton park location, so new the most recent google pic was when it was a closed down banquet hall. Right off the bat I had a comfy feel for it for these reasons:1) A quick shot off 55 exiting at Kedzie or Pulaski2) Lot with ample parking3) Although they DO HAVE a liquor license, I brought my 6 pack of pacifico and they still gave me the bucket with ice! ..AwesomenessStarted with the shrimp empanadas (4 for $6) and they are the perfect appetizer with the crispy shell and diced peppery shrimp. Ordered the langostinos in butter sauce, doesn't appear to be the season for these as they are huge in warm weather months. But nonetheless still very good. Wife had the stuffed fish with all the seafood you can think of, its phenomenal. So six beers and an undone zipper later I find myself very satisfied. The extra 15 min drive to Brighton park is well worth the convenience and lack of hassle. Good Service, Good food, Good portions, all at reasonable prices. This place is as good as it gets for Mexican Seafood.

5.description: The seafood was excellent. I can't say enough about the langostinos. This place unlike the Ashland location in that it has a liquor license, parking lot, and Mariachi Band! I am kind of partial to BYOB,not for the money but for the spontaneous choice of what to bring to dinner. Anywayyyy, this place is closer to the house and having a parking lot is quite convenient. There are a lot of "Marisco" type of restaurants popping up! They don't match the quality of Veneno. I was in Nuevo Vallarta last week and passed a seafood place that I believe is family of the Chicago "El Veneno" restaurants. It was pretty cool!

6.description: I went to El Veneno with a friend on a Friday night,  To my suprise the place was not packed. We were able to pick out our seats and parking was plentyfull,  First of all I had to take a star off because I really don't like it when resturants allow solicitors. It was somewhat annoying being approached every few minutes by someone selling gum, movies, candy, ect.  Also the mariachi they had that night was awful, and if you ask me if the mariach is not provided  by the resturant (which they were not) they really shouldn't be there, especially in a space that small place like that.  I was really loving the whole BYOB, which is great.  The food was awsome.  We ordered empandas de camaron for an appitizer.  They were great.  I had the pinapple seafood platter which was pretty good, I kinda felt like they overstuffed it with octopuss as opposed to shrimps and scallops.  The food was pretty good, If I could give this place 31/2 stars I would.

0.description: For the neighborhood its definitely a gem...but there ain't much in the neighborhood. Large portions, decent price. I had fried Tilapia....loved it. I wish they had cocktail or horseradish sauce for the raw oysters though.My fiance didn't like it though....probably because my fish still had its head on when they served it to me.

4.description: I will never go to this place again first of all the table was dirty and sticky..we ordered empanadas and they ran out!!! then they bring our food which I ordered the Langostino estilo Nayarit which was very salty and the plate had alot grease on the bottom of the plate, they also forgot the garlic bread that is suppose to come with the entree. The music was very loud and they had a couple dancing, which had a dozen kids who were running around the place even bumping into our table...the service is horrible...Sorry El Veneno....La Palapa is way better!!!

0.description: I love Chelo's.  Being a south-side girl myself, the feel of the shop is very Kedzie and Archer feeling.  The first time I showed up at Chelo's it was due to a home bleach job on red hair gone awry.  I was carrot top on crack.  I wanted to cry I threw on a cap and jetted down Archer to the first salon I saw figuring it couldn't be any worse then what I had done to myself.  She got me to my natural hair color and spent the next year helping me get my hair back to a non-straw like texture.  I had fried it to no end.  She gave me hair care products that would prepare it for the next step and even opened on a Sunday for a friend's wedding to do all of our heads and the bride's mother. Con-Cash Only.  I never carry cash.

1.description: The place was hard to get to because of the road construction, and yes not their fault, what was a bummer is that no alcohol is served, its byob. Which would have been nice to see prior to arriving. They do sell a mixture for michelada's so it's still nice. The melted cheese with chorizo was delicious although you have to eat it warm or it hardens up. I ordered the platter of barbacoa and carintas, which was plentiful for one person. The carintas had more fat than I prefer. Rice water is not good, very flat flavor. The rice was fluffy and had a good taste. I did like that they gave my little one a glow in the dark necklace,  cute touch.

9.description: Yes they have good food... but at this place it's like a nice upscale bar they serve you a good drink and they charge you like you have to pay for the bartenders' retirement!! Ohhh I almost forgot!!! Check your bill they charge you taxes for the food then charge for the tip and THEN they charge you TAXES ON THE TIP!!! I'm not joking here people.

23.description: This place is a little bit further South than what I am used to travel, but I had a coupon from Restaurant.com and decided why not? I was nicely surprised about the place. Open layout, lots of space and light.  Had recently dined at My Tierra on 26th st and the place was dark and the food was terrible, so I was very pleased with the look and ambiance of this place. So now let me talk about the food and the service...The waiter was super attentive, and came to us right away. Made sure we liked our table and took care of our drinks and appetizer. The Pico de Gallo was HOT, but we were scooping it up with our chips like it was going out of style. All that was left were the jalapeno peppers, LOL.We ordered the Nachos, and WOW we were all over them, lol, they were very very good. We wanted to order a large, but the waiter said a small would be plenty for two people unless we were looking to take some home and he was right. My boyfriend ordered the enchiladas and they were very good. I ordered the Carne a la Tampiquena and was very very happy with the quality of the meat (nice and tender, perfectly cooked), I hate it when you get charged a high price for shoe leather. The waiter kept coming back and the service was excellent, he did a great job. I highly recommend this place.  A little bit our of the way for me, but we are definitely coming back for more!!! Great food, great service, what else can you ask for??

12.description: First of all, I LOVE carnitas... and this place does a nice job in satisfying my craving.  What I like most about this place is that it is family friendly.  When I come here, it is usually with my siblings, aunts and uncles.  It is a great spot for a Sunday brunch.  The food is delicious and they have a wide variety of dishes.  I really do enjoy this place!

21.description: ahi que deliciocio!  I went to this place after a friend raved about the food and the service.  I immediately took my family there and I was not disappointed.  The service was great, now there weren't to many people as we went late in the evening.  The carnitas were excellent and the torta my daughter ordered was great as well.  As the evening went on my toddler was getting fussy and the waiter was nice enough to bring her a kiddie play set, in the box unopened.  Now it was something taht was worth a whole lot but I was impressed that he was nice enough to have this on hand as I'm sure they get a lot of families there.  I also noticed another thing, I very familiar with the area having lived near for several years and I was very impressed to see a diverse crowd dining.  It's not to often to see Asians, Anglos, Latinos, and African Americans all dining in the same venue outside the trendy spots.  I will definitely go back and I plan on making it my destination for Sunday morning carnitas.  mmmmmmmm-caaaarrrrrrnitas.

16.description: unbelievable birrria and barbacoa at great pricesother items good too.great for dine in or carry out.it can get loud in there.

10.description: Very delicious food. I picked up some tacos for the road. They are not as good as zacatacos but they are good. Great customer service, clean and welcoming restaurant.  They also do catering. I had their carnitas at catered events and the food was always great. Clean bathrooms.

5.description: Honestly the best carnitas ever. Don't forget the baronas and the pico de gallo. So so so good. They even give you a sample when you wait in line. If you like delicious things and also like them wrapped in soft fluffy tortillas, then Don Rafa this way!

11.description: Love it! I've been here twice and it was outstanding both times. One of my favorite Mexican places in Chicago. Well worth the trip to Brighton Park.

22.description: I have one simple rule about picking restaurants in an area I'm not familiar with.   If it's crowded, it's gotta be good.  I used to work in the area quite a bit and I found Carnitas Don Rafa this way.  It's easy to pass by this place.  It doesn't look like much from out in front.  It does have a large free parking lot though.  Inside, it's a pleasant sit down restaurant with a cobblestone floor and dark wood accents.  The service is very good and not intrusive.  They speak english well.  Don Rafa is a great place to bring business associates if you are looking for a business lunch.For a while, I was addicted to their suizo carne asada burrito, a burrito smothered in ranchero sauce and about a pound of cheese.  I could only finish half and the rest was dinner.  The remainder of the menu consists of standard Mexician food prepared to perfection.  For people not familiar with Carnitas, imagine a Mexician pulled pork.  The fajitas are also very good.  I don't get to this part of the city much anymore but anytime I get w/in a 2 mile radius, I make a detour to Don Rafa's.

0.description: Fire! Carnitas are bomb, Tamales are bomb and I have heard great things about their other items. Great sit down place or carry out.

20.description: My SO and I stopped in to this neighborhood joint today after meandering through the spring carnival set up a few blocks away.  SO glad we did, but so bummed it took us this long to discover it.  I had the carnitas-dark pork served with refried beans, rice, corn tortillas, and cactus salad.  My better half got the baby goat (rib portion) which was even better.  We both got a couple peach margaritas which were a little light on the booze, but big on taste and super refreshing.  Final big plus is service, which was impeccable.  We'll be back for sure!

19.description: I come here often with friends,family and the bf. My boyfriend introduced me to this place 3 years ago. Ive been in love with it ever since. I love this place. Im here at least one,sometimes even twice a week. I love the chilequlies,tortas and the carnitas. Its uber busy in here on then weekends, with long lines fo people for the cartnitas. The tamales are okay. I love the margaritas yumo!

2.description: Only come here for the tortas and drinks. Very cheap and delicious. Kinda sad that they're very underrated, with the quality of their food, i expect a full house everytime i come in. Staff is very friendly and attentive. I recommend a torta don Rafa de asada and any of their frozen margaritas,daiquiris, or micheladas!As far as platillos go, i never really had em'. My cousin ordered a steak platillo with beans and rice and looked very good.

18.description: My SO and I stopped in to this neighborhood joint today after meandering through the spring carnival set up a few blocks away.  SO glad we did, but so bummed it took us this long to discover it.  I had the carnitas-dark pork served with refried beans, rice, corn tortillas, and cactus salad.  My better half got the baby goat (rib portion) which was even better.  We both got a couple peach margaritas which were a little light on the booze, but big on taste and super refreshing.  Final big plus is service, which was impeccable.  We'll be back for sure!

13.description: Definitely the place to go! I have had there Carnitas a well as plated dishes they are all soooo tasty. I have catered from them a couple times no complaints at all. Great customer service.

4.description: Great carnitas!!!! Very fresh, I love the menudo there too , only thing it's a little pricey, the earlier u get there on the weekend the shorter the line ;)

24.description: I wasn't sure what to expect from a place with the word "carnitas" in it.  One imagines a taco shop.  However, I finally tried their food at an art event for Bank of America.  The food is very simple Mexican home style cooking.  The meat was done to perfection.  Overall, very authentic.  However, it was the presentation that really sold me.  They did a really great job at dressing their food up for the event.

6.description: I have been coming here for a while, and let me tell you that the carnitas are delicious.... And what can I say about the barbacoa it's juicy, tender and they put this red sauce on top of it and it the perfect complement to it.. I sometimes eat in but for the most part I take it to go... The few times I eat in the waiters are very friendly and I never have to wait too long for my food... If you're in the area I recommend you try this place

15.description: I have one simple rule about picking restaurants in an area I'm not familiar with.   If it's crowded, it's gotta be good.  I used to work in the area quite a bit and I found Carnitas Don Rafa this way.  It's easy to pass by this place.  It doesn't look like much from out in front.  It does have a large free parking lot though.  Inside, it's a pleasant sit down restaurant with a cobblestone floor and dark wood accents.  The service is very good and not intrusive.  They speak english well.  Don Rafa is a great place to bring business associates if you are looking for a business lunch.For a while, I was addicted to their suizo carne asada burrito, a burrito smothered in ranchero sauce and about a pound of cheese.  I could only finish half and the rest was dinner.  The remainder of the menu consists of standard Mexician food prepared to perfection.  For people not familiar with Carnitas, imagine a Mexician pulled pork.  The fajitas are also very good.  I don't get to this part of the city much anymore but anytime I get w/in a 2 mile radius, I make a detour to Don Rafa's.

7.description: I didn't have the carnitas, instead I had los Chilaquiles Don Rafa; which come with cheese and bacon. They were pretty delicious, except the bacon, I love the stuff but they have no business with my chilaquiles. Aside from that they were very tasty and very filling. The rice was a bit bland, but the beans made up for it. Can't wait to go back!

8.description: First time here and i came with my mother and cousin.  She ordered the michoacan dinner I believe it was called.  After reading reviews online I decided to order the carnitas dinner. Love at first bite! A little pricey but the plates will fill your stomachs.

3.description: My go to torta spot when on the south side!! Torta don rafa!! Bread is always soft and fresh as soon as you take a bite the juicy meat melts in your mouth with the yummy beans crema and avocado MMMMMMM SO GOOD! I never understand how people mess up tortas at other taco joints but this place always has it down!!! After being a year long customer never have i had a bad meal here everythings always perfect!! fromtheir tender juicy meats to the margaritas and horchata. Even had the fried ice cream before and it was awesome! The atmosphere is great never too crazy musics never too loud or too crowded always friendly service and very clean. I dont know what method they use to cook their carnitas or carne asada but WOW Hope you guys never change it! This place is highly underrated and a gem in this area!

14.description: I haven't been here in a while, but it has been a staple for my family. To my knowledge, it's the only place we ever get Carnitas and they are always delicious! nom nom nom.

0.description: This has been open only a few months. We stopped in to check it out and it's clean and bright. We'll see how long that lasts.

3.description: I found out about this place earlier on in the year. Used to be a huge fan of one of their competitors until my first visit here. Customer service is great, no attitudes. I appreciate the fact that if you don't like something on your plate you can remove it and replace it with something else. One of my favorite dish is the langostinos California because of the spice. I also love the piña rellena minus the oysters (personal choice). I recommend the one in the creamy sauce. I've liked every dish that I have ordered from here. One more thing it's byob CAN ONLY so don't be surprised if they hold your bottled beer at the entrance. Enjoy your beer with a killer michelada!

1.description: Amazingggggg I got a dish with octopus, shrimp cheese stuffed in a tilapia filet. Server was great. Don't wear heels tho! Gravel floor!

0.description: This Nayarit style seafood place is a real diamond in the rough. (Bear in mind , you're here because the food is delicious not because you like the dropped ceilings  and banquet table decor )As soon as you sit ,each person at the table gets a ceviche tostada ( on the house). Ground mystery fish with nice cucumber and tomato cubes on a crisp , salt laced , tostada . I ordered the Caldo de pescado  ( fish soup) . I also wanted some octopus, in there, so the server placed a special order for the kitchen. The broth is very lightly seasoned and came with an extremely generous portion of both tilapia fillets and octopus. (You can also order it with bone in catfish steaks.) Accompanied by grilled garlic bread ,some cilantro , limes and chopped onions , there was so much food I had to take a doggy bag. I sat by the kitchen pick up window and watched as the orders were being sent out. Nice selection of seafood cocktails, fried fish and shellfish entrées as well. The seafood stuffed pineapple looked delicious . That's what I'm ordering when come back .

2.description: They have very good Mexican seafood. Try the fillete rellano and the langostino's. They're delicious. I have been here at least 10 times over the years and I am never dissapointed. The food is very authentic yet very different from traditional American seafood. I would definitely be going back and have already recommended them to lots of family and friends.

5.description: Good food great service and did I mention cheap!!!! First time here with the fam and had a great experience, definitely coming back soon

6.description: I've been going to El Kora for a few years now.  My family and I absolutely love it! I've tried their competitors and this place by far is much better. They have a great customer service.  Everytime we go in we feel welcome.  The waitress Rosario just goes above and beyond. My favorite is the stuffed pineapple with the creamy sauce, but everything is so good, even the rice!!! It's a BYOB place, no bottles allowed, which is fine with me.

7.description: I have been here twice. The food is good. A little overpriced in comparison to the famous  El Veneno restaurant. Only difference here is that their service is not what you expected from a small business. They overprice their luke warm horchata, even with ice it is still warm. 3 dollars for a 16 oz glass of that warm horchata. Restaurant is BYOB, but make sure it's canned. We took bottles and they confiscated it until we were ready to leave.

8.description: Looking for a good seafood place? Too bad, its a Marisco place. This place is located two blocks east of Kedzie, on a side street corner, but you will probably miss it. Their tiny parking lot is on the corner, and they are located on the first floor of what appears to formerly have been a two flat.  The decor? No decor, looks like a tacoria.The average price for a dish is $12-$16, and goes up from there( hey its seafood you cheapo.  The food is really tasty and the portions are generous. With that said, The food is usually over cook, which may not be a bad thing with seafood on the southside of Chicago, just a thought, but the taste and portions do make up for it, Its hard to explain why but it does. Try the Seafood Stuffed Pineapple, probably the best value there, around $14 and feeds two.  Also try the Langostinos (Crawfish on the menue, Actually prawns), this comes with rice, "salad" and fries.

9.description: El kora is definitely a great mexican sea food place. I been coming here since they opened a couple of years ago. This place is byob! The stuffed fish is the most unique dish I have ever had. Being a stuffed fish fanatic I have tried many places, but this dish is hands down the best! The dish is reasonably priced and it can feed two adults. The fish is prepared in a cream sauce topped with scallops, muscles, calamari, shrimp and crab meat...do I need to go on? Ramiro the owner/chef is always accommodating and his staff is pleasant. This place has me hooked! No pun intended.If your in the area this is definitely a place to check out. Try the shrimp or fish tacos, they will not disappoint. Don't forget to bring your favorite drink...

10.description: Great seafood here! definitely recommended to take lots of friends to. The dishes are in the 12-20 dollar range. But take another friend with you and get only one plate, they're HUGE!      The ceviche was the bomb. A+ food, check it out

4.description: This place! Besides having the best Michelada Mix and it being BYOB it has a pretty chill environment. Service doesn't take forever and the food is Delicious! I go there for the Piña Rellena all the time! My absolute favorite. Portions are well served pretty fast service for the amount of people they have in their during the weekends!

3.description: The chicken package is a good deal but recently I tried their carnitas torta. It was just as good as their chicken!

1.description: I've visited El Chisme on several occasions when I was working in the area. Most of the time I was picking up lunch for the guys. Ordering a dozen steak tacos to take back to the job site. Fast friendly service, good prices on the food and I really liked it. It looks like the big draw is the roast chicken meal. I saw a bunch of folks coming in to get that. They package the meal right there behind the counter and it looks like you get a ton of food. I always had the food to go so I can't speak to the service, but from what I saw it looked like everyone was well taken care of. Place was clean and the coolers in front were well stocked and organized. I'd definitely go back and would also recommend it to my friends.Cheers!

2.description: I go here and 9 of 10 times get the chicken Diavalo for lunch. It is very hot but I like heat. The rice and beans are seasoned perfectly. The staff is friendly and prompt. Parking adjacent to the building.

5.description: My sister had been raving about this so I wanted to try it. We got carryout and they bought 2 rotisserie chickens with rice and beans. The chicken was definitely delicious and juicy and their salsa was amazing and spicy, just the way I like it. The weird thing was that I was more smitten with their rice and beans than their chicken. Their rice and beans tasted just like the ones I used to eat growing up. I also like that they weren't greasy or dry. I found myself eating tortillas filled with just beans. I am definitely a fan and will go again to try their other food.

6.description: My husband and I absolutely enjoy rotisserie chicken and some friends recommended we try this place.  We planned on ordering food for take out and talk about extremely fast service.  We got the family dinner, which included a whole chicken, rice, beans, tortillas and a 2 liter pop.  This is definitely reasonable for what you get.  When I unpacked the chicken, it was nice and hot, and they were gracious enough to pre-chop the legs and the breast-- that was pretty neat.  As far as flavor, the food was good, the chicken was tender and juicy but it could have used a bit more seasoning.  I contemplated how many stars I would give this place, and I think I would probably short change them with 3 stars, but they are not quite at the 4 stars.  I know for sure I will be back and my husband and I were pretty satisfied.  I believe in second chances, and I think this place has potential.

7.description: So, even 3 years later we still go to El Chisme.  We don't go as often since moving from the neighborhood, but still go there pretty regularly.  They now offer a "super paquete" special, which is awesome!  We get it once in a while.  It's a rotisserie chicken (very moist), tortillas, jalapenos, rice, beans, chips, salsa, (a lot of) guacamole, french fries, and a 2 liter.  I can't remember exactly the price, but it's a pretty good deal and feeds my family of 5 easily.  (We do usually have to have an extra package of tortillas).  One thing that is upsetting is the large agua de horchata is now like $2.25 or $2.50.  I guess everything is going up, but when I first realized it, it seemed like a big jump.  We'll still go occasionally though.

8.description: Well, here's another of a chain of fast-food chicken places. I only have been in here once since it opened, and the chicken sandwich that I had was so dried out I was wondering if they had given me the foot. The food is very expensive to boot for what it is.What El Chisme replaced was Julia's Restaurant. Julia's was one of the best-kept secrets on the south side, where one could get a 3-4 course completely homemade Polish, Lithuanian, or American dinner for 5-6 bucks! The chain moved in, painted everything (including the ceramic tiles) a glossy safety yellow, and left me, the neighbors, and a whole bunch of cops out on the street with no place for a cheap, down-home meal. Waah. I think I'll go cry now...

9.description: It seems like a ton of mexican roast chicken places opened in Chicago in the last couple of years, El Chisme being my favorite.  Their daily special - which consists of a whole roasted chicken, tortillas, beans and rice, and a 2 liter of soda - is only $12 and could feed a small family!  The chicken is tender, juicy, and delicious.  I can't speak for their other food as I have only ever gotten the chicken, but for the price you can not go wrong.  They even deliver!!

0.description: I order food from here mostly on weekends and the chicken package is a good deal! Feeds our whole family.. Comes with rice, beans, chiles toreados, french fries, guacamole and chips, salsa and tortillasVery tasty and filling.. Chicken is never dry.Ive also had their guisados and caldo de camaron and caldo en su jugo. Works great for hangovers! Cant beat 3 minutes away from home..Cheap prices!

4.description: I love their food...  I always order food from this place and the delivery wont take more then 15-20 mins....  Very friendly staff.

12.description: Nicest people in the world.  If you're in this area, do yourself a favor and stop by for an incredible deal and homemade food.  Taquerias and mexican restaurants are a dime a dozen in Chicago, sure, but on a cold day in a cold world it's nice to warm up with a $6 fajita lunch special and a warm smile.  This place will be getting all of my oops-I-forgot-to-pack lunch business.  Brighton Park isn't that happeningest of areas, sure, but if you're around definitely stop by this place.  Quality food, quality people.  All of us THomas Kelly HS teachers eat here at least once a week.They cater too, which, after tasting the food, I'm really curious about finding an excuse to use...

3.description: I really enjoy here, the waitresses are very kind and generous. The food is delicious, especially their tacos & breakfasts. The owner is very kind as well, he welcomes anyone with open arms in his restaurant.

1.description: This place is the best! The first time I went there, the owner greeted me with a smile and offered me samples of the puerco en salsa roja, which is absolutely delicious! They have the best customer service around, given their friendly staff. Their food is the best mexican food you will find around this area, and trust me, I have been trying everywhere around here for a while now! I definitely recommend Tierra Caliente to everyone to try! Great food, great service, and great atmosphere! Cheap, too!

2.description: Authentic Mexican food at a great price, especially if you're a student or a teacher!

9.description: This review is 9 months overdue! We've been eating here for many years and we've never been disappointed.  But I honestly think I catered from Tierra Caliente more than I have eaten here. 9 months ago I catered from Tierra Caliente for my mom's birthday party.  Chicken fajitas, carne de puerco en salsa roja and barbacoa, with all the fixins (rice, beans, pico de gallo, two types of salsa).  My guests were not disappointed and their favorite was the barbacoa.  I was asked by so many guests where I catered from because the food was so delish.  I highly recommend this place!

10.description: Although they provide "teacher and student special" meal, the price for the small portions they give me i'd still consider much pricier compare to other mexican restaurant.

13.description: Came here for a quick lunch. Very good food! The salsa is really spicy!! (I don't do well with spicy!) Horchata is very very good! We had tacos and carne asada... Both were delicious. Decent prices and the service was really good. Check this hidden gem out! Mmmm!!

16.description: Love it!  Best Place in the city- great byob place with authentic great food!  serioulsy the nicest people ever.  Go there, and bring all your friends, you won't be mistaken!

6.description: I have been here once and what I had was good!! The place is small, but they have really good specials for teachers during lunch time. This is the go to place fir a lot of teachers at my school!!

15.description: POLLO AZTECA, POLLO AZTECA, POLLA AZTECA!!!!!!!  As we sometimes say in chicago, this place is Flame!!!! Loved everything we ordered. Staff is wonderful, and best mexican food in town. Owner will always talk to you if he is there. Recently had an event there and it was simply amazing! Highly Recommend it!

0.description: We were going to go to another spot but it was closed. This was our second choice. Should've been my first choice. I had Carnitas and especially Barbacoa that was absolutely out of this world. My new number one spot for Mexican food in Chicago. That says a lot. Average decor and very good service. I can't wait to go back.

5.description: This is my new favorite lunch place while on the job. The service was so, so, so friendly. I had the teacher and student special and left very satisfied. I don't know why other reviewers complained about small portion sizes, the special was exactly the size I was expecting for two tacos with rice and beans (where exactly are you getting tacos that are a different size than this? Don Pablos?). And the price was right! I couldn't decide on my drink, so they brought me a sample of the horchata while I decided--again, they're so nice! I had the al pastor, and while it wasn't quite my FAVORITE al pastor in the city, it was certainly delicious. Also, I was really surprised with how quickly my food arrived. They knew I was on a lunch break and didn't have time to waste.Oh, and most importantly, the salsas: really great, obviously made in-house. The verde was thick and flavorful and so good that I finished my entire basket of chips.I'll be returning!

11.description: Great food, quick service, and not too expensive. I recommend the puerco en salsa verde. It's a little spicy but so good.

8.description: This is a very friendly litlte place to eat. The staff is freindly and the owner is usually there. They often bring you free 'extras' to sample. We have used them for catering as well and its super affordable and excellent quality! You'll also get to enjoy some authentic mexican live music on the weekends.

4.description: Hate to give them 2 stars, but I thought the food was too salty. They seem friendly, but English is minimal. Wanted to try the mango drink, but they were out and also the menudo. So, my guy opted for the carne asada dinner and I got the carne asada burrito.It irked me a little when we placed our order and we were sitting there eating our chips and salsa. I don't speak Spanish and my guy is minimal....so I guess she asked if we wanted guacamole and I guess my guy said yes. We thought it was on the house, but she charged us for it. I don't know if she asked because we didn't really know Spanish or that is just how they do it. Weird.

14.description: I have to say that this place is very very special to me.  If there is one place in the city where I could take somebody to have a great meal this would be the spot.  I can't think of a restaurant anywhere that has had such a positive impact on my life.  I have eaten here for my birthday for the past 3 years and this is a tradition that I can't wait to continue.  Any the party just keeps getting bigger and better every year.Tips:- The carnitas are to die for.  If there was one thing that had to be tried...look no further.- The vegetable spread they give you as an appetizer has jimica.  You don't find that everywhere and I don't understand why.  It is the best.  Better than the carrots.- The guacamole is fantastic.  So are the red and green salsas.- Most places will tell you that chicharron isn't for gringos.  But they have it here and it is very flavorful.- They do have gift certificates.  I usually buy a handful to give out to give out as surprise gifts.  I've never been able to parlay $20 into such loyalty and friendship in my life.  - Very accessible from I-55.  No a bad ride from the north side at all.  - Private lot

7.description: I've been here several times for lunch. Staff are always happy and friendly. It has been years since I ate here. Stopped by for lunch with my wife. We decided to order the carnitas taco special....normally don't get them......10 total tacos of carnitas your way......plus ordered a side of rice and beans......Chips are usually  and fresh ..salsas ar not my taste......... Once we got our carnitas, WOW  the smell of the meat...very strong.......almost as if a live pig was next to me......i tried to drown it with lime juice and salsa to take the taste away, but would not work..... I've had fresh carnitas from Mexico and here and never experienced that. ....rice and beans were ok.... Don't think I will plan to have any type of carnitas at this place again.

1.description: I have been going to Ely's Hair studio for over 5 years and I so look forward to coming in every 6-8 weeks for many reasons.  I have had my hair long, short, wavy, straight, red, dark brown and highlighted golden.  Not only is it a perfect experience every time, Ely has talked me out of some bad hair decisions and definitely helped correct a bad home dye job. There is literally nothing this woman can't do! She is very precise about the way each and every piece of hair lays and takes the time to listen to the problem areas.   The products are very gentle on your hair and you will will surely get compliments from strangers on your newly created style and/or color.  I do.  In fact I found Ely by asking a girl in a store who cuts her hair.  Oh... did I mention she was cool too!Ely is very good to her customers and works around your schedule try giving them a call and set up on appointment . I hope you enjoy your visit with Ely's Hair Studio as much as I do.

2.description: Absolutely LOVED my experience here at Ely's with my Fabulous Hair Designer Monica. As for me being a cosmetologist myself I only trust my hair in the hands of the BEST!! Monica has been my hair designer for many years and her expertise never fails.. Every color decision & design has always complimented my facial features and tone.. Monica is absolutely phenomenal!! Be sure to visit Monica and get your Free Consultation and schedule your appointment with "The Best" tell her Virginia sent you

0.description: I really like the color and cut. The color is soooo pretty. And red but not so bright where I look like Ronald McDonald  but just right. And the hair cut is just what I wanted.

Hello,Sam came to my home to add a 220 line for a hot tub I had installed.  the work was impeccable and he took the time to explain things, did my special requests, and even came back to hook up the hot tub after they delivered it as part of my job. he is very reasonable and quick to respond.

3.description: The quality of offerings here has declined noticeably, while prices climb noticeably higher. $2 for this water-damaged cookbook? Really? It's...a hassle to shop here. Y ellas no hablan Ingles alla. Ninguno. But every so often there's something interesting to be found. The jewelry prices are exorbitant, seriously. I think this is one of my least favorite VDOs in the area. If I happen to be on 47th street and I'm feeling adventurous I may dip in, but I find myself increasingly driving on past.

1.description: I'm not a big fan of this location; it's one of the smallest VDO locations and the merchandize I saw here was disappointingly boring.  Often times the selections don't necessarily reflect the type of neighborhood where the merchandize is held, but this principle appeared to be somewhat defied today.  The aisles were a bit narrow.  There weren't too many people shopping, but some of the "miscellaneous" items were sort of fragmented and shattered.  I wonder if anyone would want to take broken pieces home, unless there is a creative use out of any of these.  There were vinyls on the ground, decapitated dolls in the bins, and abandoned teddy bears that needs be revived in loving households.  There weren't any organizations on anything really.I guess you can truly have a pleasure of thrift shopping, because you will need to thrift diligently in this location. If you don't live in or close to this neighborhood, head to other locations before coming to this one.  It's one of the south-side locations, even though the CTA bus 47 (47th.; going from Hyde Park--Bronzeville--Back of the Yard--Brighton Park--Gage Park--Midway) and the CTA 49 (Western) buses are conveniently accessible.  The actual location is on the 47th. St. and S. Maplewood in the Brighton Park neighborhood, just FYI.

2.description: This store is kind of a dump. It's always a mess and it's over stuffed with everything including customers! That said, they do get some decent stuff, and if you wait until they lower their unreal prices, you can get some good stuff here. I have found a lot of decent cameras, antique toys, video games and cassette tapes, but like I said, if you don't like clutter, it's not for you.

5.description: My current favorite in the chain of Village Discounts, this small thrift store is well priced and has a good rotation of stuff going through it.  The shirts are always in good order, the housewares are in shambles but there is a pretty decent selection, everything else is hit or miss.  Found an extremely rare map of Michigan for $3 sitting in a pile of crap...The tamale lady / guy outside is top notch as well!

6.description: Ah yeah, another Village. Of course, I am obviously a fan of these stores and this one gave me a miniature horse with real horse hair for $3. I love it and would gladly shop here again!

7.description: Strictly clothes. Not the best second hand store in the Bridgeport/McKinley Park/Brighton Park area.

0.description: I don't like the other locations but decided to stop in since I frequently pass it. I don't expect much from thrift stores. I have been to many that kind of spoil you because they're laid out so well and reasonably priced but I try to remember that they are indeed to rummage through and are hit or miss. That being said,  this one was okay. Sundays are half price on the items with blue, yellow, or pink tags. There will also be a half off sale for  Columbus day tomorrow. I saw some pretty decent items but this place is a bit overpriced for my tastes. The jewelry was the worst. What appeared to me to be costume bracelets were $11. Nah, son. There were some mugs that were cute but nothing special that were $2.98 each. No thank you. Then I found some nice Stella McCartney shoes that were $20. I know she's.designer and all but I have yet to find anything in a thrift shop that would make me pay $20. They had lots of printers, fax machines, and small appliances. There were some nice sweaters as well. Overall, It's a place that I'd more than likely return to.

4.description: This Village Discount has a good selection but I'll have to tell you that every aisle is a war zone.  Manuvering around stray hangers and  3-year olds is tricky.  One day, I turned the aisle into a fresh fart someone had cut loose.  Another time, a kid was grabbing shoppers ankles from under the clothes racks.  You never know what else you will find there outside of the clothes.  I do know that I plan to go back..armed with a gas mask and ankle protectors.

3.description: I'v given this location multiple chances. First off, these people apparently are incapable of giving out correct order. Second, the food was old and stale. Just an overall bad location, which is a shame because it just opened, if anything you'd expect them to try to win over the neighborhood.

1.description: Disgusting. Awful. Everyone was looking forward to a wendy's being in this area, and saw that it was packed on opening day. Unfortunately, this has to be one of the worst locations, if not, THE WORST. workers don't know what the hell they're doing. this mix up even the simplest things wrong. even a manager saw how messed up my order was and redid it herself. but guess what? SHE STILL GOT EVERY LITTLE THING WRONG. its like they dont know what they're even doing. they all get payed to play & goof around. everyone who lives in this area always went to the wendys on archer. not too far, always worth the trip. i think its safe to say that we will continue to do so. im seriously not exaggerating when i say service and management and everything under the sun in this place is terrible. not to mention FILTHY even though it JUST opened. its almost hilarious. patiently waiting for it to be shut down and somethig better to come along.

2.description: I really had high hopes for this place, I was so excited when I saw the coming soon banner.. So today I decide to stop by and I got 4 salad(full) to go... My complaints as follow:1- my salads were placed Ina regular bag, meaning they were practically upside down.2-No Croutons .. Waah!!3- No utensils--thankfully (I'm at home)I'll much rather go to the wendys on Archer ave and Laramie.. It's a little far from my house, but I've been going there since forever and so far no problems...(this new wendys is just 5 minutes from my house,if that)Again, I was so excited and now I'm not sure if I'll come back... Very bummed out :(

5.description: I really would love to give the place 4 stars just because Wendy's was reintroduced into this area, but the service definitely would be a 1, if not, less than a 1. I do understand that it's a brand new location, but the staff should have been thoroughly trained before opening. I've only ordered drive thru in the last couple of times and my experience every time has been the same; could have been better. The quality of the food could also be better, but what do you expect? It's a fast food restaurant.

6.description: For it being a new place the inside looked dirty and beaten up already , Service is always slow and wrong .

0.description: Don't listen to these fools. I went the other day and got the freshest fries and spicy chicken nugs that have ever entered my mouth. I was honestly stoked about it. Customer service was also on point in the DT. I'll be back.

4.description: My goodness! The service in the drive thru is atrocious! It seriously took 3 or 4 people to understand that we wanted the GOUDA bacon cheeseburger, not a Jr bacon cheeseburger. 3 cars in the secondary lane moved up before someone could understand. Then they go and add nuggets to our order that we did not order. I was really excited for this Wendy's. Now, not so much.

3.description: Standard Chicago fair, good Italian beef, and really good Gyros...take your simvastatin though.

1.description: My staple for years when I was in High School. If you love Gyros..... You must try the gyro burrito.

2.description: Great food at a decent prices, very friendly staff. The gyros are some of the best I've ever had

9.description: Everything I've ever had here is in point. Burgers are great. Hot Dogs are delicious and the gyros is perfectly seasoned. The ridiculously friendly staff makes this neighborhood corner spot a can't miss.

10.description: I lovd their burgers and shrimp basket !

4.description: I'm a fan of the Philly Steak and Italian Beef here.

6.description: Their homemade Italian Beef just kicked this review to 5-STARS!! Not just any Italian Beef I say, I literally heard the 85' Chicago Bears in the background with every bite. This has to be the best hidden gem for Chicago style grub. Funny thing is these guys were slangin' tons of chicken salads...hahaha. Their chicken is HUGE and generous portions are served.Steak tacos are next on my hit list.

12.description: For a fast food place there food is good and they have good customer serves

5.description: Dino's used to be so much better. It's still a solid option for a quick lunch in BP. Hands down the best thing here are the Gyros.  They are my favorite gyro I've ever had. Try them with the green taco sauce they have here you seriously won't regret it. That sauce rivals some taco joints best sauce. Hot Dogs and fries are solid as well.  The other great thing about Dino's is the service. The people who work there are good hard working people who have been in the neighborhood for years. They remember you if you are a regular. They make small talk with you and make the wait for food go by fast.

11.description: For burger joint, Dino's blows a lot of restaurants out of the water. The burgers brought me back 30 years when I used to go to Wolfy's on Peterson & California. If it wasn't for cholesterol I'd go back more often, loved the skin-on fries and everything is freshly made to order in fron of you.

8.description: All I have to say is OMG, the burger and fries that I had for lunch were top notch!! No complaints at all for this place!!

0.description: I've been ordering at this spot for 3 years now and they're really good. FAST delivery service and good prices. Try the chicken breast salad and the gyro burrito.

7.description: I really enjoy this place. Fast delivery and great service.  We love their burgers, shrimp basket and gyros. Found this place by chance and have been eating from there about twice a week.

0.description: Super friendly staff!!! A huge selection of EVERYTHING sports related! They have the cutest Puma bags...and shoes :) I'm glad I found this store; will be coming back for sure!

Warning warning warning. Once you have cake from La Rosita you will have an instant addiction specially if u have there Mil Hojas de fresa cake. I have ordered this cake for several occasions (baby shower, baptism, my sisters wedding cake). I guarantee you will not be disappointed. The best cake in the south side of Chicago! Two thumbs up!

3.description: I like this place. I've gotten my hair cut here quite a few times...I'm considering adding them as a dependant on my taxes. I can only vouch for Victor as far as haircuts go because he's the only one that's touched my hair here and I always leave happy at the cut, frowning at the price. I know $35 is pretty standard considering the average for a woman's cut and how picky I am but it still sets me back a bit more than I'd like.The neighborhood isn't the greatest but I go well out of my way to come here so that must mean something. The building itself is stylin'. I went to the old location before and it's doesn't compare to the swag this place has. The workers are always nice and friendly so can't complain there.The parking situation is hit or miss. They have the street metered parking but across the street you can't park (even though they have a paybox) 'til after 6pm. I guess it's to reduce congestion during rush hour but the orange line isn't far so just take the train and the bus a few blocks and BAM, you're there.

1.description: I love this place! They can always get me in they are open 7 days a week. Victor is amazing his hair cuts are just amazing, giving my hair texture and an amazing color! He's always on point with his opinion on going with the right color that suits well with my hair and skin tone. He's a little pricey however, I do have long hair.

2.description: I went in and got my hair cut from Araceli ,a hair dresser there, and loved my hair! She was so nice and was very into making my haircut work for ME. She asked a lot of questions of what I was looking for and also gave me suggestions on what might work better for me. I would definitely go back to her again :)The environment was chill and the price was not bad at all for the service that was given to me! I recommend my friends to come visit this place all the time I just love it!!

5.description: I been here once and never again .. I went in for a quick trim.... 3 inches of my hair was cut off... NEVER again!!!!! Prices are way to high especially where this salon is located...!!

6.description: Not crazy about this place at all! I finally made an appointment during the week I arrived on time yet I waited for 45mins . I wasnt going to worry about that as long as my hair cut and color looked good. I picked a cut and color out of their book, showed to the lady and asked if she could do it. With a attitude she replies of course its in our book. So long story short IT WAS NoTHING LikE tHE PicTURE!!!!! The color was suppose be dark brown with red lowlights it ended up being Orange with pinkish blonde lowligh. Uhggggh I made them dye all my hair 1 color (brown). They still charged full price $130. Do not let the middle age Hispanic lady do your coloring.!  Bad experience

7.description: i have to start by saying that i don't do reviews when i get bad service, but in this case i am . i went in for a hair cut and to my surprise i was  taking care of by the actual owner of the salon, none other then victor mauricio himself. the service started by a really bad shampoo job, that alone should have tipped me off of what was to come. i sat in his chair and he chatted my ear off about his experience behind the chair so i immediately thought i was going to get the most amazing cut, but instead he butchered my hair. it was the most horrifying experience i have ever been through. when i talked to him about a refund he not only said he would refund me for the bad hair cut, but it wasn't until he insulted me and my appearance; now that was even more humiliating and unethical and very unprofessional. i will never ever want anyone to experience that type of humiliation and i also will never recommend that salon to anyone. when you drive by that salon my only suggestion is keep driving!

8.description: Came here with a friend because we thought it would be a very affordable price....not the result. After, not wanting to cut my hair but convinced by ruben I agreed and felt it was pretty OK he didn't asked just told he'd put a glaze and the trimmed our hair, we agreed. After about 45 min after glazed and shampooed he began to trimmed my hair which im not going to lie he made my hair volume and pretty... i did love it. So after it he was trying to sell me shampoo for 18.00 a bottle... idts. So i proceeded to the cashier and astonished and surprised I was charged $80.00 for a trim and style. Wow never have i paid as much for such a small trimming of my hair. To my experienced it was OK but overly charge 45.00 for a simple glaze i could possibly done myself is such a waste of money to end it bad i showered and next day my hair was no different than before my so called shiny glazed. I will not be coming back nor recommending anyone here.

9.description: I tried this place out after a friend raved about how well they cut her hair.  When I approached the salon, the windows were covered with black shades.  The inside was very messy in terms of boxes everywhere. The stylist informed me they were relocating, so I ignored the mess.  For the price they charged, I believe the quality of the haircut was average, because the morning after I washed my hair, I noticed the length of the hair were not well trimed.  there were some strands which were longer on right side of my face and shorter on the left side.  I did not notice this b/c he curled my hair during styling.  but my stylist did do a great job blow drying and styling the hair.   Overall, if you are not picky about the quality of the haircut and are willing to pay $30 + tip for it, then it's decent.

0.description: I visited Victor Mauricio Salon (VMS) for the first time in June of 2011 for a haircut and had an awesome experience. I returned in April 2013 for a perm and a haircut and though the professionalism fell short from the first time, I am very happy with the way my hair turned out. Here's a brief recap of my experienced pro's and con's:Pros: - The hair stylists took my input into consideration and made excellent suggestions that complimented my specific hair type and face. Matilde even pulled up pictures on her iphone to give me an idea of what my own hair would look like once she finished.- The salon was very welcoming of me calling or coming back for a quick demo lesson to style my new hair.Cons:-Prices of services aren't necessarily fixed, so make sure you get the costs upfront. Victor Mauricio was charging me an amount that was higher than my initial estimate, but he quickly took care of this when I voiced the disparity in price and even gave me a free diffusor for the inconvenience.As for the prices, my husband said it best "Quality that fullfills your expectations is worth the cost."

4.description: I've been a customer of this salon for a few years now and always leave looking and feeling great! I love the honest feedback I get when I ask for something specific done to my hair. Some people are delusional and think they'll look like the model in the picture they present to the stylist and those are the one's who will complain. Overall the salon quality is above average especially for the south side, prices are standard but lower than north side salons.

1.description: Worst Chinese food ever. Just had it and it was worse then store bought Chinese. Throwing away the leftovers, that's how bad it was. Seriously, do not get food from here if you have other options. Two thumbs WAY down.

2.description: Is the Golden Gate worth a trip if you don't live in Brighton Park?  Well, no.  If you live around here though and don't want to head to Chinatown, this place is pretty good.  I recommend the vegetable lo mein.  So far, that's my favorite option for vegans.  I prefer this over the other Chinese place closest to me, New Happy Chop Suey.

0.description: Egg foo yung. Yum yum yum!  And she gave me free delicious won ton soup on this cold windy day. And check out  baby lily; she is a beauty!

3.description: Better than Huck  and Pindos.  Still would get a 4 star rating if they updated the decor.  Decently priced.

1.description: Nothing special with the food. Service was good.Ordered breakfast. Hash browns were crispy, but didn't taste that good. Eggs and bacon were ok. I did like the sausages, didn't taste burnt and hard like some places.

2.description: This place is a blast from the past.  I mean that in a good way. It has that old school diner feel, like it was set up back in the late 80's or early 90's and it froze there.  The place is spotless, very clean and very friendly.  I have only been here for breakfast where they serve the typical breakfast items seen at any other breakfast diner.  The food is nothing extravagantly special, but it also does not disappoint, it is very straight forward and simple.  The prices are good, and again the staff very friendly.The coffee stays warm, this goes with the place which has a cozy homey feel.   I know the place is run by a small family and the same staff has been there for years.  I like that there are some parking spaces in the back (by the fire station) and I can go in through the back door instead of trying to park on Archer.  I won't lie, it always makes me feel like I am part of the "in" crowd or like I run the joint since not many people are aware of the back entrance.  (well, now they will....)Simple, easy, and to the point.   If you are tired of Pindos, Huck Finn, New Archview, give this place a shot, it won't disappoint.

5.description: Sometimes it's the little things that keep you around or make you go back.I write this review in honor of my late father, Ricardo, because it's almost  father's day and well he can't cause he's .... dead.My old man took me to this place all the timeI don't know why.  The food is par for the course, Usual diner fare.  Nothing to really write home about.I guess what set this one apart from the others on Archer, was the service.  Kind waitresses whom treated you well with prompt and  courteous service.My old man told me one day after having a late breakfast there his reasoning behind traveling to Restaurant located six miles from our home in PIlsen.He said it was the aspect that the waitresses always kept his coffee warm, remembered his name, didn't bother him much while he ate his meal, the place it self was always very clean and sanitation were never an issue, and the man behind the counter always made it a point to come over and ask him how he was doing, and trade old fishing stories."you go out of your way for things that you like or places that treat you well" he told me.Their fare is the usual diner grub, although their omelets are very tasty and the fact they have many dishes with Chorizo always made my day.  Good, tasty food, with excellent service at a decent Price.Sadly my old man got the cancer in early 2005, he became quite sick, and his days were drawing to a near. We still would go not as often as before but, every once a month or soThe entire staff knew the situation at hand, and went out of their way even moreIn the fall of 2005 his body could take no more  and he passed on.Two months later I stopped by with what then was my girl friend but now is my wife.The entire wait staff come over because they knew he had passed on, in some sort of  acknowledgement of my father's patronage, they gave us our meal for free.  A fine gesture indeedMy trips are not as often as in my youth, but I still go.And I can still hear my dad talking about the going fishing for bullheads or admonishing me for putting ketchup on my eggs

0.description: the place is spotless,the first thing i check is the salt&pepper and sugar containers&and condiments all clean,in fact spotless just like the washroom.my server victor was so helpful,he being a big guy:I asked for his recommendations and he recommended their steak skillet( it was the bomb!! YUM!) very filling,cheap under$12 and full!!:) NICE mex-amercan fusion will defenately go back.my friend had heives rancheros and the sauce was yummy!! they also make homemade menudo on the weekends,but get there early they open at 6 am because they run out by midday.

4.description: Not so good maybe it's what I ordered

3.description: Stopped in for a quick mani and its not a very pleasant salon to be at...smells like sewer...i wouldn't recommend to go!!

1.description: Stopped in for a quick mani-pedi for a wedding.  Yikes.First, it doesn't look terribly clean in here.  The towel used during my pedi looked filthy.  I'm mildly worried about how well they sanitize.   The staff was not terribly friendly.  The girl who did my nails barely said two words to me.  She didn't offer to turn my massage chair on, didn't ask if I wanted her to trim my nails down (she didn't bother), seemed super rushed and rough, didn't ask what shape I wanted my nails (just cut them in an uneven and very short square!!!  Gross.)  and left one nail so ragged, I came home, took the polish off and filed it down properly myself. This was a waste of my time and money. I could have driven to the west loop where there's parking and had my mani-pedi done the right way, with a little bit of pampering.  It might have cost me a few bucks more, but it'd be WELL WORTH IT.  Go to any nail joint in the loop over this.  What a bummer--there's no where else even remotely nearby.  I was hoping this would be a regular place I could come, but I guess not.

2.description: Came here for my first mani and pedi EVER, so I didn't know what to expect.  I feel I have dry rough feet, so I decided to have this service, assuming they'll make my feet soft and cute.  After an hour long wait (this place is VERY SMALL), the service was fun, it was worth the wait.  BUT while I was getting my finger nails done, I noticed 2 ladies getting a service on their feet that I didn't just minutes ago.  They were literally slicing dead skin off onto the towel!  I was very disappointed because I didn't recieve that!... and I'm the one with rough feet :(This place smells like acrylic, its small and on a busy street so you might have to wait, and they don't accept credit cards, but there is an ATM directly next door.  Oh and the value for both services (pedicure and french manicure) was 35$... WOW thats great price :)

0.description: I came here in 2008 2 days before my wedding and I loved it. It was my first mani pedi and they did a suuuuuuuupppppppppper great job. The girl I got was really nice and I loved her work and my fiances girl did a great job on his terrible feet. hahaWe went back a year later and we didn't see those girls anymore and the service was not as great as the first time but they still did give good service.I am going this week again (i don't get mani/pedis all the time).The place is small but comfortable except when its full which they do get very busy. GOOD FOR THEM

1.description: I think it might be new management again. Decided to pick up some lunch specials.Mongolian Beef - The flavor wasn't bad, but not really made like other places.Kung Pao Chicken - Bland and no heat.The fried rice that came with it was too wet and bland. Egg rolls aren't good either.One thing they had in common was food was usually salty....ease up on the MSG please!Will probably give them another try since they are close. Oh, and prices were raised a bit.

2.description: Good food, 10/10 would eat here again.

0.description: This place is not that bad actually. I always order the usual which is orange chicken and shrimp chow mein. Total was like $19 something. I guess the price is okay... You get a free egg roll with $10 purchase. The orange chicken is good and not very sweet like other places. I like my orange chicken spicy, so just let them know. Shrimp chow mein is yummy with giant shrimps. What I don't understand is why they give out a small box of white rice with a large order of orange chicken? It's not enough rice. So that's the reason it's only 4 stars.

Awesome place for hot dogs. I love coming here for that and pretty much just that. Their 2 hot dogs and fries for $3 and some change is just unbeatable. Been coming here since I was about 12 years old.

1.description: "What could probably go wrong" was my first mistake. I'm in a Mexican neighborhood. They're serving seafood. There's lots of local competition.The place being empty it noon on a Saturday should've been my first clue. I was disappointed to see only high price offerings. No tacos. No enchiladas. No burritos. Even the soft drinks were expensive. Want alcohol? Forget about it!I had the ceviche which is a large serving at a large plate.I don't know,  I just didn't like the place. Your mileage may vary.

0.description: This business obviously just started up, have potential and it looks to be family own.Their prices fore size of the dishes are decent and you get a lot seafood. I feel like their chimichanga are a hit with the sauce it comes with! I had tried their stuff chicken with shrimps and I liked the combo. Seafood, dine-in, and BYOB too!Try the chimichanga if you go!

12.description: Really good, tough to complain.It's a typical small taqueria with a menu that, while not extensive, is enough to fill you up pretty quickly.  The food's really good, the "sopes" are awesome, and the salsa is tasty enough (my tolerance for ultra-hot biases my taste buds).I usually get the burritos without cream (makes it less juicy so it holds together longer), I ask for "tacos de carne asada" with only cilantro and onions (cuz you get more meat that way & it reminds me of street tacos in Mexico), and maybe some jalapeños "dorados" to spice it up even more.La Haciendita is IMO better than the other quick taquerias in the neighborhood.  Elia's down the street has started to taste too average, Manolo's is always running out of one thing or another, Atotonilco tastes average, and that one way down near 59th in the plaza is more after-clubbing quality.  Plus Haciendita is open 'til 1am most nights.Sunday mornings are incredibly busy.  Try to stay away from the salt/pepper shakers or you can wipe down some things before you use them.  There's a lot of rampant toddlers in there sometimes and you know how babies like to put their mouths on everything.  Sorry Haciendita, but you know how it is.

7.description: I'm always looking for good tongue tacos and this place fits the bill. The meat is cut in chucks abd is always moist and flavorful.  I usually order to go and so far they haven't messed up my order, unlike most other places where I end up with steak tacos instead. (I've just learned to always check my bag before I leave.)

19.description: The gorditas here are very good,the best i've tried in the city and they are affordable.They have another location on 51 st and kedzie.THE BEST DEAL THEY HAVE THOUGH IS CHICKEN BREAST TORTA with mayo(sounds gross but tastes great),avocado,jalap,and lettuce and tom. with a can of pop for $4.50 can't beat that!

1.description: Don't go here ... bad service and they take forever!!! ... I had ordered a burrito to go by phone ... and when I got it it was stale as hell idk how that's possible cuz I was still waiting for the damn thing when I got there it should of been fresh ...right??? .... we order tacos by phone and when we get there they aren't ready either lol ... i told some waiter i want a burrito con todo menos tomate y avocado ... and he was like then what do you want in the burrito ... i had to explain i want it... i want everything else which your menu says comes in it minus the tomato or avocado if that comes in it cuz I don't like that ... then he's still like wait I don't get how you want it lol... but this has happened  lots of times ... the only reason we ever even order is if our cars break down and we are extremely  lazy  ...

2.description: I actually found this place by accident when I was headed to another restaurant but got turned around so I ended up here.I really didn't know what to expect from this place because of the mixed reviews but I'm glad I took a chance. I have been here twice already that's how much I liked this place.  The prices are reasonable and they gave a few of my favorite Mexican Restaurants a run for their money.There was a bit of a language barrier between me and my waitress the first time I went but we got things figured out.  I had a burrito the first time with avocado, sour cream and cheese.  I did think it was only .50 extra but each ingredient was .50 but that still kept the food at a great price point.  I want to say $6.50 and it was stuffed with steak as well as piping hot.My daughter got the Taco Dinner which came with beans and rice it was so flavorful and that was only $7.50.I also tried the Margarita $6 (which I was told it was strawberry but it wasn't I still don't know which kind it was) but it was Excellent the bartender didn't skimp on the liquor and it came in a big glass.   My daughter had the Tequila Sunrise $5.50 the glass wasn't as big but it was still good all the same.I also loved the homemade salsa and chips....very spicy and very good.The only thing I didn't like was when I tried to get a small container to take the rest of my salsa home I was told that it would be $2...I don't know if she thought I wanted an entire new order so I just ended up pouring the rest on my burrito I was taking home.The second time I went it was to celebrate my birthday and it was so worth the train ride to the place...the great thing is I was better able to communicate with the waitress.We started off with a Steak Taco and it was only $1.99 again just so good.  For the main course we had La Tampiquena which is grilled skirt steak served w/enchilada, grilled onions and jalapeno peppers for only $12.95...now this wasn't the best skirt steak I have ever had but it very flavorful and I would order it again.This time I really did have the Strawberry Margarita which was made with real Strawberries that was treat.  It wasn't as good as the first one I had but it was still good especially if you like strawberries.  They are open 7 days a week and they do except credit and debit cards but you have to spend at least $10.All in All my experience here was wonderful, the staff was great and the food reasonably priced and oh so Tasty.  I will be back for sure.If you are in the neighborhood I say give them a try I'm so glad we did!Enjoy!

9.description: Good Mexican restaurant although  they need to improve their customer service...NO "good morning or Hello" ..Just very blah..!!! My boyfriend and I waited for about 10 mins before any of the 3 waitress took our order... and mind you there was about two or three families having lunch and 3 waitresses on duty ....and we still waited.They have good gorditas and a good breakfast menu...I would like to see them improve their coffee. The coffee seems to be watered down... but over all I prefer my experience in the morning then I would had during the evening.

6.description: My go to place when I want fast mexican food. The food is great, im stuck on the cheese enchiladas with red sauce. Their carne asada meal is awesome very filling.

18.description: This is a hole-in-the-wall family joint restaurant.  It's kind of a cramped space, but very cozy.  I go with close friends to just eat really good food for really cheap.They serve the best gorditas!  The chicken is juicy, mixed in with sauteed onions and fresh lettuce and tomatoes.  Squeeze a bit of lime and eat with the pickled spicy carrots provided.  It's so heavenly...and greasy.  I like to drink it with cool agua de horchata!  The carne asada is great too, though the portion may be a bit small.  But remember, an entree and drink amounts to less than $5.  Well worth the trip for some good Mexican food.

10.description: In the corner building at the intersection of 47th St. and Christiana Ave. The interior decoration is very good. In the rear there is an elevated dining area with red walls underneath an arched ceiling. At the front between the entrance and the kitchen door is a countertop structure designed to look like a roadside stand in Mexico. They have an ATM and a jukebox in the main section. Some of the artwork is kind of generic paintings that are produced for the purpose of decorating Mexican resturants. But they also have some original works by local artists, which included some woodcut print portraits of Pancho Villa and other famous generals of the Mexican revolution.   The enchiladas with mole were quite good and in an authentic style. Prices are good considering the quality and quantity of the food you are getting. Tortillas were thick and crunchy. Slightly awkward moment in that the waitress who came to the table is clearly not accustomed to speaking English, so she went to get the woman at the front counter to take the order instead. Maybe I should have told her it's OK to speak in Spanish because what she was trying to ask me was simple enough. Also I agree somewhat with previous comments that it's hard to get the attention of the staff, there were three waitresses on duty which was more than enough for the mostly empty space, but they all seemed listless and indifferent. Eventually I gave up and walked to the front counter to ask for the bill. The clientele at that time was exclusively Mexican working-class and middle-class people from the nearby area. Some high school soccer players in uniforms also came in. This is a popular and good place in the neighborhood.

13.description: La Haciendita has potential... there gorditas and tacos are good but platillos could definitely improve. My BF likes the place but isn't his first choice.  I call it the 'chill spot" the times we've gone it's been empty so we get great service. Definitely not our favorite Mexican place but will do.

16.description: I hadn't been to this place in a really long time (not sure why), but decided to go back for Saturday Brunch. The place wasn't over crowded at all...I mean, we were able to find a table right away. All three gals had chilaquiles...watch out for the green ones - they're HOT! What I like about La Haciendita that other Mexican restaurants don't do is include potatoes with all breakfast entrees - that means you get rice, bean (these are vegetarian FYI), the main course, and potatoes.
