As you can imagine, the plate is piled high. The people next to us had gorditas that looked really good. I'm definitely going back to try them too. The only complaint is that waitresses failed to refill my coffee cup - I literally had to hunt them down to get their attention. But they made up for it by going around and offering their dessert selections in a platter for people to see.

17.description: I used to frequent this place quiet a bit before but I haven't been there in a while. I used to always order steak gorditas from here. I agree with the previous review it does get packed on the weekends. Its a nice place to go to grab some delicious Mexican food.  The area can be a little sketchy during the night time.

15.description: This restaurant makes mexican food the way it should be- good!They have an extensive menu from tacos to stews to dinners for a great price.  It's mostly packed on the weekends, but you'll eventually be seated in minutes.  They serve alcohol, fresh fruit shakes, and the decoration is very cool, sometimes they have local art on display.  The only negative for me is the location, I only go when in the area; and although it's on a busy street I some how always find parking!

0.description: I love coming here. Well I have only been here 2 times. I have been to their other location years YEARS ago. I have always liked their food. We went for breakfast the other day and my husband and I ordered the chilaquiles. No disappointment at all. Our dish was so effin good. My son ordered a torta de asada and he really liked it as well. I have yet to taste their enchiladas. That is what I used to order at their other location about 12 years ago. I will update.  The service is good. No complaints there.

5.description: I've been back a few times. I do like the strawberry banana shake. Ordered a carne asada torta and the bread was so soft and fresh. I wished they didn't cut up the steak as it kept spilling out so it was hard to eat. The salsa that comes with the chips are warm and pretty good.Think I'll try a different torta and shake next time.

11.description: Pros and Cons:Pros*Good Quality Food**Solid Portions**Awesome Tequila Bar**Extensive Menu *Cons*Lazy Waitresses**Slooooooooow Service**Discrimination against Tacos,Tortas,and Burritos*There is another Haciendita on 5151 S Kedzie Ave however neither are numbered one or two unlike say a "Comales"and as the waitress here informed me this is more "restaurant" as opposed to the other location which is considered a standard taqueria.Their in lies the problem, If you choose to order a taco,torta or burrito be prepared to wait unlike the other Haciendita on Kedzie where they serve you said items in a fair and timely manner. However in this restaurant it takes forever for a simple item! No joke the last time I came here along with my family it took 20 minutes for my burrito to arrive! Which was inexcusable I mean come on the burrito is nothing more than a glorified taco on crack which is cool but it should not take 20+ minutes for it to arrive nor make.When the burrito came I was relived and pleasantly surprised at it's size, believe me this burrito is packed with meat and since I ordered it "combinado" which is basically a burrito that is stuffed with two different meats and in my case it was beef tongue and carne asada. The meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked and  the vegetables where fresh but they did not overshadow the meat which is important in an artery clogging burrito.The dinner plates here are inexpensive and varied as opposed to the other location which has overpriced and under portioned plate options and also unlike the other location this place gives you free chips and salsa! They suck and taste very stale but hey it's better that paying two bucks a pop for the same thing at the other location. Back to the service yeah it's slooow even with a half empty restaurant the waitresses here take their time for example: five minutes to attend you and bring you their crappy chips and modest salsa:five more minutes to take your order and or bring your drinks:then ten to twenty minutes for your tacos,tortas, or burritos that is unless you order a dinner plate. That's right prepare to be discriminated if you order a simple taco,torta, or burrito but if you order a plate of something anything lo and behold you get it almost immediately well seven or eight minutes but it's still a huge difference when compared to the standard tacos etc.It's sad that the service is so lackluster because this place is actually really delicious and the decor is a mixture of a cantina and traditional Mexican but with a subdued but relaxing atmosphere thanks in large part to the fact that it's caters to families and other working class individuals. Don't worry there are no drunken idiots here since I'm quite sure they water down the alcohol well except the beer.The parking is also a mess especially on a busy weekend so if you plan on coming here plan accordingly and if you don't speak Spanish don't worry just look at the menu and do like Russian roulette and hope for the best.Verdict: If you want tacos,tortas or burritos go to the other location on 5151 S Kedzie Ave but if you want  a good dinner plate with good flavor and solid portions(and good prices) come here but with horribly lazy and slow waitresses and service it could test your patience so consumer beware.No go and have a taco you deserve it:)

8.description: OUR FAMILY GO TO for quick bites, late night carryout, dinner and alcoholic drinks or just a nice family dinner. Food is fresh and they have a healthy menu which is great for a mexican restaurant, you really don't see that at alot of places.  They take debit/credit cards which is great and the food is not that expensive.  Clean place, practical prices, my kind of place.  We always stick to tacos, tortas or burritos here, but will definitely mix it up soon in the future.  Great atmosphere.

3.description: Been coming here for years. Wife LOVES, LOVES,LOVES the Chilaquiles(and she's tried them everywhere!) Not only a good spot for breakfast, but lunch and dinner are usually on the spot.

14.description: This place is your typical Mexican looking eatery. We get our table and we are brought menus. Sometime later (wait staff is not too attentive) we get chips and salsa. Mind you, it is Sunday, it is busy. The chips are stale and the salsa is OK at best. This should have been our clue to leave. We are hungry. It's been a long day, we stay. Orders are typical, easy enough. Tacos and tortas, and a burrito. We are now brought a green salsa on addition to the red salsa served w/ the chips. YAY green salsa, not even I can mess that up! Wow it is horrible! The carne asada is bland and over cooked. My burritos tortilla is so over cooked it is like a cracker. We now see the table across from us get a bin of pickled carrots, so we ask can we get some? Her response is you have to ask we don't just put them on the table. Um that is what we are doing...asking for some. With living in the Little Village maybe I'm spoiled but this was the worst experience I have ever had. Next time the chips and salsa are not good, I won't be sticking around for the rest.

4.description: Probably the worst experience I've had in a long time. We sat down...and menus were brought to us almost 5 minutes later. Then came another server and asked for drink orders...the others ordered drinks while I just ordered a water. The water came in a small styrofoam cup and was half full. I drank it down immediately and was never offered a refill on water. Another server took our food order and another server brought the food and rushed away. Immediately I noticed I did not have a fork or knife...I'm not sure it's possible to eat rice and beans with your fingers. There was not one server to flag down for a set of utensils, not one server came by to check how the food was. I had to go up to the cashier and ask for utensils... The servers all 4-5 of them were in the back chatting away. The only time they came around was to remove plates but even that took a while. Very bad service and mediocre food. Not coming back.

12.description: I've been there once but my parents order carry outs often.  I tried the ceviche de pescado... super yummy.  I also had the sopa de camarones.  Both menu items were great.  The ceviche de pescado is everything I expected, great flavor, love the taste of lemon.  The sopa de camarones was also delicious.  The shrimp are huge and have an awesome flavor.  The place is super clean and the waitress was super friendly.  I was torn between which ceviche to try so she offered us a generous sample portion of both ceviches and brought out tostadas and crackers.  I'm definitely a fan!

3.description: Delicious fresh seafood made to order. My shrimp diablo was on the sweeter side but still good. Wish it was more spicy. My friends fish was awesome!

1.description: It's a really small place but it's BEYOND clean. The kitchen is in full view so you can see everything that's going on , which I can appreciate. Service is awesome , with all the waitresses being super attentive.  Food is delicious, really recommend Camarones sarandeados. No matter how many seafood restaurants I try , I always come back to this one!

2.description: One of my favorite marisco places. My favorite are the camarones ala diabla... the rice on the dishes is so good as for the jaiva salad, and the buttered bread mmmm :P only cons are that its a bit small, the neighborhood is not that great and they only offer street parking. I still give them 5 stars though!

9.description: Sincerely... NOT A GOOD PLACE FOR SEAFOOD I have been probably to more than 50 seafood restaurants in Illinois in the past 2 to 3 years honestly this has Been one of the worst I don't understand those that have said is the best thing ever maybe there are a lot of people who can eat just about everything and everything tastes good to them.. I am definitely not one of those

10.description: One of my favorite restaurant in Chicago! Everything I have had here is great and seasoned well! I have done Veneno up north but it was not so yummy to me. A bit dry and bland. Maybe it was a bad night? BYOB = happy me! Go now! Abuelo awaits!

4.description: We came here for a gathering and the service was excellent!  The food was very good too.  We had langostinos as an appetizer and they were delicious!   My husband who doesn't like sea food ordered a Filete Sarandeado and he loved it!  I ordered a coctel de pulpo and Camaron and it was great too!  I also has a casuelita which is an alcoholic beverage with tequila, lime, orange and grapefruit slices. ..it was sooooo yummy!!! Overall we all enjoyed our food.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because during our time there two musicians, a man selling flowers and a woman selling cds came in asking if we wanted to buy.  It was a bit annoying, even though I appreciate the fact that they were working. Other than. The this is a nice place for mexican sea food.

6.description: Terrible food. Restaurant could use a cleaning. They also need to buy new dishes. They are all made of very old plastic. My sister ordered the breaded shrimp- the picture says it all. We were a group of 7 people. Everyone had a problem with their food. None of the shrimp was cleaned. When we asked about this, the waitress said that we have to ask for them to clean it before they made the food?? What??There was a "Jaiba" aka fake/processed imitation crab coleslaw that was slathered all over the real salad. Gross. No one ate it. I would never come here again. My mom, who birthday we were celebrating, said she remembers eating there and the food was much different. They obviously changed staff. I don't recommend anyone eat here. We still had the foods taste for a few days after. GROSS!

15.description: THE BEST SEA FOOD!!!!!!!!the Best sea food in chicago, I have never taste food so good!  this restaurant in in the Brighton park area, the area is not the best, but the food is delicious, its also a BYOB, the staff brings a "bucket" to place the beer w/ ice!! delicious food! I will definitely be going back there for more!!!!!!!!

0.description: Found it completely by accident as I was zigzagging through traffic on Archer from Midway toward the Stevenson.  The name was intriguing so I circled the block until I could find a parking spot.  Interior was cute, kinda beach-kitchy and super clean.  Had the Piña Rellena: this rocks! Seafood (fish, octopus, nice-sized shrimp, bits of bacon and pineapple smothered in cheese and roasted in a pineapple half. Served with avocado and rice and eaten like a taco. Delicious!

5.description: seafood at its greates. i was tired of EL VENENOs overly hyped restaurant so i decided to give this place a chance and it has become my favorite seafood place ever since . very fair prices and very good service. the oyters are always fresh and the fish is always cooked to perfection. did i mentioned is BYBO? oh yeah, take that EL VENENO!

13.description: I rarely eat seafood, but if my mom is not the one cooking it, I'll be getting it from this place! The service is great, their fast an knowledgeable about the menu items. You get a complementary soup with a shrimp in it and is just delicious and a good way to start your meal. Pescado Sarandiado es my favorite dish. This place is BYOB so do bring your Corona beer. Family own and run by a wonderful young couple. Can't wait for another dinner here!

11.description: Another great find in the books!A good friend of mine lives right by here and invited me out to dinner here over the weekend and I must say I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the seafood fare was here! Whenever I want seafood "estilo Nayarit" I normally head right on over to El Veneno but this place gives El Veneno a run for it's money! We started out with the shrimp ceviche platter, which was delectable. Perfectly seasoned, the shrimp tasted really fresh, and the red onion and cucumber inside the ceviche was perfectly chopped and crunchy. They did skimp a little on the avocado but when we asked for me the waitress did not hesitate to bring us over a plate of extra avocado. I ordered the "Camaron Empanizado" dinner which was excellent! Tons of battered and fried jumbo shrimp, served with this amazing white rice, this cole slaw-type concoction, toasted garlic bread, and a green salad. Good stuff.For it being a Saturday night, it wasn't really packed at all (unlike El Veneno where it's like THE place to see and be seen within Chicago's Mexican population, lolz!) and it is BYOB. The waitresses even brought out red plastic party cups rimmed with lime and salt for our Modelo's that we brought along for our dinner. God bless 'em.

8.description: I walked in this place 45 minutes before closing.  The waitress still very nice. For a sea food place we got fast service. The food was delicious.  I got the Cajun grilled butterfly shrimp and my friend got the filete relleno.  Their limited on drinks ( I do my best to stay away from soda). It's BYOB place.

14.description: This is a little Mexican Seafood Restaurant and the food is WAAAayyyyYYY good!  And the prices are great!  Only thing is if you are a drinker it's BYOB.  I would recommend the Empenadas de Camarones (shrimp empanadas) or the Ceviche.  Also the servers are super nice!  Excellent place!

7.description: The only one of the restaurants over on that corner that accepts credit / debit cards. This place serves seafood only. I ordered a ceviche tostada. It was served cold as are all of the tostadas. I did like it. I also had three tilapia tacos, cooked crispy and to golden brown, very delicious. I would try it again.

3.description: Since it's close to me, it's somewhere I go for convenience if I needed something. I prefer Pete's Market, Cermak Produce or even Dominick's and Jewel over them. I have to say some of the produce looks pretty old and unappealing. Doesn't seem there is a system by the meat area, since people just stood around waiting for help. They have all the basics, but just not the selections like the other stores. Prices on some items are good only when on sale.

1.description: Convenient but pricey. You have to catch the good weekly deals. I definitely wouldn't buy all my groceries from here and the alcohol is definitely over priced! They also allow the same panhandlers outside the entrance/exit asking for money, selling bootleg movies, homemade food (without proper permits). Good for convenience but over pricey and dirty.

2.description: I was grossed out and annoyed with this store. I walk in and the store looks like it hasn't been cleaned since the 80's. I should've just walked right out but we wanted some queso fresco to go with our awesome barbacoa.The setup is seriously weird. You have to buy your meats, juices and cheeses in the back and then pay for the rest of your stuff in the front. Wtf!?! Ok whatever I'll deal with not being able to scrutinize the cheese I buy (I'm psycho like that). So I pay for my cheese and decide to buy some Mexican soda to go with our Mexican meal. I notice that the sodas in the fridge have a huge sticker with a price which is weird but I don't mind. When I notice they have only one apple soda I go to the soda aisle to get a warm one(we love us some apple soda). This is when it makes sense why the have the huge price sticker. The sticker covers the barcode. If you buy the soda cold there is a 30 cent charge. WTF!?! Who does that? I leave all the sodas and leave with my cheese. When we take the cheese home it is quite clear that the cheese was left in the heat and then put back in the cold. My kids even refuse to eat it. Never again! I'll stick to Pete's or Jewel.

5.description: I feel like I need glow sticks and wear a club in shirt with my collar popped up whenever I come here. The one time I came here and it felt like a nightclub but all the lights were on. Loud techno music and don't forget to pay for your meat. Oh wait you can't touch your meat unless you pay for it. Ghetto store ghetto hood.

6.description: This store is good with cheap prices and its where i go alot since its by my boyfriends place, then the Jewel in the loop by my place. The prices are really cheap. but I sometimes worry about the cleanliness of the meat and if its not tainted or something. When they had arracheda on sale once, they were putting it on the scale all bloody and nothing underneath it. blood was dripping down the sides and dried blood was on the side to its was so disgusting . I didnt even buy any meat that day, but went to petes instead. Plus sometimes I notice the workers dont have gloves on. when there is a sale on chicken thighs. they have them in like this big box and not in the cooler so I m sorta disgusted by it but also chicken is what his cats eat so its okay.  I just keep coming back because its cheap. Plus someone who works there used to go to school with me so i stop by to say hey !

7.description: Supermercados El Guero have been good to me, and this one is my favorite.  It's the largest of the locations I've been to, and has the most extensive selection of produce and fresh meats.  Even more impressive than the variety is how fresh everything is.  A night-and-day difference from stores like Dominick's and Jewel.  This location seems to be the busiest as well, but everyone from the butchers to the cashiers work very hard to keep the lines moving.  Purchases from the butcher counter have to be paid for at separate cashiers at the end of the counter where they are marked as paid for when you bring the rest of your groceries to the front cashiers.  The liquor section is small, but the prices are great as well.            When I'm stuck for something to make for dinner, I get one of their rotisserie-roasted chickens.  A whole roasted chicken with seasoned, crispy skin is wrapped up with a package of fresh tortillas, and two little tubs of house-made salsa (sometimes red, sometimes green).  For the price of a Value Meal, you have dinner for two.

8.description: The prices are great and it is close to my house.  But I really suggest them to improve their store's cleanliness.  The Department of Health has closed the store a couple of times.  I tried switching stores like Cermak Produce and Pete's Market but they can't beat El Guero's prices.  Besides, I am a supporter of my community.  Mexicans need to stick together!

0.description: Personally, I still prefer Pete's Fresh Market.  But I live closer to this and the local Jewel.  When I need just a couple fruits or veggies (or if I'm at the laundromat and suddenly remember that I need some groceries), I stop here rather than hopping on a bus down to Pete's.  Huge selection of cheap produce, though like many supermercados, the rest of the groceries can be a bit pricey. Check out the cheap, 1ish dollar aisle though.  I found $1 pita chips there...once.  They also have candy and various types of nuts for cheap, though (in clear plastic boxes).  They sell Silk soymilk , and though it's $4, again, if that's all I need, I'd rather walk to El Guero than go all the way to Jewel.  They also sell some "carne soy," which is also a little pricey and MSG-laden, but pretty good.  Hey, that's rare to find in this part of town.Speaking Spanish helps, but I took French in high school :-P.  I just go in the line where a young person is working (they're more likely to know English).

4.description: Looks very dirty here. I don't know how this place is still open. You find cheaper process in Aldi, Cermack produce, or Pete's Fresh Market. The meat here doesn't taste that good. Has a lot of fat in it sometimes, not worth buying here.

3.description: Decent Walgreens. Pretty well stocked. Parking lot is small and usually someone out there selling candy or panhandling.

1.description: This is the crappiest pharmacy I've ever been to. Expect to wait at least 30 minutes in the drive-thru before someone actually helps you. What a joke!!

2.description: This is the worst pharmacy I have EVER been to.  I'd give them 0 stars.  They have in the past charged me for a 3 month prescription but only given me one month, they've mixed up my prescriptions, they fail to fill prescriptions and don't bother to call and let you know.  And forget any decent customer service--the pharmacy staff treat customers like we are wasting their time.Today I called in a prescription early in the morning.  the automated system said my script would be ready by 10:00 am.  I didn't pick up till later in the afternoon and the girl behind the counter informed me that she didn't have anything for me in the system.  Wha? Why?  She said I probably was refilling too early.  Crazy--this is a prescription I need, and I get filled constantly, and I have never had any problems.  Then she basically gave me a look that said, "next".  Then she chided me for "cutting her off" when I asked her a question and told me I would have to pay cash.I left.  I called another pharmacy.  Over the phone, the girl at THAT pharmacy told me that yes, I was too early to refill but it was no problem.  The insurance company had an "override" option on this prescription and she would have it ready in an hour. Thank God for other pharmacies who have employees who care about their customers.  I'll never come here for a refill again--I'd rather drive out of my way for a pharmacist who gets that I'm not trying to be shady by filling my prescriptions, but that I need them.  And then they actually offer to HELP.  Shocking concept Walgreens.

5.description: By far one of the worst Walgreens I've ever been into. The store must be one of the poorest run in the system. For months this store had two broken windows that went unreplaced. A dead tree in front took them over a year to replace. When it snows they fail to shovel the sidewalk around the entire perimeter of the store. For such a new store the floors have taken a beating and look tired along with the credit card pin pads. Outside of the early morning hours the place is a mess. When the workers begin to stock (around 10) they turn the store upside down without any regard to shoppers. Lines are often very long and end in an encounter with the lifeless checker. However, their selection is good for last minute items and their pharmacy is good.

0.description: I only come here because its close to my daughters school and they are always out of anything I ever need! Its a small walgreens so its expected...only come for simple things because sale items are usually sold out... The pharmacy does suck!!! They take forever inside abd the drive tru does dragg!!! Ugh would never come here to fill any prescriptions...

4.description: A standard Walgreens it is clean and well stocked. I The staff is nice

0.description: Dinosaur old computers, seating is horribly uncomfortable and to top it off the man that runs the place is rude! Don't waste your time or money here. Travel 3-4 mins headed to kedzie and 47th and in the shopping complex there is a well worth computer lounge. I can spend hours comfortably here they even have refreshments.  If you pass the bank on the corner you went to far.

3.description: I've seen Dr. Juarez about four times already and really like him.  He listens to my concerns and has been working with me to relieve the pain in my neck and lower back.I've also been there a few times for a massage and Ana is just PHENOMENAL!

1.description: Dr. Juarez and Ana are the best!  Ana is the best massage therapist, she is great you can tell she loves her job and knows what she is doing.  Dr. Juarez is a great doctor.  I had back pain for years and after a couple visits the back pain went away.  I was suffering from migraines and with the help of Ana and Dr. Juarez they are under control!  They keep the office very clean I have never seen dirt on the floors.  I recommend them to everyone!

2.description: I was a patient of Dr. Juarez's when he was a student at National University in Lombard. My sister-in-law is a chiropractor and encouraged me to go to the university for my chiropractic care.Dr. Juarez was always informative, professional, and he always took the time necessary to address my concerns. Having seen many different chiropractors before, Dr. Juarez's adjustments are among the most gentle and, I feel, the most accurate. I like the technique he uses and always found myself feeling better after my appointments with him.Now I just wish I lived closer so I could get regular chiropractic adjustments from him!

9.description: I bought a Groupon for 3 massage/chiropractic services and have already had one appointment. The space is very nice and Dr. Juarez is friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. They allow you to book appointments online too, which is really convenient. My massage was with Ana who was delightful and good at what she does. Check them out, it's worth it!

10.description: Great experience dealing with both Anna and Dr Rod.I was so happy with my personal experience I purchased gift certificates for my mom and sister. By the way,  they loved it as much as I did!!!!

4.description: I suffered from planters fasciitis pain for about 3 years, it felt like knives going through my heels! I seriously considered switching careers (I work retail) I didn't think I would be able to work this holiday season! I had visited pediatrist and all they did was give me cortisone shots that would wear off  and leave me in worse pain... I seen Doctor Juarez, and after the first visit started feeling better. I seen him 3 more times and I feel 100 percent healed from this horrible condition!!! Thank you Dr. Juarez, you are a miracle healer!

6.description: This place knows how to treat its customers. The offices is clean, very well kept, and most importantly, the service is very informative and tailored to you. As an athlete, whenever I have a problem I can always rely on Dr. Juarez to help me in answering not only how to fix it, but what caused it and the fundamentals on how to stay away from that injury in the future. To be completely honest, my interest in chiropractics has grown into a fascination that has now caused me to pursue a license as a chiropractor all thanks to the explanations and amazing recovery I've gone through with the help of Dr. Juarez.

12.description: Dr. Juarez really took time out to listen to my complaints which was a refreshing change as compared to other doctors. I came in with neck pain and after only a  couple of visits it is virtually gone!

5.description: Dr. Juarez has seriously changed my everyday life. I was dealing with mid and lower back pain for about 2 years and it was so uncomfortable, not to mention painful. Dr.Juarez really took the time to listen to my issues and explain to me what steps would be necessary to fix them. After only a few adjustments I am feeling amazing.The things I really appreciate about Dr. Juarez:1. He is definitely affordable, I was always hesitant about seeing a chiropractor because I always hear about how expensive they can be but if thats your reason not to see a chiropractor give Dr.Juarez a try.2. He is friendly and professional. He converses with his patients and tries to get know them in order to form a good Dr/patient connection. 3. He knows what he is doing and gets straight to the point.4. Free Parking outside.5. Relaxing environment in the office.

11.description: GREAT DOCTOR! No more back or neck pain, massage and acupuncture  is a most!

8.description: I have been going to Dr. Juraz for almost a year now. He's kind, very professional and simply wonderful! Place is really cozy, FREE parking outside. I've had herniated disc issue for a while, and when I'm in pain, the pain is pretty intense. No treatments seem to work well long term. Luckily, I found Dr Juraz on yelp and decided to give him a try. After few adjustments, I've seen dramatic improvements. Now i go here to get my regular massages. His office is so close to where I live, it just make sense to make this a regular. For massages, ask for Denise!! Denise is AMAZING!! She has the most gifted and magical hands that heals your pain and really work on your problematic area. I love massages and also pick. tried a dozen of different places in the past. No one tops Denise. She is truly one of THE BEST. She's available by appointments only. Ask for $40 special for 1st time clients. Great Deal can't miss!

0.description: After my first visit, I knew I came to the right doctor. This year I've been getting all types of injuries so I try to do research and see a doctor that is affordable but knows what he's doing. I felt very comfortable knowing I was in the right hands. Walked out of there feeling 50% better just after the first visit. Will definitely keep going back.The office is just off 47th street, very cozy waiting area and friendly environment.

7.description: I saw Dr. Juarez for chronic neck pain I've been dealing with for years. Being the first chiropractor I have ever visited, I was filled with anxiety but Dr. Juarez addressed my issues and was very knowledgeable not only with his practice, but with exercises I can do at home, which has GREATLY improved my condition. Thank you for taking the time to help me!

28.description: Well, I am also a recent victim of the dreaded 3 hour delivery. Timeline:8:15 PM order placed online for a large pepperoni for 9:15 delivery time.9:15 PM *tumbleweeds*10:00 PM I think maybe i misinterpreted their online ordering system and 9:15 means maybe that is when they start making the pizza. So I call them, long story short, they throw a pie in the oven for me and promise to remove the delivery charges.11:00 PM Pizza arrives.2 days later. credit card finalizes. Delivery and tip not removed from bill. Makes me wonder what would of happened if I hadn't called. Do they just keep my money for free?Is calling them the impetus they need to begin my order? Should i order online, then call within 5 minutes to get an order on time?Never again.

1.description: La Cocos is your traditional pizza place.I order from her often because it's close to home.When picking up the order is always on time however delivery does take longer than expected.The calzones are delicious!! And I love the mad fries (without the chili).The Italian ice is a must have!!They are all delicious but nothing is better than the traditional lemon. The employees are always friendly, helpful and quick (:

9.description: Really dissappointed. Grew up down the street and loved their food. But to day I had to wait an hour and a half after being told the wait time would be an hour. Got attitude on the phone and in the end got a barely warm pizza. Had I known I would have to heat it myself I shouldve just bought a frozen pizza. Never again!

29.description: This place is horrible! I ordered my food at 9:30pm and it's 11 o'clock and the person tells me that the driver will be here any minute.  He told me the same thing at 10:40. Then I ask why is a chicken sandwich and chili taking so long and he blames the driver.  This is pitiful excuse for customer service!

23.description: I was enticed by a birthday promotion offering 50% off any pizza so I said what's the harm.  First off it is a different setup than when I was in here previously a longggg time ago.  The bar called Mad Anthony's took over much of the space and La Coco's was rendered primarily to a take out area.First visit to take advantage of the birthday promo yielded a fairly decent pizza.  Generous toppings nice taste sweet yet enough Italian spice.  Could use a little more sauce.  The thin crust was crisp on the outside edges but unfortunately a little soggy in the middle.  Not sure if that was due to ensuring a prompt pickup time or the fresh green pepper and mushroom ingredients.A second try the following week with the same pizza gave us the same results.  So it was not a fluke.  I really want to give this a better rating due to the taste and fresh ingredients but that soggy middle was too much to ignore.  Fix that and you get three stars.

5.description: I recently had my daughter's Birthday party at LaCoco's Banquet.  I couldn't have been more happier with how great everything was. Staff was super friendly! The food came out at EXACTLY the time I had requested! The room and bathrooms were very clean and organized.The pizza was so good I had to order more for my guests! :)

31.description: So we have been ordering from this place for over a year.  In a neighboorhood that does not have much in the way of delivery this place what just what was needed. Great thin pizza, chips and salsa (salsa is amazing!), good calzones and good italian beef....on and italian ice that is oh so good.Now we ordered last week and the pizza was burnt....the chips to go with the salsa are burnt....we figure it is Friday it was an off night.  Now it is a week later and we place another order. Pizza is burnt AGAIN.  Italian beef is tiny and not how we ordered it.  I ordered a burger and it is PINK I do not mind medium but this is too pink.We call to speak to a manager...who has a hard time identifing herself, then has an attitude with me?  Then says that they had 300 orders go out today and we are the first to complain!!?? OK...needless to say that they have lost a customer.

25.description: So this used to a great place to grab a great charbroiled burger, Italian beef, french fries and pizza.  I used to come here alot with my uncle and aunt growing up. Back then it was just Lacoco's, a small joint with a few stools to sit and eat, but mostly take out.  The customer service was great and you felt appreciated for your business. Now it is part of Madd Anthonys and provides the food for sports bar that was built in it's place.  Times change, I know..  But i guess sometimes you wish things would stay the same. So now that I am past the nostalgia, I can get down to the nitty gritty.   I ordered a family size pizza for the my parents and the kiddos last week.  Pick up was the best option since they are about five minutes away.  They have a pretty good deal, a family size pizza with one topping for $9.99..  The pizza was actually pretty good, nice amount of toppings, good sauce, and enough to feed five of us.    Again, the price is a bargain.. I would choose this place over two $5 pizzas from Little Cesars in a heartbeat. I actually would be giving this place 3 stars but the manager was kind of an ass about giving me the Yelp check-in special they offered, which i wasn't aware of until I arrived and checked in..  It basically was the same exact deal with a free two liter of pop.   The manager fretted a bit about not being aware of the deal and then agreed to give me the pop.  He then followed up with having to choose from a diet two liter or a can of RC because his shipment of liters was late.   I really didn't care too much for the diet pop but i said to myself what the heck, it's free.   So I tell the guy, i will take the diet.  His response, "it's free anyway so it shouldn't matter"..    I guess, it doesn't matter to them that people actually feel welcome and feel appreciated as customers in this joint..   I took my pizza and the pop and left, but I will definitely be hesitant about trying this place again.   I guess everything really did change here at Lacoco's after all.

12.description: Our go to place when we want quick fast food. 9.99 family size pizza with side of hot buffalo wings, our usual order. food is great, my favorite is the meatball sandwich. So delicious.

21.description: Great pizza and wings! Everything is good. If you go the bar side of the place and order to eat and have some drinks it is a very nice place and service.

16.description: I have always been very pleased with my food from LaCoco's! The breaded steak sandwiches are out of this world, the meatballs are amazing, wings are great and I am always craving the pan pepperoni pizza! I have done both dine in and delivery. It's amazing that they deliver the distances they do because there isn't any good food places close to my house!! Highly recommend!!!

17.description: Horrible customer service. I usually try to have patience with people since I work in customer service but this place has literally the worst customer service I have experienced in a long time. Most places will try and work with you especially if it was a mistake/problem on their end but this place did not even apologize or say let me make this right or anything. More like oh well attitude towards their customer. Last time I try to order from this shit hole. Avoid this place it has bad service and over priced food. Food is alright but it's not even worth the bad service you receive.

10.description: The MADD Fries and the Chicken Sandwiches were so awesome, I just wanted to tell everyone that you have to stop by and try them :) Keep up the good work

11.description: is a love and hate relationship with la cocos, one day they i have such great service and fast pizza and other days i have horrible service and a long wait for pizza.  staff is great (sometimes) and the alcohol selection is good. specials are good but i think they need more beer specials (drinking= more people eating) hint*

26.description: The chicken strips are so delicious dipped with ranch dressing and side order of french fries. It is very, very good. Pizza is reasonable prices and very good. The chicken wings are out of this world. I recommend this restaurant if you have a taste for chicken.

27.description: Just got a chicken sandwich from there and thought it was really good. Also can't argue with a good pizza deal and it's good pizza!New delivery guy was also really nice. Hopefully paid well.Pretty positive experience.

35.description: A usual staple of our company supplied holiday celebration ( or winter festival, or yearly gathering, or whatever you want to call it to keep with the p.c. people)  The pizza is really not that bad, and is always delivered hot, fresh, and on time, even if we order 30 pizzas.  But also, their sandwiches are pretty good, I'd try the meatball sandwich (just my suggestion).  The only thing wrong I have ever experienced here is when picking up an order, the people they have working the take out/pick-up counter seem to have severe mental deficiencies  ( borderline retarded- that wouldn't be at all p.c.).

0.description: Good pizza, and good lunch specials at the attached bar.Good for:BurgersPizzaPastaWingsVery good place.  Probably a 3.5 but I don't have that option.

20.description: Once again I wish you could give negative stars on yelp.The worst customer service! We ordered a pizza and fries at 6:30. We were told our order would be here in an hour. At 7:45 my husband calls to find out where our order is. He was told it's with the driver and should be there in a few minutes. Our order finally arrives at 8:05. The pizza is cold and no french fries. My husband tells the driver we want a refund because who wants a cold pizza. The driver says call for a refund. My husband proceeds to call and ask Jackie "the manager" for a refund. She was very sarcastic and did not even apologize. Now my husband is just amazed at the horrible customer service. He asks Jackie who her boss is and once again is extremely sarcastic and rude and says go ahead and call my boss then hangs up. The worst we will never order from here again. This is just absolutely unacceptable behavior from the service industry. We were pretty regular customers, not anymore.  If you want an incorrect order and cold pizza feel free to order from here. If not call somewhere, anywhere else. ********ORDER AT YOUR OWN RISK***********Update:  I would like to say thank you to Anthony for the apology to my husband.  Unfortunately Jackie has left a such a bad impression that we still will not return to your establishment.

19.description: Came in for lunch on a Saturday with a fairly large group, (15 or so) and it took fooooorever to get our food. An hour and a half or so.Also, it was cold. I'm normally hot, and everyone in the group, including me, was shivering.The one nice thing about the place was that they split the check for us without complaint.OK wings. So-so loaded fries. Probably will not return.

33.description: This place sucks compared to what it used to be. The chili is awful now and the last thing this neighborhood needs is ANOTHER place for idiots to be drinking all day.

2.description: Unfortunately, my experience was bad. The server took 20 minutes to come to our table (the place was empty) and got our order wrong twice. We stayed pretty calm throughout but kept going up to the bartender to ask about our order. We later learned that the server was new and still getting a hang of things. While they were very accommodating about correcting each error, and this was likely an isolated situation, I stand by my rating for two reasons: 1) I ordered sweet heat chicken tenders and they brought me inferno. When I mentioned the error, the server left and brought back the same tenders disguised as sweet heat. I bit into them and my mouth went numb instantly. Not ok. 2) The server never wrote down our order. This all could have been avoided if she had written it down. The bartender saved our dinner. We could have left right after the food fiasco but we stayed after she apologized profusely and brought us a round of drinks and fries to tame the heat we'd just endured.

34.description: So I have been going to this place for over 10 years., it was awesome.. BUT I went in after some time to get some italian ice and burgers.. only to see that you can only enter thru the bar.. no more drive thru, limited menu... and food was very different.  Red sauce was total opposite of what it was before. everything else was ok, but nothing worth going back for.  Plus there seemed to be a "regular" crowd in there screaming and yelling and totally wasted at 3pmThere are many better places in the area...  Server was nice though.. only real positive.

32.description: i don't know, this place is all right if you just need a quick slice of thin crust. you know, their thin is all right. but something about their deep dish, if you get a slice, i mean it fills you up and all that, but the tomato sauce tastes like they just scooped out a couple of table spoons from some generic can of tomato sauce that tastes like metal

18.description: Once again I wish you could give negative stars on yelp.The worst customer service! We ordered a pizza and fries at 6:30. We were told our order would be here in an hour. At 7:45 my husband calls to find out where our order is. He was told it's with the driver and should be there in a few minutes. Our order finally arrives at 8:05. The pizza is cold and no french fries. My husband tells the driver we want a refund because who wants a cold pizza. The driver says call for a refund. My husband proceeds to call and ask Jackie "the manager" for a refund. She was very sarcastic and did not even apologize. Now my husband is just amazed at the horrible customer service. He asks Jackie who her boss is and once again is extremely sarcastic and rude and says go ahead and call my boss then hangs up. The worst we will never order from here again. This is just absolutely unacceptable behavior from the service industry. We were pretty regular customers, not anymore.  If you want an incorrect order and cold pizza feel free to order from here. If not call somewhere, anywhere else. ********ORDER AT YOUR OWN RISK***********Update:  I would like to say thank you to Anthony for the apology to my husband.  Unfortunately Jackie has left a such a bad impression that we still will not return to your establishment.

13.description: This pizza hits the spot.  Good quality cheese.  The sauce is a little sweet for my taste, but whatever.  The extra thin crust is nice and crunchy.  This pizza kind of reminded me of Chuck e Cheese (or showbiz pizza if you remember those days). I recommend.

4.description: Bad service over the phone ... they give you attitude if you tell them they did your order wrong ... and tell you to waste your time bringing it back or that its your fault you dont speak clearly ... constantly got our order wrong and  the pizzas are never fully cooked I guess they are in a rush but they take forever to deliver  anyway ....

24.description: I love this pizza!!! soooo delicious! It's worth the wait because it's always fresh! Loyal customer for life!

6.description: I loveLaCoco's and don't mind the merge with MADD Anthony's. The music can be loud sometimes and the bar patrons are sure interesting, but overall a good experience. I come here for the deep dish pizza when I do swing through the neighborhood. There's something about it that's SO much better than chains, and we all know that we don't really eat THAT much deep dish in one year. When I do crave it, I'll always call LaCoco's.

22.description: Came in for lunch on a Saturday with a fairly large group, (15 or so) and it took fooooorever to get our food. An hour and a half or so.Also, it was cold. I'm normally hot, and everyone in the group, including me, was shivering.The one nice thing about the place was that they split the check for us without complaint.OK wings. So-so loaded fries. Probably will not return.

15.description: When i comes to delivery you need to live close or your food will be cold and takes for ever to get here plus i ordered a spaghetti  and its supposed to come with a salad after waiting over a hour in a half they forget my salad lol and plus my huge portion only came with two small meatballs plus my boyfriend ordered the madd fries and it was very sloppy and soggy only order if last resort

7.description: Placed an order for my sons b'day, Celia took the phone order and all smooth and easy. Its the official pizza at our kids school BCA and they seem to like it very much.

8.description: I've never eaten at the establishment,  so I can only speak to their pizza delivery,  and it's probably one of the best experiences I've had with pizza in Chicago.  Great thin crust. Lots of cheese.  The sauce has a good citrus bite. All the toppings are exceptional.  My order has always been correct, and they're pretty fast. Very important to note, they probably have one of the best values as well.  On weekdays,  you can get a family size pizza, just cheese,  for $9.99. Now, if you want a XL pepperoni pizza,  it's like 15 bucks,  but if you must do the $9.99 deal,  and add the topping, it's only an additional $2.99. Such a good deal for truly great pizza.

30.description: Some things never change. Ordered a few months ago. I realize that a lot has changed,but the service is still horrible. Ordered a pan pizza with pepperoni. Pizza took 1.5 hours for delivery. Brought it upstairs and discovered that it was a pie with everything. Called them, explained. No apology, but another will come. You would think they would think "We messed up, this is a long-time customer, so we'll put some effort into getting this quickly delivered." Nah. Took another hour and 20 minutes. Discount for all of the bullshit? Nah.In this situation,I debate cancelling, but I'm hungry and already have so much time invested. Do I risk calling another pizza place? I should have,and then tell Lacoco's when they showed up that I did not want the pizza anymore.Pizza joints ought to be honest and just tell a customer that things are running slow because they'd at least KEEP their customers with honesty, rather than put them through a shit experience like this.EVERYONE: Do not patronize this place. Let it go out of business.

3.description: Ordered 3 garbage salads and a bowl of chili for delivery.. 2 hours later I get a call saying the delivery won't be here for at least another hour so I cancel the order and order from Dino's about the same distance away. 15 minutes after I placed the order with Dino's our food arrived nice and fresh... And the La coco's delivery walks up right behind them. I informed the delivery driver that I canceled the order because it took forever and he called the restaurant and had me speak with an individual that told me it's not a big deal if the delivery got there late and if the chili is cold you can just throw it microwave... Is she serious??! I refused the delivery and will never be ordering from this place again. They're consistently late on deliveries and the way they do business is BAD for business..

14.description: Very poor customer service. I was rudely hung up when I was attempting to place my order. People that answer the phone have no customer service etiquette or consideration towards ordering a few minutes before closing. To top it off I order literally almost every weekend. If I could rate customer service 0 stars I would.

3.description: Weekend made Menudo?? It is very good you have to try it. It's only to go and they have carnitas they are good like just about everywhere. Oh and don't walk in there with loose change to buy anything like a two liter of pop lol, you can feel they hate it. The store is too pricey on everything els, not a good thing and no parking lot so you park on the street and you have to pay the meter just to stop in.

1.description: If you're planning a Mexican family picnic this is a pretty awesome place to go grocery shopping for the event. There's tons of carne, pollo, spices and pablano peppers for way cheaper than you'd find these ingredients at a Jewel. There's also a really large liquor selection with some higher end tequilas so the most important aspects of this fiesta should be covered at La Palma. Compared to several of the other markets in the area that aren't online this store is the cleanest and most well organized. They also have an ATM if you just happen to be nearby and need some cash.

2.description: Not only does La Palma Supermercado sell the tasty ingredients, they also make the food on the weekend to sell. The Barbocoa is delicious. You can tell it's high quality and prepared and seasoned perfectly. They should start a catering business!

0.description: The food is packed with flavor and authentic. The beef tacos are one of my favorites. It's filled with shredded beef that has a nice texture where it's not too chewy and marinated to perfection. It's topped off with a green salsa that  has a spicy kick but well-balanced with a sweet after taste. A lime garnish completes the beef taco; a taco that I wouldn't mind eating any (or every) day of the week.

I decided to go to Mariscos for lunch on a Friday afternoon. I'd read good things about it on a local food discussion group, so I figured why not? This outpost of Mariscos (which also has El Abulo y Yo in its name), is on a busy, industrial stretch of Kedzie at 38th St. The interior of the restaurant is bright from the abundant natural light which streams in courtesy of the corner location. Each table is adorned with a surprisingly large  assortment of good hot sauces (El Yucateco, Tamazula, Salsa Huichol, Valentina, Tapatio, etc.). When you are seated, you'll be given a small plastic cup with a tasty shrimp consomme.The menu given to me by the server seemed to be geared toward the dinner crowd. I ordered a  tostada topped with s generous portion of shrimp ceviche. It was tasty and was a bargain at only $2.50.  While I prefer a little more acid to my ceviche, they did provide a bowl of fresh limes which I took immediate advantage of.I had read about their fish tacos, but saw no trace of them on the menu. The server said that it would be no problem to prepare them (at about $2.00 each). The fish was piping hot and fantastic, served on corn tortillas. They clearly know how to prepare seafood here.Based on the food, I would give Mariscos a solid 4 stars, especially considering the relatively low price. Note: the standard dinner items may be less of a deal, as it would be hard to find an entree under $13 here.Alas, the service I was given could best be described as supreme indifference. Upon completing my meal, I had to wait 5 minutes or so for her to make eye contact with me long enough to take away my plate and another 10 minutes before she allowed me to request the check. And this was in a lunch service with only one other table occupied.I don't take to being willfully ignored gladly, so I won't be making a return visit. Still, I certainly won't disparage the food at all. It was very tasty.

3.description: I'm new to Chicago and a friend recommended this place. The food was delicious and fresh, and the serving size for the price can't be beat. They also make the best and biggest egg roll I've ever had. The lady cashing me out was also very nice and friendly. Definitely my go-to place for Chinese food!

1.description: Love, love , love the Crab Rangoon here! Best in town. Reasonable prices and good food. Mongolian Beef is top notch. ***Note: This is a totally different place than the previous occupants with almost the same name.

2.description: The food and service here are both absolutely amazing. Everything is fresh, the prices are right, and the food is delicious.

9.description: We ordered the dinner for 3 (pepper steak, chicken wings, shrimp egg foo young, shrimp fried rice, cookies crab rangoon and chicken noodle soup) a small chop suey a bannana & strawberry smoothie and a pineapple & coconut smoothie....first off....the portions are ginormous....so so much food...we had a feast before us...people looked at us like crazy wild madmen for ordering so much....everything is literally cooked fresh from scratch...wonderful & unique in my opinion... they dont skimp out on the meat ingredients...the taste is amazing...so delicious... so fresh tasting...nothing overdone...everything just right... their smoothies are fantastic... they use actual fruit...we have left overs for a few days... definitely going back....will spread the word too...excellent restaurant in the heart of brighton park...you'll love it... JHG

10.description: Chinese food is my favorite cuisine. Recently my "usual" Chinese food restaurant changed ownership and suddenly the food wasn't too great. I decided to give Chop Suey City a try. I AM GLAD I DID! The food is some of the best Chinese food I have had. It is very fresh and full of flavor! The inside of the restaurant is very clean also which is a huge plus. The staff is also very friendly. Looks like I found my new favorite restaurant!  Maybe next time I'll try their smoothies with tapioca! Lol

4.description: All the other Chinese food places suck around the McKinley Park area, so much so that I'd just rather drive to China Town to get something better. I'm glad this place opened up. Good food, perfect for when I'm not in the mood to cook (which is always) and I'm too lazy to go pick something up.

6.description: We order delivery from this place probably twice per month. It is our favorite! The food is always fresh and cooked perfectly. The crab rangoon is fantastic, and the fried rice and chicken and shrimp dishes have been tasty too. Delivery is fast and the driver and everyone who answers the phone are all very friendly and have made great food recommendations! They often give us a an order of free egg rolls or a complimentary drink as well as have good portion sizes for a reasonable price. Best Chinese food in the area!

12.description: I've always appreciated the quality of food and friendly customer service that Chop Suey brings to the table. I've never actually sat down at their restaurant, but they bring speedy delivery and pickup service. I'm not sure if the owners changed or the chefs. But they have done nothing but improve their already great tasting food. The ingredients are fresh and consistent in flavor. Their general tso's chicken is amazing and their fried rice. I would say if you're in the neighborhood and your craving Chinese food, this is the place to go .

5.description: Ordered take out once from here last week. It was so delicious. I ordered the Curry Chicken and my husband ordered the Mongolian Beef and egg rolls... Yum!  I got a smoothie and it was alright. The Curry Chicken was not breaded meat but tender the sauce was a perfect thickness and a medium spice.  The fried rice was delicious and the egg roll was yummy too.

11.description: Best egg rolls in town and they're huge.  Tried many dishes and the quality of the ingredients and experience of the chef shines through.  Quantities are large and there's no shortage of beef or shrimp in your dish.  Try the Mongolian beef especially if you like it spicy.  Very clean and friendly place to go.  I can't wait to go again and try the shrimp and broccoli.  Plenty of street parking, just east of McDonalds!

8.description: I have ordered from here a couple of times and every time my order has been wrong. Besides that good food.

0.description: I had passed by on my way home from work and decided to try it out. I love Chinese food, and I was craving it after a long day. I made an order to-go and was told the wait would be about 15-20 minutes--perfect, as I had bought a bottle of wine prior, and what better way to spend my time while waiting. The woman at the front, who also took my order, is very sweet and attentive. Such a nice first experience. Will definitely be returning, as it is just around the corner!Also, I totally agree with a previous reviewer: their quantities are quite large! It's worth the price you are paying!

7.description: The best crab Rangoon !! I never was a fan but when I tasted theirs it is simply Delish! The combo rice is very good and don't past up on the orange chicken ! I highly recommend.

3.description: Came here to pick up food for the Bears game. They were a little slow since they had only 3 people working.Ordered 20 piece chicken, large fries, 6 biscuits and red beans and rice.Chicken is ok. Large fries didn't even come in the box like Ashland does. Don't eat biscuits and didn't eat any of the red beans and rice.I'll rather drive the extra 5-10 minutes to Ashland instead.

1.description: People here are great and always happy to serve.. We usually go in large groups and can be a handful at times, but that doesn't phase them at all. They should really stop selling red stick chicken though... That stuff is wack

2.description: Chicken is dry. Ordered 2 piece meal and the drumsticks were dry hardly any meat. Fries were good and so were the mashed potatoes

0.description: It's hard to write about a franchise location, since the food and menu and decor is pretty much all the same.  But when it comes down to the little things, this Popeye's location is "a good one".The ordering area has a neat section with a maze of poles and bars, like you'd find at an amusement park.  Wheee!!!!  Chicken!!!  The staff at the register have been nothing but courteous to us one those occasions that we find ourselves in this area and in the mood for fried chicken (as opposed to the fried chicken establishments a few blocks from where we live).Honestly, just about every time it's been because I wanted to get food at Frank's Shrimp House a few doors down, but my fiance was not in the mood for that and preferred that I pick up Popeye's for her instead.Not a problem here.  I don't know if it's just the time of day I make these trips on the weekend, but the inside of the restaurant is frequently EMPTY.  No wait in the line.  No noise from the immaculate tables set up on the other half of the establishment.  There are occasionally cars in the drive-thru, so I have no doubt that they'll be going bankrupt or closing anytime soon.All in all, they do a good job here.  I've never had a problem with one of my orders.  The food is of the same caliber I expect from a Popeye's franchise location.  The staff knows what they're doing.If you're in the area and you want to eat Popeye's, c'mon in.  If not, see if you can find me at Frank's down the street waiting on some jumbo fried shrimp.

1.description: This is my hardware store.  I use to live in the area, which is how I found it.  I still go there even though I now live in another neighborhood. The owner is so helpful, very kind, and extremely knowledgeable.  I go in there, explain what I need and they get it.  They keep their prices low and pay the sales tax for you.  They have almost everything and if they don't, they know where you can get it and don't mind giving you the information for another store.   You can still go in there and buy a handful of nails or screws unlike Home Depot where you have to buy a whole box.  The other day I went in for an adapter for my portable dishwasher.  I had my 2 year old son with me who wanted to carry the bag.  Knowing that kids drop bags, the owner took another small bag, gave it to my son and then gave me the adapter.  It's the small things that matter when I choose the place I frequent.  I really can't express how great this store is in a review, you really just have to go there and see what it's like to have great customer service and get what you really need at a great price.

2.description: This NOSTALGIC hardware store will have you screaming AUNT BEA I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!  This family owned business has been there ever since I have been alive!  As soon as you walk into the place and step onto the wooden creaking floors you're transformed back to a time when all was right with the world.  I went to get a piece of glass to repair a window and of course they had it!  THEY HAVE EVERYTHING!  Any odd- strange item that you think you could never find anywhere this place has it somewhere in the archives!  They'll disappear and come back with exactly what you wanted.  Along with my glass they gave me a SLAB of putty wrapped up in newspaper and all the corner wedges I need to put the window in.  Just like the olden days!  It's not like going into Home Depot and having some pimple faced kid with his mouth open try to guess which isle to send you down!  These people know the hardware business inside and out, if they don't have what you're looking for you aren't going to find it---and if nothing else it'll make you feel all nostalgic just being there!  They've always been SO WONDERFUL I think when they close their doors I'll feel a twinge of pain in my heart!

0.description: This is one of my favorite places. They have all sorts of necessary stuff in an old-time hardware store. I have gone in there with all sorts of nerd projects, and they have always helped me out. Their prices are less than the new Home Depot .5 miles away. Fronczak's has the best service (and parts) whereas Home Depot has none.

12.description: I remember ordering from here back when I was a wee pup.  Since I'm not currently in range for Giordano's delivery (full disclosure, my fave), Piezano's is a great substitute.  The food was delivered fast and hot, and you can't beat the RC.  I've never had a grinder from here, but I've heard good things.  The only downfalls that I've ever faced are the fact that there is no websiteI'll dig through the menu drawer anytime for this local secret!

7.description: Time & time again, I am left disappointed. This my neighborhood pizzeria & I decided to take my business elsewhere for the lack of pretty much everything. I unfortunately was willing to give them another chance today, since my order would b so simple... Guess what... My order was wrong again! I ordered 2 slices of sausage, 1 slice of pepperoni. Instead I got the opposite, I called & had to drive back to get the right slice. I kindly told the cashier I'm here for a slice under my name... This cashier didn't event greet me FYI & she handed my slice with the rudest stare, she said absolutely nothing. No apology or thank you. In what business is this acceptable?! I also work near by & before would place my order with plenty of time so I could take my lunch appropriately, upon every arrival they would barely start my order... If I'm calling, I'm going with the intention of my order being ready. I mean a slice should not take 30 minutes when I was promised 10.  This place is pathetic.. Oh & the slices I picked up were cold. Worst service ever! They need to b educated on customer service & speedier food preparation.

3.description: My friend told me to stop by here and visit this place. Glad I did, had some pizza and ribs. They had a lot of random food like mozzarella sticks and RC cola. I was in heaven, cute little spot. There is parking in the back and they also serve slices. A really home like place. Clean enough to not be a hole in the wall place but def has the home style appeal.

1.description: The pizza still delivers on taste. The mozzarella cheese sticks, however, are not good. They use your run of the mill frozen variety and serve it with a decent marinara sauce. The sauce couldn't save them, though.

2.description: Pizza is amazing, light and great sauce. Will definitely be back. Came from California and was treated to greatness. They have a full menu.

9.description: If I could give this business zero stars I would! I placed an order for delivery tonight and did not get what a ordered or payed for. I ordered a chicken parmesan but wanted to substitute the spaghetti for fettuccine alfredo. I was told it would be an additional charge, which I agreed to pay because I understand that alfredo sauce is more expensive (I managed an Italian restaurant so I know) I still received a chicken parmesan with fettuccine but no alfredo sauce! I called and spoke to Michael and he proceeded to argue with me and wouldn't even let me talk. He did offer to replace my food but he was very adamant about how I could not touch the food if I wanted it replaced! Seriously? That's pety. I understand small businesses are struggling to keep up with chain restaurants and there are a lot of chronic complainers that are looking for a free meal, but I  did agree to pay for my modifications. He even laughed at me! I had my phone on speaker when I ordered so my sister knows that I made myself clear on what I wanted. I also waited 1.5 hours for my delivery and was not told that if I was paying with a card I would have to pay over the phone...actually I was never asked about the method of payment I would be using. The delivery driver was kind of clueless. He placed my food outside in 10 degree weather while I went back upstairs to settle my payment over the phone. The food was mediocre at best. Jalapeño poppers were dry and gross. Save your money and go elsewhere.

10.description: I got the submarine grinder for $5.45 + tax. It was pretty good. It was nice, warm, and filling.  It took 10 min to bake though. And its a minimum of $10 for credit card use but there's no sign that says that.

13.description: The pizza is really good and the delivery is quick.

16.description: The only thing I like about this place are the kids working the counter, they are really nice neighborhood kids who have a killer sense of humor.  Other than that, the food fucking sucks, I feel sick everytime I go here and the selection sort of blows.  The pizza selection in Brighton Park leaves something to be desired.

17.description: great thin crust pizza with the perfect cheese. order well done!!!!

15.description: Awesome pizza, north side quality at south-side pricing.

0.description: This has been my go too pizzeria. I've been coming here for a long time and the taste of the food is just perfect. I love their pizza, it's crispy and delicious. Glad they have new staff in the front counter.

5.description: Well, for the 3rd or 4th time this year, I've stopped in after work. Time varied between 2:30 and 5:30 PM. Went for slices and they were out of slices. NOT ONE. For a place that sells slices, this is weird. I know it's not the typical lunch time (11AM-1PM), but to have NO slices? This last time I kind of jokingly asked if it was something I did. The cashier didn't get it. I explained that every time I come here, they're out of slices. She said "I don't know". Hmmm... I asked if there was a good time or bad time to come, as in maybe after "school" hours, so they are stocked up for students or something. She said "no" and added that maybe I can phone ahead and they can save me some slices. WTF? If they have no slices NOW, what are they going to save? And, if I order ahead, why don't I just order a whole fresh pizza? Because--if I were to order a whole pizza, it would be from some place better and more reliable.

11.description: My wife and I went here to get some sandwiches for lunch.  The staff was rude and condescending to us when we placed our order.  My wife's sandwich was not heated through and mine was pretty bland.  The foodstuffs seem store bought and I've definitely made better at home.  Way too expensive for what we got.

8.description: Their pizza is good but I suggest picking up in person. I've never had a pizza arrive in under an hour and a half. Call and ask? They give you an excuse that you live too far. Phone service isn't their forte. Thanks, but I'll go elsewhere who doesn't blame me for the 90 minute wait.To top it all off, they deliver the wrong pizza.

4.description: Your Business is buy far the worst customer service I have ever encountered. You left a family of five with no pizza and all u can see in my children's eyes was hunger. It was 12/17/2015 family came home some from school others from work long day so I decided to order a pizza and reward my family with a pizza. I paid for it with my last 28.00$ that my family had. Pizza man arises gives me the pizza and the sodas. I was handed the pizza as soon as the pizza was in my hands the box tilted a little and the pizza pie fell our of the box.The delivery man himself saw I was left with just the box on hand and pizza on the concrete floor.The driver immediately called the Manger Mike to explain what happened and his response was it's not his responsibility to send a fresh pizza even though it was not are fault the box was improperly closed.So here is to you Mike and the young lady at Pizzanos let me give you a shout out that you left a family of five with no dinner that night and the thing was this was the last of my money and my family went to bed with no dinner thank you for you non ethical business ways and know that you need to improve your coustomer service and take into consideration that some people work hard for a living and don't have the luxury of throwing away a pizza or 28.00$ and tell your children there not eating dinner couse We spent are last dollars on Pizza we never ate. MARRY X MASS  hope your family never goes through this.

14.description: So I haven't tried this place in forever.. and decided to last night since my normal place was closed.  I order the house pizza extra thin. It came in less then an hour, was hot and with a free 6 pack of RC.  It was very crispy and just enough of all ingredients.Call taker was very pleasant also...I would highly recommend this pizza joint =)

6.description: I ordered late almost close to closing and they accommodated my timing very well. I still got home to eat a hot pizza:-). One of my favorite pizza places  with awesome customer service. What they did for me made me like them even more. Lastly, I will continue to remain a valued customer.

1.description: This is another back of the store location but don't let that deter you! Picadilllo taco, picadillo sope and fresca shake-verrry good. The prices are right too!

0.description: Walk to the back of the store, there you will find, in my humble opinion, the best or second best taco in Chicago. The "taqueria" is clean and tidy, but not very cute. I could only speak of the tacos, anything else you would have to try out.MUST TRY!

3.description: I don't like writing negative reviews but this place was pretty bad. I heard their pizza wasn't too good but I also saw they had sandwiches. So I ordered a ham and salami. Instead of real ham they used like little cubes of ham. Almost looked like pizza toppings. And the salami was actually  pepperoni. Also pizza toppings. So the whole sandwich was pizza toppings on bread. Step up your game lugganos!

1.description: Average pizza. On top of that, it was cold as it took over an hour to deliver (even though we're only a few miles away). Payment was also very difficult due to poor communication. Do not recommend.

2.description: Man, I should of listen to the reviews. But here I go they took 1 hour 20 min an I'm like 10 min away.  I'm not a jerk so I took it in. Cold pizza but I hate it. Don't order here please

5.description: Went here last night and got a XL Sausage and Mushroom Pizza. They have a special for a XL with one topping for $9.99.Nice lady, but she doesn't really speak English.Pizza was a bit thicker than I like. Crust was bleh. Sausage had a nice zest to it, but pizza was still just blah to me. We asked for water and she brought it in styrofoam cups and my guy opened his up after drinking like half of it and we saw something on the bottom. He fished it out, but it didn't look like a roach, but maybe something like ashes.........hmmmmm......Doubt I'll come back.

6.description: I use work at this place first "cashier" job never again!I know absolutely what is behind the counter. Cockroaches!!! YUP, this was a summer job for me for about a month. I couldn't lie to these customers. They are veryyyy seeking about their slices of pizza. IF you want a cheese slice and all they have is pepperoni or sausage they will literally take off the pepperoni or sausage and pop the "cheese pizza" in the oven for your PERFECT hot slice! This place has a history of being shut down/re-open/shut down NO JOKE!bon appetit ;)

7.description: Complete garbage. Waste of money. Believe it or not Pizza Hut holds higher standards than this joint.

0.description: First time trying this place. I wasn't disappointed and if I tweak the next order it will definitely taste better. I ordered an XL pizza with half cheese and other half sausage mushrooms and jalapeño(very hot peppers) I eat spicy .  I would recommend you ask for extra sauce as it was the only ingredient lacking. I only gave them a four star review because they didn't get my order right instead of half a pie with cheese it was all over ingredients. So try the pizza with extra sauce. I'll post a review next time on their deep dish pizza.

4.description: I am not even sure how begin with the problems of this place. First I ordered for delivery. The person taking the order couldn't even understand me when I said ARCHER AVE! Which anyone in Chicago knows Archer Ave is one of the biggest streets in the city. How the person taking orders can not know of this street should have been a sign for me to hang up right there. But sadly i didnt. So I ordered a pizza and a salad which they had a special on. The driver showed up and delivered the food. He pulled the food out of the hot pizza bag. Including the salad which was now a very hot salad! I even told him why would you put the salad in a hot bag. He didnt understand a single word we said when suggesting a salad should not be HOT! At this point i figured it was going to be a bust....and I was right. The pizza barely evne had sauce on it.I have had bad experiences with ordering food before but this was the worst! Seriously...a HOT Salad? If you dont know Salads are not supposed to be HOT...you are in the wrong business.

0.description: This place sucks! If you go there get ready to buy the waitresses alcoholic drinks that are waterdowned and still cost the same as the real deal. They come and ask you to buy them drinks one after another. You will spend too much just to go in and have a few drinks for yourself do to the waitresses hitting your pocket book like that. Not worth it at all!

3.description: Good place for beer and snack.. Been a long time customer like 6 years ago purchased my first beer at this place the staff is ok but sometimes they get busy and are rushing you off there's rude customers on weekends but I guess they are just trying to get their medicine and get out as soon as possible.. Prices are fair and yes the parking lot gets wild on weekends!!

1.description: Great selection from cava to craft beer bingo!

2.description: been going here since we moved into the neighborhood 8 years ago.  Great selection of beers, wine and booze- If you can't find it ask George and it'll be there the next time! Hidden Gem!

5.description: Minny Binnys. This place carries a large selection of beers. I was shocked they didn't have Magic Hat #9 and asked the owner where it was at. He freaked out and placed it on order because he felt like he let me down. I always order my kegs here all the time. They are cool peeps. Sometimes they'll have attitudes but you can't blame them because drunk ass dudes irritate them. Oh and the best part is, some weekends they'll have all sorts of tequilla/beer girls giving out free samples. Yes!!! Love doing shots while shopping!

6.description: This old school place is a gem. They had two kinds of rye a pretty large selection of bourbons, tons of vodkas. I forgot to note their gins because it is January I guess. No Creme de Violette, but I don't think anyone in town has that. The beer selection is fairly large and best of all, the prices were reasonable. It is not a superstore so they may not have every single beer on the market today, but they have a broad collection of spirits.Wine? I forgot to look and would not know what to look for anyway. They had some.The staff was super helpful.

0.description: Where did all this craft beer come from?!My family has been coming here since I was a little kid in the late 70s. It's always been a dependable, well-stocked neighborhood liquor store. If there was a liquor you were looking for and they didn't have it, you'd let the owner know about it, and they'd track it down for you. That kind of place.
