Very helpful and friendly.However, (back then) they didn't have much a selection of American craft beers, although their import selection was well represented and pretty impressive.Apparently, that has changed in the last two years. I don't know how I missed the craft beers when I came in a couple months ago, but today I just realized that they have an immense selection of local and imported craft beers. There must have been at least a hundred different types, probably much more. The only other liquor store in the area to have this kind of selection is Archer Liquors, and I've found a couple beers at Town & Country that Archer didn't stock (and vice-versa, too.)So, if you live out here in Brighton Park/Southwest Side area and need to get your beer fix on without having to pop in downtown to Binny's, Town & Country Liquor (as well as Archer Liquors) is your place!

4.description: I live two blocks away, so it's easy to get to.  The staff knows me by name and are very nice.  The only negative to this place is the parking lot.  If you visit on a Friday evening after work or on weekends, the lot is a packed frenzy of semi inebriated people who can't figure out how to park or pull in and out of a parking lot.  Just be careful

1.description: This place is not permanently closed! Standard neighborhood dive bar. Pretty much the only one left in this neighborhood. They've got a good selection on the juke box. And the bartender  Mary is sweet and awesome ;) Tip her a lot.

2.description: Andrew F is a liar I know him, personally and almost carnally.  He was also drunk when he was there( I know I seent him!) so you can't  take anything he says as information.  I witnessed him drink at least four shots of cheap scotch and equal number of domestic beer, half of which was paid for.   They also apperantly had just either "whacked" somebody in there or had just field dressed a deer, as the pungent stench of pine sol was heavy  that night.  I know it. They did their dirty deed and then tried to clean it up before business started.  I know,  i spilled alot of sh!t during the course of my youth and tried to cover it up with pine sol. Shame on you Fountain Blue Inn or FBI as i like to call it.  They're obviously in cahoots with the government.  Plus I think my friend, we'll call him Washington Baker( you know who you are), has sex with the bar maid for cheap scotch and street cred from his friends. Well?! it works godd@mnit!

0.description: Have you ever heard of the old Chicago corner taps, every neighborhood had one. This is one, it's great.Feels like you're drinking with history.  With quick buy backs and friendly barmaid and owner it's cheap too and welcoming too, so forget looking at the History Museum and come here.

29.description: Good goooooooosh! I'm in love again! If there was ever a hole in the wall that will surprise you, this should be it. Great BBQ from a place that barely has a parking lot, is take out only and takes only cash!?! You know what? It doesn't even matter, this place is sooooo good!We bought a Rib-tip bucket - GOODWe tried their Hot Links - GREATWe tried their Ribs - EVEN BETTERI can't complain. I love the fries that come smothered in BBQ sauce and I love the white bread you get when you order their Hot Links.I'm definitely a SUPER FAN. Now we just gotta go back and try their seafood and chicken. I have no doubt it'll be great. I LOVE BBQ! Cheers!

42.description: I hate this place! The wings are so good and cheap that I gained 10lb, lol. The bbq sauce has a honey sweetness to it, but spicy enough for you to want to eat fast so you don't notice your lips burning.  The fries must have been engineered to absorb the bbq sauce, there is nothing like Leon's fries drenched in their sauce. I love fries, its such a weakness, especially here. I'm not a rib kinda guy, but I have always licked my fingers, and the bones for that matter, every time  I had them.

23.description: Had an event this weekend 08/09 and ordered the bbq rib tips tray..Had to say ...delicious .......also order chicken tray which was ok....

47.description: This Leon's Barbeque joint is in a White neighborhood. I just so happened to drive past it one day and could not believe the location! So, one day I went back and got some ribs.  The workers are hispanic, I think.  The ribs are delicious!!!  I was surprised that this historically Black BBQ joint, in a Caucasian neighborhood with Hispanic (?) cooks is FANTASTIC!!!  I never had a problem with an order here.  They work fast!!!

8.description: Been going here for years and it NEVER disappoints, ever. I can guarantee you've never had anything quite this good, Leon's is simply the best. I literally can't think of anything they could do better at this place. The fries, ribs, chicken, and sauce are in their own class. The quality of their meat alongside their signature sauce makes it nearly impossible to find a better bbq joint in Chicago. Oh, I also forgot to mention the excellent customer service which makes it all the better!!

31.description: Thanks to Pedro R. recommendation. That chicken leg special with hot sauce is yum! Give it a try!

34.description: used to come here all the time, so i decided to give it a visit and see how it was now... big disappointment! i had the rib tips and the BBQ chicken... the BBQ chicken was soggy and the meat was flavorless.. the rib tips doesn't taste anything like what it used to few years back.. some of the meat is very chewy and it just doesn't have that tender and juicy taste to it anymore... still have fast service tho.. will not be coming back

16.description: bbq done right by father and son team.i highly recommend trying everything.ask for extra sauce on the side .use bread to soak it up....yum.

13.description: This place is amazing!!! Just thinking about it makes my mouth water. Good Prices + Delicious Food =

11.description: I live 40 minutes away yet I drive to Leon's once a week since I first tried it two months ago.  I LOVE their shrimp with the extra spicy bbq sauce!!  Oh my gosh, it does not get better than this place.  I don't eat meat, only seafood, and Leon's is just unbelievable.   Their fries are so good too.  My boyfriend loves the ribs and the hot links.Thank you Leons for always being so fresh, friendly and delicious!!!

39.description: This is a review from 6 years ago.When I was in college in Chicago a friend introduced me to Leon's for bbq. I remember going there late at night and getting the rib tips and fries. I have never found anything like this place. Just great!

37.description: Who would have thunk, (yes thunk) that there was such a finger lickin' BBQ in the south side, in my neighborhood. Not Amy L, that's who! And to thunk, I've been here at least 14 years and never knew about this place. Ordered a full slab of BBQ mild and it came with 4 pieces of white bread and some fries. The fries didn't seem that crispy but when lathered with the BBQ sauce from the ribs, I didn't really give a damn. I was just that good! Ribs were meaty and the mild sauce was really good. Next time, I'll try the spicy one. Prices were also pretty cheap for BBQ. I think our meal cost about $17, give or take. Next time, I thunk I will go there again and get my BBQ on!

0.description: Usually my favorite place for ribs is Famous Dave's, but I decided to try something new so I looked up a good place to eat ribs around my area and this was one of the suggestions. The reviews for this place were great so I decided to give it a try. I ordered some ribs and let me tell you this, the service is GREAT, and the food is mother-freakin' AMAZING omg, they serve the best freakin' ribs I've bed tried omg. Omg. OMg. OMG and it's CHEAP like wow. It's not better than Famous Dave's, but it's pretty-freakin'-good so give this place a try. You won't regret it. I swear on my 3 legged goat that you'll freakin' like it.

38.description: Holy rib tips batman! So i tutor a kid on Sat and after not having breakfast this AM I hopped on my yelp app to see what was in the hood. leon's came up and i looked over a few of the reviews and by the 3rd one I was already driving. I'm a fan of meat drenched in BBQ so I ordered the combo with chicken, links, and rib tips. It was prepared in no time and as I got to the car I opened the paper bag and stared back at sheer happiness covered in sauce. I tried the rib tip first. it was meaty with very little fat and the sauce was really good. the fries were hot and were made to soak up bbq sauce. they give you a fork if you are worried about getting your hands too messy. The chicken was really good though I didn't realize that you only get one wing...next time I'll order another one...the link was okay though that's more reflective of the fact that I'm not a sausage person anyway but I ate it so no prob....the best part of all is the fact that this place is pretty cheap. i got all that and 2 slices of white bread for less than 10 bux....awesome.I'm def going to make Leon's a weekly visit spot...yay for bbq!!

27.description: Rib Tips and links are very good =)

32.description: Gotta YELP these guys.. they deserve it!!   I have been coming to this place since they first opened, practically 15 years ago..  I gotta say that this Leon's has been putting pounds on me during that span, but I loved every sloppy moment of it!Pound for Pound, one of the best BBQ options in Chicago.  the best things here are the ribs, rib tips and BBQ fried chicken..  Their ribs are smoked, very flavorful, tender and slathered with their signature spicy sauce, which i must say is pretty damn good.  Ditto for the tips, very meaty and a bit fatty, but fat = FLAVOR, so i don't mind it at all.   The chicken is lightly breaded fried and then slathered in sauce, or if you are partial to having crispy chicken, request the sauce on the side and dip your heart away. Their menu consists of the above mentioned ribs & chicken, plus fried fish, shrimp, and hot links.  The seafood and hotlinks are just ok, nothing special and the sides fries, slaw, potato, and mac salad are just average.   Oh and Most orders come with fries and good old fashioned slices of white bread to sop up the sauce.. trust me you will be licking our fingers and using the bread to finish the sauce.  If this place had a little more variety, I would eat here once a week for sure. I really wish they would serve some sandwiches. Take note Leon's...  Boneless BBQ rib sandwich on french roll, hot link sandwich on french, BBQ boneless chicken breast sandwich on a french roll, maybe add a few sides while your at it..  BBQ and no mac and cheese??  Mashed potatoes?? Baked beans??  Think I will have to mention it to the owner next time i drop in. lolAll in all.. 5 stars in my book, Leon's has never dissapointed. OH and i almost forgot to mention how cheap it is..  definitely a  good bonus!

48.description: This shop is an institution - great quality, been there forever. Fast service, plenty of food. Sauce is average, nothign special, but the flavor of the meat is fabulous.

44.description: some great ribs here!!!!!!!!!! love there chicken to. i live just 10 min from leons and try to eat there food at least 3 to 4 times a month

24.description: Love the barbeque and sauce. Meat is always tender and the sauce is always on point. Have been going here for years. I also love the main Que Master Marco.

7.description: The hot links are awesome!  I wish I lived a little closer so I could frequently sample more of their smoked meats. Will be back!!!!

40.description: BBQ is good here. Chicken is what I order. Love the BBQ fries mmm

30.description: It had been a couple of years since I had them but was watching BBQ Pitmasters on Tv all day and needed some ASAP!  Sent the hubs to Leon's for some rib tips and OMGee they were good!  We got the bucket and it was jammed packed and smothered in a delicious sweet,spicy sauce. 5 of us ate from the bucket and we only ate about 1/3 of it. It also comes with an order of fries. They were crispy, fresh and delicious. We will def be back more often!

46.description: hello BBQ! This dingy, tiny, freestanding thing of a place has great food! Don't expect to sit down at a table - there is none. Just walk in, order, inhale all the smokey grillness while waiting for food, and devour it. Cheap lunch option as well, if you work around there. I'd suggest you pick "spicy" when they ask. It's not that spicy at all, and it adds a nice kick.

1.description: I've been coming here since i was a kid. i love their hot bbq sauce. Usually get your food with in minutes of you ordering. Their hot link is my favorite but their ribs are a close second.

9.description: Their Ribs and Chicken are so fresh, just amazing ! That sauce, well I've never tasted any bbq sauce like it. So delicious. I highly recommend. Great staff. I even got a peak of their kitchen/back area, so clean!

26.description: Not a fan of the Bbq sauce but liked the tenderness of the ribs

25.description: To give readers some perspective on my bbq reviews, I'm a big fan of Ribs 'n Bibs in Hyde Park and Lem's on 75th St.  They both use the aquarium smoker and cook the ribs over an open wood fire.  I expected that Leon's would cook ribs the same way and, sure enough, they had an aquarium smoker.  It was not in use when I was there, but I figured that they had already cooked the day's ribs.  But the ribs had no smoke flavor.  I only ate half of the slab that I bought.  That means the ribs were pretty bad, since I'm a rib fanatic.  Good south side bbq ain't easy.

12.description: Never thought that the food was good until I can n here a few weeks ago links r on point ribs r very tender n the sauce is just like the original that use to b on stony island folks need to get over here just hate that they close at 2200 every day

21.description: I was disappointed with my first visit to Leon's because I saw this business spotlighted on one of  the cooking shows on TV and thought I would give it a try.  I got  the sausage and rib tips. The sauce was finger licking good, and I liked the flavour of  the sausage. The rib tips that I was able to eat were delicious.  But there were several pieces of rib tips that were to tough to chew. You chop it and serve itt, there is no way you didn't know some pieces were bad. Don't sell me old food!  Put it in the trash or take it home to your  DOG.  Don't pass your loss off on me.  I work too hard for my money. This is not acceptable. Also, give a receiot when  a custoner makes a purchase.

17.description: Customer service was blah! I was not impressed,  the bbq  sauce was not thick enough, links were cold, the only reason I was willing to try this place out was because my husband didn't bbq, I will not be back.

10.description: This place was an Institution. It's the end of an era. It doesn't appear that this place is going to be around much longer. Loved this place and their Hot Links. I went to the one on South Chicago Ave when I was a teen. I frequented the one on 59th and Racine as an adult until it closed. There will never be another Leons.

5.description: Been coming here for a looong time; back when the 5 legs deal used to be $5 (now its like 4 legs for $7?) and they have been consistently delicious. Their chicken and rib tips are awesome.

3.description: Cant have any better BBQ wings. They are awesome!!!The tips could be better but the wings with the spicy sauce is really good!!!

35.description: I was in the mood for hot links (discovered them over Memorial Day weekend) and my friend Kara M suggested that I give this place a try. The drive from Wicker Park was a bit long, but so worth it! Sadly, they didn't have any hot links but I got the rib tips with fries special. Let me tell you, I was praying for red lights all the way back home so that I could eat the rib tips. So tender, so delicious. The bbq sauce was great and was a perfect complement to everything. Wish that I could have gotten more fries, but who cares when you've got Leon's rib tips. I will DEFINITELY be back to get the hot links!

19.description: I was disappointed with my first visit to Leon's because I saw this business spotlighted on one of  the cooking shows on TV and thought I would give it a try.  I got  the sausage and rib tips. The sauce was finger licking good, and I liked the flavour of  the sausage. The rib tips that I was able to eat were delicious.  But there were several pieces of rib tips that were to tough to chew. You chop it and serve itt, there is no way you didn't know some pieces were bad. Don't sell me old food!  Put it in the trash or take it home to your  DOG.  Don't pass your loss off on me.  I work too hard for my money. This is not acceptable. Also, give a receiot when  a custoner makes a purchase.

28.description: Awesome BBQ ribs! I just wish the sauce was a little better.Rib Tips are always on point and inexpensive.

45.description: We had just flown into O'Hare Airport and we needed to pick up another couple at Midway Airport. On the way there the huge traffic build up on the highway caused us to attempt a cross city shortcut that found us passing Leon's. Once we picked them up and we doubled back to Leon's for sausage, ribs, shrimp and chicken. There was no place to sit inside or out so we sat in our car and ate. The food was great but it lost something by eating in a backseat and then not being able to wash our hands with anything other than handy wipes. The food was good enough to try another sit down location or if I lived or worked locally to take out and bring home to sit down. The sauce was great and I had a wonderful apple soda that I hope to track down again in the future.

33.description: These ribs are the bomb! For the only rib place around they are pretty damn good. The barbecue sauce flavor is the best. You can order spicy or mild but both are great and not that hot where you can't enjoy it. They also have good links. My favorite is how the ribs come with fries and the fries are soaked with the sauce ... So yummy. They take credit now and they deliver. The only thing I don't like is the ribs have a lot of fat but the flavor makes up for it. A must try but you can't really eat there it's more of a carry out sorta joint .

2.description: Im sooooo glad I stopped in tonight.I hadnt been to Leon's in quite a long time.For some reason I dont recall them ever being THIS GOOOOOD.These rib tips were EXCELLENT.So were the hot links.Everything was SUPERB.Even the fries had a nice juicy fatty flavor covered in BBQ sauce.Naaaaaw I aint on NO DIET!!!! Hahaha.Im gonna have to stop in more often!!!!!! Cant believe it took me so long to visit again.Were they ALWAYS this good? lol

18.description: I love their shrimp!! They are huge!!. The price of shrimp is steep, but u pay what you get. Their ribs are awsome, I prefer the ribs over the rib tips but they are both delicious. I really did not like the links, but it was my first time ever trying them. The chicken was a little dry. It's a small take out place. I suggest ordering ahead.

41.description: Good BBQ for Chicago, but for the real taste mo place like Texas. Ribs are great, chicken is fried not barbecued. They have some chicken wings that are good, not BBQ. Where is the brisket?

4.description: Perfect place for a really nice, romantic date.

6.description: Got ribs , the service was fast. Guys behind the counter recommended ribs, I went for it. Happy I did they were sweet and fell right off the bone.

22.description: Just amazing ! Excellent food ... Excellent service. . Excellent prices.. enough said !

15.description: Had an event this weekend 08/09 and ordered the bbq rib tips tray..Had to say ...delicious .......also order chicken tray which was ok....

20.description: Still awesome, had not had some in a while, tried them again and still like old times. Rib tips are the best

36.description: i been trying this place and all the time i go in there i get the same thing. i get the 5 chicken legs. i would say that this is probably the best deal i seen around town. also you get fries. now you cant beat that. the shrimp there is also pretty good. but i will stick with my chicken legs and some extra hot house. enjoy.

14.description: Since I was about 10 my parents always loved this place. We finally found it again since the one we would go to closed about 8 years ago and they have been buying it every week ever since they found this one. The best ribs and fries !

12.description: eh... the food here is not that great. there was 2 different times that i ordered the flauta dinner and found bones in my beans. the meat doesn't taste fresh and sometimes over cooked.. will not be coming back here again due to lack of quality.

3.description: Great food and good service but the best part was the horchata. If you want quick service and great food for a great price head over to La Fiesta. You won't be disappointed.

1.description: Stopped in to this place in the middle of the night with my friend, who swore this has the best drunk people food in all of South Chicago. I would be hard pressed to disagree! I don't like to eat anything so late at night / early in the morning, especially heavy food like meat or dairy, but the place smelled so ridiculously good, I had to order something. I ended up eating half of a steak burrito that was delicious, especially with the hot sauce they provide. I was worried I would be up the rest of the night with a heartburn and/or gallbladder distress (TMI?) but I actually woke up feeling pretty fresh and not at all hungover the next day. It was a magic burrito!Also, the place is super cheap and the service was friendly and very fast. Our burritos came out in under 3 minutes!

2.description: This is what a real taqueria looks like. I have been going to LF since 1992 and have lived all over the US and damn I crave these burritos and tacos all day every day. I used to go so frequently. If you want service or atmosphere go to Big Star and get some of that mediocre food, if you want a good honest solid burrito or  taco this is your place. My suggestion 3 carna asada tacos, 2 picadillo and a 12 pack ;)! or ! carna asada burrito and 1 carne asada taco and 1 picadillo. My wife now gets carnitas, its good but nothing like the carne asada.

9.description: The burritos are good but some of the ladies that work here are BITCHES!!!! straight up bitches!The owner lady only likes you if you have a some chorizo in your pantalones if you know what i mean. & with chicks she'll act like u aint there!

10.description: This is the place to get your late night Mexican fix.  My sister would drive here late at night when craving.  Keep in mind that this is a dive restaurant, don't expect anything fancy - some of the patrons are a little scary too.  We once saw someone expose himself here haha - but we still got our food and ate it!The food is cheap and delicious ... get the burritos.  They're about the size of your head and I always wind up with leftovers.

4.description: Open 24/7 and the food is good and portions are great. The server is quick to service and you don't need to be waiting to see if she will come by to see if you need anything. The free chips and salsa are very good. Small spot but good food and service. Not a place for a date but who cares lol! Just remember a place with good food and great service is a place to tip! I have gone there for years and many times.

6.description: Dined in and must say the quality of the meat seemed to be cheap. It is still massive, but the meat quality was just not there.They are friendly and horchata is still refreshing.Will update if I go again and see how it is.

0.description: My favourite goto place when I was in high school. I went back 10 years lady and the waitress remember me! Best Burritos with out the fillers of rice and beans!

5.description: Let me start off by saying there were 2 people in front of me and it took 20 minutes just to order. The woman behind the counter has no idea what the hell she is doing. We ordered 2 steak burritos, 1 with only cheese the other with no lettuce no tomato with sour cream, and 1 carne asada dinner. It took her 5 minutes to take the order which was a sign right off the bat this was not going to end well. 15 minutes later she comes out with 3 burritos, obviously not what we ordered. But the best part is that NONE of it was right. We left because we weren't going to wait another 15 minutes for her to try to understand us and then get the food. The meat was so dry I couldn't even eat it. Would not recommend to anyone unless they want frustration and awful burritos.

13.description: Trusty La Fiesta. I call it "Da Party". This place looks like Mexico. In fact, you could film a TV show about Mexico with the exterior and interior and no one would suspect anything other than the english menu on the wall. *Warning: This is not a "clean" place. If you are looking for linen and such, do not even venture within 5 miles of this area. However, if you have no fear and will eat anything, you will be rewarded. Once again, come at your own risk.Open 24/7, it is a place where I can get giant burritos at 4am. They have the best horchata. Dine in and you get unlimited chips and salsa/pico. My personal favorites are steak or pastor burrito and lengua tacos. Their burritos are HUGE but they do not have rice. What they lack in rice, they make up in MEAT. So its a win for me. Otherwise, there is beans, lettuce, tomato, chihuahua cheese and MEAT all wrapped up. Nothing else. Oh, did I mention that it's $2.75 for the burrito? Everything else costs extra but you can add rice, sour cream, guac or whatever else you want...I've never felt the need to add all that stuff.I only eat here either in the middle of the night when Cook County Sheriff's Department is here for their lunch (since the CC Jail is only a mile or two away) or for lunch, so I couldn't tell you how it is during other times.

11.description: I've only had their steak burritos and chips and salsa here and both are pretty good. I'm also a fan of their pickled jalepenos, onions and carrots mix. There steak burrito is loaded with meat and it's a tasty when you add their jalapeños to it. Under 4 dollars! Cash only, open 24 hrs, no nonsense, hits the spot and cheap! I think it's acceptable to drag a date here after you've seen each other naked. What's there to hide or be ashamed of after that.. Hmmm?

8.description: My mom has been going to this restaurant along time since she been working for CCDOC (which is 27 years) and today I found it after thinking 111 st was la fiesta the one I was thought was the place i remembered. I called up and the guy said the burritos are 10 dollars and not that big at all he seen bigger I was disappointed and was about to give up (thank god I never went there) but I can tell that no other restaurant can top this la fiesta cause its the only one with the giant burritos that holds true to their name and the lady was so nice to me I will be going to them from now on!Great service and you can't top that's it's open 24/7 too!

14.description: I had been told by someone who once lived in the area of this place and the fact that they have giant burritos for under 4 bucks.  After going there today, I can't understand why it took me so long to finally go to this place.  The steak was decent and tasty, and good lord, do they pack it in, along with lettuce, beans, and cheese.  The pico de gallo is also quite good.  If you can find a better burrito for this price, please let me know!

7.description: Thank goodness there is a taco place around the southside that is open 24 hours. The food is descent.

3.description: Love this place! Wasn't expecting it to be anything great but I was wrong! My husband & I are foodies so things must be top notch. I had their chilaquiles de mole. Loved them! I don't usually ever go for mole but the waitresses recommended them so I gave them a shot. They're sweet and not too spicy and the sides weren't bad either. Good portions. Also! You guys must try their cafe con Leche, sounds average but it's something different than other Mexican joints. I'll be here again soon!

1.description: As I'm writing this review I'm thinking what was  about it that didn't blow me away. I mean it is a small but cool place, they serve fresh food and it is a much needed different kind of restaurant on this neighborhood.I was there with a friend and we had chicken sandwich, veggie omelet and D' Nuez crepes. Everything was good but just good. I guess I was expecting more.Do not get me wrong, it is good, just not amazing. When I was there I overheard the owner or chef saying that they will expand the menu and the hours, will have to check them out againPricewise is a little higher than other places in the area, but again it is completely different.Service was nice PS, mango water was super weird, don't get that

2.description: Chicken wings taste not very good. The milkshake is great! The steak tastes just okay. The delivery man called and spoke Spanish which I couldn't understand.

5.description: Love this place, it's something different from all the Mexican Restaurant around( there is nothing wrong with that). I have been here twice and the staff is very friendly and helpful.. The crepes are amazing the are full of fresh fruit and yogurt they are a must try.. The sandwich was very good too, wheat bread, fresh lettuce,tomato, purple onion,lots of Avocado and chipotle mayo and of course grill chicken.. The chilaqiles de mole where amazing they come with rice and salad.. We had cafe de olla and it was just perfect, if you are in the area you have to stop by and try it for your self..

6.description: The D'Nuez crepes are amazing! I've gotten my whole family addicted! First restaurant to ever offer Lechera and Cajeta! The D'nuez coffee is also my favorite. I've had their lunch, dinner and breakfast options and haven't been disappointed. I love the display of the food, it's always fresh and the variety of fresh waters is awesome. Love the fact that the BBQ chicken isn't crazy sweet and sticky to the point of leaking BBQ sauce out like most restaurants, love their chilaquiles and variety of chilaquiles, even their fries are delicious!

7.description: I am writing this review as i go , first of all nice little place so welcoming and clean, we started with a cappuccino and a Mango milkshake, cappuccino so tasting and strong they have a variety of flavors (eggnog caramel and chocolate ) the shake was ok. Ok just got my D NUEZ MIX its Crepes with fruit and Nutella they are AWESOME its a Bomb on every bite. Moving to the CHILAQUILES DE MOLE am just going to say NOT EVEN MY OWN MOTHER MAKES THEM LIKE THESE GUYS . Am done i have to ENJOY this Delicious Food .

8.description: Eh! This place is 'ok'. I went there for breakfast with my boyfriend. Their shakes and juices are too expensive... they're $5-$6!!! They dont have a very big variety of coffee drinks. My food was ok both times i went... but has nothing i would crave enough to go back.

0.description: There not really a lot to eat in this neighborhood besides tacos, and most of the taco places are just so-so. D'nuez is like a hidden gem that not everyone knows about. Usually a place with Mexican and other types of food either has great Mexican and not so great other types, but D'nuez nails it on everything. The crepes, paninis and wings are all great but so are the enchiladas, chileauiles and drinks! I recommend any dish with the red sauce, it's spicy and authentic. The abobado sauce is more sweet with a strong spicy after taste. Coffee with rompope (Mexican rum like liquor) is also great and the crepes are awesome. I can't even believe they deliver!!!

4.description: I've only had their delicious crepes but the family decided to have dinner here.  This place is awesome! Delicious mango chicken/steak with a strawberry salad was mouth watering. We also ordered the chicken alambre and melon/pina water, yummy! I regret not taking pics to show how great the food looked and tasted. I'll definitely continue to come. I'm gonna try the panini sandwiches, wings, and pasta next. If your expecting pacos tacos or gallos prices then your in the wrong place. This place has comparable prices to Tio luis except much more modern twist and beautiful presentation!

3.description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE the hut. I've been going there since I was a little girl and the food has always been great. I usually order hotdogs and gyros. Everything is always fresh. Staff is always friendly and quick.

1.description: Great place for lunch, they have it all hot and fresh. Hot soup great fries, better side of your typical hot dog stand.  Go with the daily specials, if you get a beef from here. Go with  dipped , sweet and hot with raw onion. You will not be disappointed.

2.description: Cash only please.... I have been coming to this place for a while and although the food is good I feel like the service and prices are not as great as they used to. The lady at the counter charged me for 2 gyros when I only had one. She was rushing to charge me even though there wasnt many people there waiting and I feel like thats why she messed up. Be careful and make sure you kind of know how much your food should be so this doesn't happen to you. This is the usual burger, hot dog,  and gyro joint which there are plenty of in the area. None of their stools/tables have changed since the 90's when it was Donalds so they should consider revamping the place too. Might try something else in the area next time for sure.

5.description: I've been coming here since they were called Donald's back in the 90s.  Great lunch/dinner hot dog stand.  Your standard Chicago style hot dogs, Polishes, Gyros, burgers, skinny fries, etc.They frame grill their burgers which I think it's pretty unique.  Great food and a great price!

6.description: Good food for a decent price! I love their pizza puffs and fries. The only drawback is that they only take cash. No debit cards, but their prices are pretty low. The other day we ordered lunch from there and my total came to a little less than 15 dollar and my brother, myself and my 4 year old all ate! I've been coming ever since i was a kid and i still recognize most of the same faces.

7.description: Good food and the service is fast. The fries are some of the best i've had! The food is also affordable, 2 hot dogs with 2 fries is 4.50. I noticed that they cook fresh chicken breasts for their chicken selections; that's a plus.

8.description: Great food and fast service! Try everything oh and their chicken sandwich is awesome my wife always gets that and I go for the gyro lol but I have tried everything and everything is good.

9.description: Whoa! Surprised there are no reviews...Well here I go, standard Chicago fare, which means good for your taste buds, bad for your arteries, hotdog and fries (skinny fries) good, Gyros good.  Thats all I have had so far, but it is a standard chicago lunch stand so a menu like that. Hotdog and fries is $2 with tax...yay!

0.description: I travel often and have lived all over the country but my home is Brighton. The Hut is a family tradition so every time I come home I visit The Hut ! Everything on the menu is good , the staff are efficient and friendly. There is no need to place an order if you're a regular customer because Chris and Lou already know what you want. I think my favorite is the Italian Beef. Always moist, flavorful and filling !

4.description: Sorry, but definitely there is better out there.It does get a bit busy during lunch hours, but they are pretty quick.The lady was nice.My guy said his friend raved about the chili here. So, we got a few chili dogs to try and I thought the chili was pretty bland. The fries were pretty good though.However, the other day I decided to try the gyro plate and I gotta say this was the worst gyro I've tasted. It also only comes with one pita which is not enough, but the gyro meat is so salty and grainy. It was also sitting in a pool of grease...yuck! Also, the fries were different and wasn't as good.

1.description: I think this is a great place to meet down-to-earth people in the area and just chill after a long day of holding back the urge to collectively slap people in the face. The bar tenders are both physically and mentally attractive so tip them nicely or I'll kick your ass.

0.description: This is a classic neighborhood dive bar. During the week you will find locals catching a few drinks while watching sports. The best part about this bar is everyone is friendly and they keep the local trouble makers out. That is special because a lot of the bars in the area are full of gangbanger assholes and coke heads. But not here.

This family owned business w/ 2 locations has great variety at great prices!! They have shoes for the whole family w/ styles that make you smile !!! Not only are the prices awesome but the customer service given by the employees and the owner  is a feeling that makes you return over and over again !!

3.description: It was nasty. Pizza was average. Owner didn't even care after i told him it didnt look right. Take your hunger somewhere else

1.description: Prices are cheap, but food was just okay.My guy got the personal pizza and didn't care for it.I got the steak sandwich and I thought it was good.It's close by, but not sure if we'll return since there are better options.

2.description: Worst customer service ever they charge you  for extra ingredients and the pizzas come plain have ordered three times and they can't get the order right.  You  call and they want to argue that the ingredients are there and they aren't..

9.description: Meh. Pizza was on time, but I wouldn't mind it taking longer if it were good. Me and fiance didn't care much for it at all. The cheesefries were good, but pizza was a let down, a little too sweet.

10.description: I love this neighborhood spot. Its a bit of a dive but the the grilled chicken sandwich and salad is amazing and fresh , spinach bread is so yummy too! pizza is not the best

4.description: Ordered delivery, pizza was cold. Forgot six pack of Dr. Pepper. Italian Beef meal sub par as well.

6.description: Yummy for my tummy! This place has great food at affordable prices!! Great pizza and outstanding Cheeseburgers! Fast delivery and cheap! They usually say pizza will be in 45-min to and hour but it actually shows up in 30min. If you order during big events like the Super Bowl.... well come on its obvious they are swamped so don't be a nancy.

11.description: This place has some really tasty pizza, I ordered takeout from there two days in a row because I liked it so much.  There are a few booths in there where you can eat, but it's pretty much a dive.  The people working at the counter are pretty friendly, it seems like it might be a family owned business.  I highly recommend the pepperoni pizza, a small one is only $8 and it's fantastic.  They have a fairly large menu though, and they deliver.

5.description: Very bad quality of ingredients. Sausage will have you making faces. Anyone liking this shows you dont like to spend money.

7.description: The pizza by the slice always ready and warm for a quick lunch. Grilled chicken sandwich is awesome. Great prices and great service!

8.description: OK, just go in and ask for the cheeseburger special. Seriously. Do you want to know what it is? Here goes: a typical delicious diner burger (a big, wide slider, kinda like a whopper), sitting on top of a nicely grilled slice of ham (yes, ham), topped with a big slice of cheese, a healthy amount of bacon (gooood bacon, too, none of that wimpy thin stuff), fried onions, fried pineapple chunks (yes, pineapple!!!), lettuce, tomato, mustard, and ketchup!!! Get it with fries and a pop, and you will be in heaven.OK, now I want one.

0.description: Love their Pizza! Always order the Naples Special.. Our family are regulars here and love that the guys are friendly and know us by our names and faces. I like the rib tips too and the cheese fries! Yum! Ive had the pasta primavera which is spicy and full of flavor. LOVE LOVE LOVEEE that they make sausage slices with jalapenos in it for our spicy lovers.. Can never go wrong with that!

1.description: It's big and clean. They just fixed up the entrance and the outside. Usually good prices on the produce, veggies and meat.

9.description: I wish I could say I was as impressed as other Yelpers but...I was going to pay my water bill when I noticed Pete's was right next door. Since I think that Dominick's and (especially) Jewel suck, I figured I would check it out. Now this is not the fault of the establishment but the patrons were super rude. Lots of cutting my basket off and standing in front of me as if I weren't there. Just all around rudeness. What I did like was the large variety of fresh produce (not like the half dead produce at Jewel). There was also a large variety of Meat and Deli Products. I also enjoyed being able to get ethnic food like fresh, homemade guacamole (which I ate in it's entirety when I got home!). The prices were also pretty decent. I think what I hated the most was that I felt it was really hard to navigate. The aisles are super skinny making it difficult to not be in anyone's way and also to drive your little cart around corners. Also the aisles are like a claustrophobic's nightmare! Boxes, upon boxes! Cans upon cans! Piled high and tight. When you peek down the aisle to see what's on it, all you see is a blur. You can't make out anything. It was just too much for me.So, although, through no fault of Pete's, this slight claustrophobic, rude people hating chick will not be returning.

23.description: Best produce I've seen in the city - and geometrically arranged so perfectly! I've never seen apples align so harmoniously into interlocked rows. Great deli counter and meat selection. The only downsides are that the store does not carry many organic foods (if any?).

5.description: This was my second daily run at Pete's this week. You see, me and Pete (we are on a 1st name basis) go way back; back to when this used to be a Dominicks and Pete's hostel take over began.  We used to pick fruit and slaughter meat together. But that's all over now, he doesn't remember me anymore. I'm just some asian girl who will forever shop at his market and cry tears of joy for my fresh fruit, veggie's and meat galore. Oh Pete, where are thou?I come to Pete's at least twice a week. To pick up some quick meat, vegetables or fruit on my way home or when just need something. Everything is extremely fresh and clean. Ten's and thousands of fresh meat and all different cuts. I went to Jewel once in the suburbs and all they had was 3 pieces of steak. How disappointing! At Pete's, the whole back of the store is devoted to raw meat. Ahhh, meat......  The place is spacious and the majority population is hispanic. I'm the only asian there and I feel I practically live there. All-in-all, Pete's is the BEST!***Now only if he will accept me to be apart of his family...

25.description: The meat and produce selections here put the typical Jewel or Dominicks to shame in terms of variety, freshness, volume, and price, with an emphasis on Mexican items.  The store is as super-busy as you'd expect any popular, high-volume grocer to be, but the checkouts seem to move efficiently despite the long lines.  Pete's is a little bit too far outside my "home territory" for me to come here regularly, but it's highly recommended if you live or shop in or near the area.

12.description: Okay, some background.  In 2002 I was living in the neighborhood, I used to shop at the 57th & Kedzie store regularly.  The meat at that store was USDA grade STANDARD + COMMERCIAL - they had a small sign behind the counter that affirmed this, yet it was not on the package.  I complained, the manager basically told me tough shit.  A produce guy was pushing an overloaded cart of full boxes of tomatoes -- they FELL ON ME AND THEY WERE MORE CONCERNED WITH THE TOMATOES THAN THEY WERE WITH ME!!  Not even a "sorry: When the Jewel at 51st closed, then the Dominics at 47th closed, the owners of Pete's bought both locations, and kept them closed for 2 years, stifling any chance for competition, and contributing to neighborhood blight.  I did some investigation, and found that they had contributed tens of thousands of dollars to Ald. Burkes campaign chest.So, shop there if you like - I won't.

21.description: Pete's Fresh Market in Brighton Park is my primary grocery store. I'm in love with their wide variety of fresh vegetable selections. Granted, they do not offer every product available but their offerings are far from slim. On my last visit, they offered at least six different types of peaches, hot peppers, etc., and those are items that I just noticed while shopping.Staff make every effort to make everything look clean and presentable. I always see one staffer vacuuming, sweeping or straightening things like a bandit. I'm not quite sure how they do it, but the prices are often far more reasonable than any of the local chain grocery stores, especially the items listed in their weekly circular. I never spend more than $30 for a week's worth of groceries for myself unless I'm shopping for a large dinner party.Pete's also has fabulous deli, meat and seafood counters and even a little counter to buy fresh cut elotes topped with mayo, butter, parmesan cheese and cayenne pepper. Yum-o!

16.description: we like to shop around at several locations in the city when buying our weekly food supplies. Pete's is good for a couple of things. First off, they have awesome produce department. Fresh and cheap and plenty of it. (A+) Secondly, their deli counter is pretty good not great but pretty good. Like most places the good stuff cost more but still way cheaper the Jewel or Domanick's. (B) Last but not least their bakery department is the bomb....The cakes are cheap, cheap, cheap and unlike most mexican bakeries they taste fresh, sweet, moist and good. The bread is so fresh that it steams up the box its waiting for you in. The pastries are yum o'rama. (A+) So if your shopping in the "hood" this place is Clean, and Safe. However heavy on the Mexican =-( but good on the price =-)

17.description: It's all in the name "FRESH"  Pete's has the best fruit in the city!  Forget about Jewels, Dominick's, and Food4Less... Jewel and Dominick's are super pricey when it comes to fresh fruit and Food4Less has horrible quality!

10.description: The only grocery store in my area that cares about their customers. With a well stocked list of vegetables and fruits they really make eating healthy easy. PS: called Peapod once and was told that they don't deliver in my neighborhood. Thanks Pete's for providing much needed service and quality!

11.description: A smaller pete's with less selection. Not as impressive as the one on pulaski.

26.description: This has to be one of the best grocery stores in the city. The store is well stocked, very clean, and the fixtures are beautiful. The produce section is cavernous. People I've brought there are in disbelief the first time they see it!  The variety is fantastic, and the prices are really low. It's all good stuff ---not the waxy, tasteless stuff that you find in the major chains. The deli department is less expensive that the major chains, too. The meat department is also really great. The meat quality is excellent, and again, the prices can't be beat. The frozen/prepared section isn't that big, but since I cook from scratch, it doesn't matter that much to me. Pete's other store on Pulaski and 44th seems to have a bigger frozen section. I am usually stunned by how little I pay for my groceries at Pete's. I usually do my regular shopping here. For fresh, healthy food, this is a great place.

22.description: Okay, some background.  In 2002 I was living in the neighborhood, I used to shop at the 57th & Kedzie store regularly.  The meat at that store was USDA grade STANDARD + COMMERCIAL - they had a small sign behind the counter that affirmed this, yet it was not on the package.  I complained, the manager basically told me tough shit.  A produce guy was pushing an overloaded cart of full boxes of tomatoes -- they FELL ON ME AND THEY WERE MORE CONCERNED WITH THE TOMATOES THAN THEY WERE WITH ME!!  Not even a "sorry: When the Jewel at 51st closed, then the Dominics at 47th closed, the owners of Pete's bought both locations, and kept them closed for 2 years, stifling any chance for competition, and contributing to neighborhood blight.  I did some investigation, and found that they had contributed tens of thousands of dollars to Ald. Burkes campaign chest.So, shop there if you like - I won't.

0.description: So nice and clean as all Pete's that I've been to. Produce is super fresh and clean. Meats are fresh and plentyful.The whole store is well stocked and immaculately orginized. Really nice cheese dept. in this specific location.Service as usual, really nice fast and helpful.

20.description: I wish I could say I was as impressed as other Yelpers but...I was going to pay my water bill when I noticed Pete's was right next door. Since I think that Dominick's and (especially) Jewel suck, I figured I would check it out. Now this is not the fault of the establishment but the patrons were super rude. Lots of cutting my basket off and standing in front of me as if I weren't there. Just all around rudeness. What I did like was the large variety of fresh produce (not like the half dead produce at Jewel). There was also a large variety of Meat and Deli Products. I also enjoyed being able to get ethnic food like fresh, homemade guacamole (which I ate in it's entirety when I got home!). The prices were also pretty decent. I think what I hated the most was that I felt it was really hard to navigate. The aisles are super skinny making it difficult to not be in anyone's way and also to drive your little cart around corners. Also the aisles are like a claustrophobic's nightmare! Boxes, upon boxes! Cans upon cans! Piled high and tight. When you peek down the aisle to see what's on it, all you see is a blur. You can't make out anything. It was just too much for me.So, although, through no fault of Pete's, this slight claustrophobic, rude people hating chick will not be returning.

19.description: This is grocery store heaven if you like veggies, fruit and lunch meat. All three are ridiculously cheap and they have a great selection as well. They have a great selection of nuts, dried fruit and such - even cranberries. They also have portobello mushrooms for cheaper than Costco.I have a little panic attack - in the good way - every time I visit. I only wish it were close to a train.Seriously, this is the best grocery stores in the city.

2.description: I'm a snobby person and I admit it... I had a horrible experience at this place in May. I came in to grab a cake for my dad's birthday. Since he's always got a sweet tooth, we grabbed a cake from the shelf. There's no price label on the cake. There's also labels on the shelf AND THEY WERE OUTDATED! The cake was on the rack that was labeled to be $14.99 for 10 inches. I guess not everyone buys cakes while looking at the prices?We grabbed that one and when it rung up, the price was off. Fine. I needed the cake. I just paid. Then I went online to contact them and they apologized for the labels and the glory. They gave me a coupon for my next visit. Oh, before I even made it to the cake/ pastries section I was in the canned food aisle to look at spices. The guy who works there glared at me because my cart was in the way while I looked at the spices. He pushed it away and it nearly knocked me over.I prayed that I would knock some stuff down because he pushed my cart at me without saying excuse me or anything....

18.description: The sign welcoming you to Pete's might make you fear you will find a matching profile of Pete on the sex offenders list.  Despite the lack of a man with his looks showing up on Dateline, he surely DOES know his Cucumbers.Petes rocks.  I have never seen more affordable and beautiful produce.  The produce lasts FOREVER and costs less than any other place Ive shopped.Their Proteins, if you can stomach being around some more "ethinic" cuts, are super fresh and affordable as well.  The deli carries every variety of cold cuts I have ever imagined, and as an added bonus all varities of specialty hispanic cheeses sliced by the pound!We highly recommend the fresh salsas and guacamole as well.  There are only 2 drawbacks to Petes:  one: the center of the store is pretty lame.  most of the overpricing happens here, and the variety in brands is lackingtwo: do not walk in here and not expect to want to make salsa.  you will buy all the ingredients and eat the homemade salsa all day.  Let me know if you need a recipe

13.description: Overall the place has generally improved since they first opened.  The parking lot and store are modernly styled and immaculate (a welcome site in this neck of the woods).  The produce section is one of the best and more affordable in the neighborhood.  They opened an upscale cheese section and olive bar last year that are very good.  The sandwich meat section is vast but often filled with lesser quality meats.  I don't have a lot of confidence in the fresh meat and seafood sections.  Bakery is so-so.  General merchandise selction has improved (always well stocked though) from when they opened but still lacks all the brands or selection that are available at the big chain stores.  Tend to lean towards local specialties and we invariably have to go to the chains to pick up additional items.  Check out lines can be long at peak hours (and noisy) but are quick on off hours (as they are staffed well many times).  They've also improved their staffing but still have a ways to go (more employees speak English than when they've first started - it can be frustrating when asking where something is located and they admit they don't know what you're asking because they don't understand you).

4.description: Pete's Fresh Market is THE place to buy meat from. Their meat is fresh and doesn't have a lot of fat compared to other places I have bought from. They have a large variety of fruits and vegetables. I noticed they are very clean and organized which to me says a lot because I wouldn't buy food where the area is dirty.

24.description: The sign welcoming you to Pete's might make you fear you will find a matching profile of Pete on the sex offenders list.  Despite the lack of a man with his looks showing up on Dateline, he surely DOES know his Cucumbers.Petes rocks.  I have never seen more affordable and beautiful produce.  The produce lasts FOREVER and costs less than any other place Ive shopped.Their Proteins, if you can stomach being around some more "ethinic" cuts, are super fresh and affordable as well.  The deli carries every variety of cold cuts I have ever imagined, and as an added bonus all varities of specialty hispanic cheeses sliced by the pound!We highly recommend the fresh salsas and guacamole as well.  There are only 2 drawbacks to Petes:  one: the center of the store is pretty lame.  most of the overpricing happens here, and the variety in brands is lackingtwo: do not walk in here and not expect to want to make salsa.  you will buy all the ingredients and eat the homemade salsa all day.  Let me know if you need a recipe

6.description: Nice choice of groceries at competitive prices. In fact you'll find many types of fruits and vegetables you've probably never heard of here or at least find an unusual variety. It'd be nice if they'd open a location in the suburbs.

15.description: Pete's Fresh Market in Brighton Park is my primary grocery store. I'm in love with their wide variety of fresh vegetable selections. Granted, they do not offer every product available but their offerings are far from slim. On my last visit, they offered at least six different types of peaches, hot peppers, etc., and those are items that I just noticed while shopping.Staff make every effort to make everything look clean and presentable. I always see one staffer vacuuming, sweeping or straightening things like a bandit. I'm not quite sure how they do it, but the prices are often far more reasonable than any of the local chain grocery stores, especially the items listed in their weekly circular. I never spend more than $30 for a week's worth of groceries for myself unless I'm shopping for a large dinner party.Pete's also has fabulous deli, meat and seafood counters and even a little counter to buy fresh cut elotes topped with mayo, butter, parmesan cheese and cayenne pepper. Yum-o!

7.description: Talk about a little bit of light at the end of the tunnel!  Going to Jewel (whose produce smells funny and is not a good value) and/or Dominicks for produce are NOT fun.  I'm just never happy with what I walk away with.  Even Cermak Produce has a smaller selection than Pete's.  I always feel taken away someplace else when I walk into Pete's.  I get ideas for what to make for dinner just by standing in the store.  Picking up meats and other staple items is easy, as they have a comparable selection of domestic items as Jewel or Dominicks (at least on what I'm looking for).A wonderful, local alternative to the larger corporations!

8.description: Wow, I have to say all the Pete's Markets I've been to have been great.  This ones has such great produce and very fresh.  The prices are unbeatable, also.  I only wish I lived closer to one.  The northside and suburbs don't know what they are missing.

3.description: I have gone to many of the different locations and some have higher quality fresh fruits and veggies at same price as they all do. This location has one of the lowest quality grade in some fresh fruits and veggies. Yes they have lots of verieties in produce but this location has ugly past due fruit and veggies. The 95th location in Oak Lawn has the best quality everything. Is it because the they tend to have better stuff for the richer?? This location has beat up fresh fruit. Look at the pears, apples, peaches, tomatoes and avocados for starters. You will see what I mean. Then go to the Oak Lawn one and compare. Just something to think about.

14.description: Thank You Thank You Thank You for a CLEAN, CHEAP grocery store in my neighborhood once again... I can get all my favs to the more fancy hard to find Latin specialties. You can get deli norms, hot food to take home.. They have a HUGE meat and seafood selection as well as a HUGE fruit and veggie department. Great weekly sales and pleasant people make it all a huge success. They have opened several new locations and I have been to them all... its a gem and I suggest everyone try to get one if you like quality and value

1.description: I almost never wear make-up. Mainly because I'm pretty inept when it comes to putting it on but I'm a believer! Anjelica is amazing! She made me look beautiful in a subtle way. I was particularly wary of the fake eyelashes which is included with the bridal trial and day of make up, but I gotta tell you, it's worth it! It was like they weren't even there after a few minutes. Although after our ceremony I may have cried a corner of one off. Easily fixed with help from my maid of honor. If you're a crier or even have potential, I would recommend some extra glue in your bag just in case. The air-brush machine? Can I just say, if I could get that for my home use, I would just apply it all the time. Going to Mariano's? Airbrush! Going to walk the dog? Airbrush! All imperfections literally disappeared in a minute or less. Anjelica was wonderful about staying on schedule too! As someone who doesn't like to be late, I really appreciated that we were done when she said we would be. Oh last thing, whatever that spray is at the end...it basically shellacked the make-up to our faces. It's amazing. Like Anjelica.

0.description: I added Anjelica Bannos Artistry onto Yelp because I feel like I want to share her expertise with the world. When I started looking for make-up artists during Summer 2013, I knew that I wanted someone that would make me feel great and pulled together without making me feel caked with makeup and not myself.  I started to get frustrated because I was finding too many artists whose portfolios were not what I was looking for (80's make-up, yikes!) or they charged an arm & a leg (I really didn't want my bridesmaids to have to pay oodles of money).I found Anjelica's ad in Chicago Social and the picture was lovely. After looking through her website and some pictures of her work, I was very hopeful. After receiving a prompt, friendly, straightforward response from her, I was sold. So I used Anjelica for both my engagement pictures and for our wedding and seriously, SHE IS AWESOME. I was so pleased with the way my make-up looked on our wedding day and so were each of my bridesmaids. It was the perfect blend of glowing, but still done up. It looked fresh and natural but stayed on all night!  In addition, Anjelica is such a nice person and a calming influence, so she's was extra handy to have during the stress of getting wedding prepared.She really listens to the look that you are going for and interpreted it well for each of us. When I shared that the lashed from our engagement shoot felt a tad heavy on my eyes, she came up with the perfect alternate plan for  the wedding day.  Both times she did my make up, she extremely prompt, set up quickly and worked efficiently. Anjelica is a true pro!I am now working to convince my husband that I need her to do my makeup for other things... so, obviously, I recommend her services for anyone looking for a make up artist that will make you look fresh, glam, and glowing.  Yay, Anjelica!

1.description: I've been coming here for about 3 months now and have no complaints.  Fades run $12.  They do other things like blow-outs, eyebrows,etc. They have 4 LCD TVs that are always on Sportscenter.

0.description: I been coming here since when they were on 47th and Archer. I use to travel 12 miles just to get a haircut!!! Not anymore but this place was the place that started it off. Much love.

3.description: So, my friend Sarah Jayne (below) always has this habit of beating me to the punch and being the "first to review" stuff. Darn her!!! Dirty, dirty .....(beautiful...dirty dirty rich) But....I digress! The only reason the Dolls went to Zemsky's was to pick up coveralls for our upcoming shopping cart race / costume event. -But, it's actually a pretty cool store. Very "Discovery-esque." I got a really cute South Pole T-shirt (which is like the knock off of Baby Phat) with the city skyline on it for $17.98. I also picked up a really chic pair of Isotoner winter boots for $44. My friends were so happy with this purchase, as they were embarrassed by my dirty white 1980's moon boots I had been wearing all day. So I ditched the MTV Moon-man look and rocked my new fashionable boots...oh yeah! This place is worth checking out if you need to get any work clothes or uniforms and are in the mood for a little fashion too!

1.description: They messed up my mail order beyond belief and were completely unapologetic about it.

2.description: This place will bring you back in time as far as what types of items they carry.  They still have house coats and aprons as well as rainhats!  They also have the largest supply of school uniforms!  They always have the uniforms for my son as well as the work gear for my husband.  Let's not forget the prices!  You cannot beat this place!  I love this store and will continue to shop there for as long as they are open.

0.description: Sweatpants with elastic bands under $15, Checksneakers under $20. CheckI am cheap, CheckMy requirements were met.  Nice and helpful people as well.

4.description: This is a really interesting store on the south siiide. The PussyCart Dolls went there today primarily to buy overalls for our upcoming Chiditarod race. Funny thing is, not only can you buy all kinds of work wear there (nurses, mechanics etc take note) but they also have some other interesting stuff and it's CHEAP!! I ended up buying my Dickies overalls for $29 and then a great coat that is going to be super warm and super stylin' since we all know Chicago isn't done with winter just yet!! The coat was reduced to $35 from $80 - STEAL!! Also picked up some cute gloves and a scarf for under $5. We didn't really have time to browse but this place definately had some interesting finds!!

0.description: I haven't had any encounters of rudeness or ignorance here lately. Everyone has been super nice! I think that has a lot to do with the fact that the same people that used to work there no longer do. At least it seems like it.  It looks like a whole new staff. The security guy at night is so sweet. The only thing that sucks is that it is only open till ten. Other than that, i feel welcome here, and recommend this location. So far, so good i gess
